Reviews.Title: “No heat”
Reviews.Author: Judgeskj
Reviews.Content: I am happy that I stayed in this room alone, because the room (including the tiny bathroom) was too small for even two persons. The heating system did not operate in the room during my stay. I finally was provided a space heater after complaining to the front desk. The "sleep number" king bed was not comfortable, no matter what number I picked. This room was a bit pricey for what was offered. Positive aspects: free access to the business center, helpful staff downstairs and the location of the hotel to the subway trains.

Reviews.Title: “First Class...All The Way!”
Reviews.Author: Susan B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Radisson Lexington Hotel, and all I can say is the hotel is first class all the way!!! Our stay was enjoyable from start to finish. We were upgraded to a King Executive room and not only was it very clean, but sooo spacious. The customer service is top notch, too. We've stayed here many times before, and not only is the location great, but the hotel staff goes out of their way to help you with all of your needs. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is considering planning a trip to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MagsBurno
Reviews.Content: My third stay at the Radisson Lexington. The rooms are a little bit older in appearance, however they are clean and do have the sleep number beds. I arrived late at night and was given a room pretty promptly. Though I'd booked a petite room, I ended up with two double beds and two bathrooms, which would have been nice had I not been on my own for business. The location is great - a quick walk from Grand Central and close to major attractions and transportation. The staff was friendly. One negative - charged me $2 to store my suitcase after check out until my flight later in the day. I normally tip for this, but I found the mandatory charge pretty cheesy. Guess that's New York for you. For a clean, basic hotel with a great location, I would recommend the Radisson Lexington.

Reviews.Title: “Great Housekeeping Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bruce B
Reviews.Content: Apart from a great location, this hotel has a great housekeeping staff! I forgot my wallet in my room at checkout and discovered it only while at the airport. A quick call to Cynthia and it was recovered, and further, Doris and Cynthia gathered my details to send it to me FEDEX overnight. All cards, cash, and items were perfectly in tact. I am very grateful to these honest and dedicated employees who really went the extra mile to return my belongings! Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: paulandalisonlewis
Reviews.Content: Spent the last part of our honeymoon here and can recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York just a 5 minute walk from Broadway and the hotel itself is clean and the staff were really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: PamB279
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Radisson on luxington, we got a package deal thru price line. We would recommend the Radisson, great location!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, terrible room”
Reviews.Author: stephany3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 different hotels while in New York, and had a wonderful stay at our first cheaper hotel, but had high hopes for this second hotel, the Radisson, based on its reputation. I travel all the time and have never written one of the reviews before because I've never been so disappointed before. The lobby and front desk area were huge and impressive. But our room was anything but. We had a tiny and very uncomfortable bed with an old saggy mattress. The paint was peeling from the walls. The sink and tub were dirty and stained. We paid $14 for 24 hours use of wi-fi and it worked only sporadically and slowly, despite multiple calls to the front desk and to their internet technical support line. One funny thing happened while on the elevator when a customer asked her friend how her room was; she answered by saying that her room is great now that she'd been moved off the 7th floor. She then said "Avoid the 7th floor", right before the elevator stopped for us on the 7th floor, and we all laughed. Perhaps the rooms on the other floors are nicer and have been recently renovated. Perhaps knowing that we are priceline customers, we get the "cheap room" - which angers me because if they agree to rent a room for that price then the service should be the same regardless of booking method. In any case, it was awful and we certainly won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “overbooked, 1 bed instead of 2 and no wake-up call”
Reviews.Author: Danni D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in August 2011 and overall it was very disappointing. We arrived at the hotel after a long flight around 8 pm, only to be told that the hotel was overbooked and we would have to wait for them to organize us a room. Strange, because we had clearly stated in the reservation that we would arrive in the evening. After almost an hour of waiting we were finally given a room. Not only a room but a suite. Nice at first glance, but sadly it had only one queen-sized bed and we had booked twin beds. The receptionist even tried to argue with us about that, at least until I showed her our booking confirmation and she conceded that yes, we had in fact booked twin beds. Never argue with your guests, that's tourist industry rule No. 1. This wouldn't have been that much of a problem if I had travelled with a close relative but I don't usually make a habit of sharing beds with acquaintances. We would have gone to a different hotel after that but it was already 9 pm and we were really tired after a long day of traveling, so we stayed. Bad decision. The next morning we had to leave at 6 am and asked for a wake-up call - which we didn't get. Aren't these usually done automatically instead of in person by now? Luckily I suffered from jet lag and woke up shortly before 6 so we barely managed to catch our bus. The only positive thing I can say about this hotel is the location. Yes, the staff was polite and apologized in the morning, but that really didn't help when they were overbooked, we had to share a bed and almost missed our bus because of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lulu_0567
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, subway very handy. Staff helpful. Room and bathroom good size. Only issue we had was the cost of breakfast in the dinner. Be warned, very expensive, didn't make the same mistake twice! Luckily there is a Starbucks in the hotel also which was great. Would stay here again but elsewhere for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: Paulnairobi
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to New York and I was concerned that a hotel at the heart of Manhattan would be noisy and expensive and small. But this hotel is quiet and resonably priced-although prices vary with the day of the week. It has a restaurant with quick and efficient workers (although they do not own the restaurant). And its a walking distance to almost anywhere in Central Manhattan. You need to be on the top floor to have a good view of the city (18 upwards), but the higher ones are no easy to get. Be sure to use nice language and you may just be offered complimentary breakfast and drinks for your entire stay! Good place, with late check out (2pm extension)

Reviews.Title: “Ir is ok”
Reviews.Author: Chechus_2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is golf located, the staff friendly I forgot a couple of things and they returned them. The 2 biggest inconvinients were the size of the room, really small we did not have enough place for our stuff and the cleanliness specifically the windows, you could not literally see anything! In the lobby you have free access to internet, it was ok, specially if you only need a room to sleep only.

Reviews.Title: “Did not enjoy our stay here at all”
Reviews.Author: Trevor G
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for four nights including New Years. On check in we got upgrade to a bigger suite, which was nice. My partner has one of the loyality cards and we stay in Radisson alot. However this was really a terrible experenice. First we woke up the next day (after new year's eve) and I got out of the shower to realise there was not towels. Rang to reception and an hour later towels arrived. We then started noticing these red makes on our bodies. Which we though were bed bugs. We went and spoke to the manager and he said he would send someone up to have a look. The bites were extremely iticky and we had to by creams to stop them. Some of the bites were on our face, so our New York Pictures don't look so great. We went out for the day and got back to the hotel and the manager said it was a mosquito (In January) and that it flew out the window when the guy was looking at the room. The manager never offer to pay for the creams we had to buy from staying in there hotel or comp us one thing, they just simply did not care. The next morning we went down to reception to book a table for dinner. I qued for 30 mins and spoke to a lady who told me that it was the other girl that could work the table booking system, I waited for another 20 minutes (as files of people passed me) and I just walked away. WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities!”
Reviews.Author: Arnaud21
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in an area that I have never spent one night before, but I do not regret it. There are plenty of dining and shopping around and it is within walking distance to Times Sq. and to Bloomingdale's. Rooms are clean and comfortable. I had a suite and it was a reasonable size by NY standards. The bathroom is tiny. On Saturday, they had a street market on Lexington Ave. and it was an experience and a lot of fun. I was told this is done often on Saturdays so you are in the right spot! The bar at the lobby is nice, modern and kind of trendy. People watching at the lobby is an interesting pastime... Very busy and never boring! There is a Starbucks right on the Lexington Ave. entrance, so you can't go wrong. I would definitively come back if the chance comes up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jopin55
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price. It is not a budget hotel but unless you go to the Ritz you are not going to get much more than that. The room is great , the location on Lexington and 48th street is very central without being on Broadway with all the tourists and the bustle. They have a paying internet, they definitely should give that for free. I think all hotels should include a small charge in their rate and give that as part of the room, just like you don't expect to pay for having a TV in your room. Don't expect the staff to recognize you, this is a semi large hotel. But everyone is professional.

Reviews.Title: “Short Trip to NY”
Reviews.Author: SPBrentwood
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Radisson. Arriving on Friday night we found ourselves on the third floor which was very noisy. The hotel agreed to move us the next day and we ended up on the twenty sixth floor which was much quieter! The staff were helpful. We had breakfast in the hotel twice. One breakfast was great but the breakfast in Raffles was really disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,good location”
Reviews.Author: Jacntony
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of feb for a week,check in was prompt and even better we got a smoking room,as we were on the 5th floor you could hear traffic noise,very warm rooms no way of turning the heater off under the window and we turned air con on which made little effect,thank god the window opened!!!!! Deli across the road for breakfast and only a 10min walk to times square and a lot of other places so good base location for us. Only downfall we found was how expensive restaurants were for your evening meal especially when the same chain in say Orlando is by far cheaper than the same restaurant in new York and then when you have to add the tip on its even more expensive,definitely ripping the customer off in that respect,even well known pharmacy stores etc have increased prices to other areas in America and this made the trip dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Beyond_all_Borders
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for a conference. Check-in was fast and we received our Club Carlson complementary upgrade to a Junior Suite and a welcome treat. The room was rather large for NYC, noticing it was actually two rooms remodeled to be one. We enjoyed the two bathrooms, free wifi, robes, and slippers. The view was good and the mattress although it wasn't a sleep number was still comfortable. We had a nice dinner at Mamajuana Cafe downstairs on the ground floor. The service was excellent and the menu and atmosphere would remind you of diner. Some things I was surprised about: 1. Our down comforter was missing a duvet, I was a little uncomfortable about that. 2. No coffee machine in our room to go along with the microwave and fridge. I suppose they wanted us to go down and support Fivebucks, I mean Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and hotel”
Reviews.Author: nestor a
Reviews.Content: I come every year. The hotel is excellent, perfectly situated and the staff is great. Also very nice restaurants in the hotel and nearby

Reviews.Title: “an uninvited guest”
Reviews.Author: tweeter826919
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2/4/12. The hotel itself looks nice from the outside rooms are decent size, slightly updated was nice to have two bathrooms. While getting ready to go out my friend had a roach crawl across her foot. We called the front desk and had they sent security up. Im not sure why security would deal with that, pretty sure that little roach couldnt fit it cuffs lol When security came up he seemed annoyed and bothered and asked us what we wanted him to do. We know that bugs are everywhere but its a bit unnerving to find a roach in your room, especially when it crawls across your foot and the carpet is black so its very difficult to see if they are anymore. We were allowed to switch rooms (our request) and upon checkout we were given comp. parking but even then we were treated like its no big deal. I just feel the whole situation could have been handled better. Also we ordered room service we tried to get a bottle of champagne and were informed they only had one kind available (there were at least four on the menu) we ended up getting 3 martinis which came with ice in a glass that you are given in your bathroom. We didn't even drink them, they tasted so bad. That being said the bell hop was extremely nice and funny. I wouldn't say the experience was horrible but it was less than enjoyable and I will not likely return.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: CobusP
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review mainly to inform others that the rooms are not made for more than 1 person. I've stayed there twice. 1st in a Petite room which is rediculously small and then tried a standard room on my second stay. The standard room is exactly the same size with a bigger bed. Nothing wrong with the hotel and fully worth the $80 per night I paid (this was a special), I'm just glad I wasn't joined by my wife. There really isn't space for more than 1 person in these rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 1981clyde
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was excellent and the room was clean tidy and everything we needed just for a place to rest at night as we made the most of the city by day. Would use Radisson Hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: CroozerCanada
Reviews.Content: Phenomenal location only a few blocks from Times Square, 5th Avenue shopping, Central Park and so many other attractions. Subway is close by to go downtown. Service was good and staff were friendly. The room was small (for two people), but clean and the decor was nice, including a nice large flat screen TV. Only problem we had was that someone in one of the adjacent rooms was smoking (even though it was a non-smoking floor) and it traveled through the vents into our bathroom which was kind of gross - tried to report it to front desk, but their service line was busy and we were heading out anyways so couldn't wait around. When we reported it later on, they told us to advise them if we smelled it again and they would investigate. At any rate, other than one inconsiderate smoker, we would definitely stay at the Radisson again.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, disgusting dive”
Reviews.Author: Mandy S
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The carpets in the public areas and on the floors were filthy and stained and the cream stripes on it have now gone brown. Found a dirty handtowel in my room with make up on it. Room hadn't been vacuumed. Bathroom ceiling was a piece of pulled straight plastic that had been painted beige. The bed had uncomfortable springs poking through it. Absolutely awful place. Pity as it was my first stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Got a great rate, good location, nice sized rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: swisstourist
Reviews.Content: Got a awesome rate here - $99 a night for a Radisson in NYC. Good location - about 4 blocks from Grand Central Station, about 5 blocks from Rockefeller Center. Away from the chaos and noise of Times Square but close enough to walk to sites and subway stops. Room was a good size, especially for NYC, desk, flat screen, 2 drawer dresser, closet with safe and our room had 2 twin beds. Both room and bathroom were clean. Negative is the windows are definitely not soundproof, had asked for a high floor and unfortunately didn't get one - was told it wasn't available but could ask again the next night. We heard all the noise -trash trucks, sounds outside, etc..honking, sirens. Other then not having soundproof windows, I would recommend staying here - nice place and nice location

Reviews.Title: “Best front desk and location”
Reviews.Author: Gleb V
Reviews.Content: Accommodated for 2 nights. Best location in central but not noisey place of Manhattan. Thanks for pleasant front desk and duty manager, Irina Borukhov a special mercy! Fast and clever responding on any request. My suggestion is to increase internet access speed.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: 128Mary
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. The front desk and staff were friendly and excellent. Upgraded us twice without our asking. The location is wonderful and the price was great. it's not fancy, but I would stay here again in a minute/

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: andymwood
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the best thing about the hotel is the location. A short walk from Grand Central Station so if you're in and around that bit of town, this hotel is well placed. We stayed for 4-nights. This'll be the third time we've been to NYC and we've stayed in a range of hotels. Granted, a hotel in NYC is more often a place to sleep rather than a location in itself. We were up on the 19th floor round the back and tho' the view wasn't great it was very quiet during the night and not too busy in the hallway. The room had a pleasant decor, but the bathroom was bordering on grim: cleaned yes but the ceiling had peeling paint which made the room feel scruffy. Maybe its a european thing - but I like to have have tea/coffee in the room. I also think wi-fi in the room shouldn't be a big deal nowadays: still a wires connection at extortionate rates although you can go down to the lobby to access a free service. There is a Starbucks in the lobby as well as two restaurants (Chinese/Italian). I don't like Starbucks and we didn't like the look of either restaurant so we went across the street - there's a wide range of alternatives if you feel the same. We had a couple of problems with the lights in the room - the staff were great and it was fixed straight away. The gym has plenty of options. This Radisson is decent value for money, perhaps if I'd seen 3 rather than 4 stars I'd have been better prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service, room quality, Lexington Ave rooms noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Jay H
Reviews.Content: Feb 1-3 2012 stay. Reception excellent. Staff most agreeable and helpful. 4th Floor king double room clean and comfortable. But facing on Lexington Ave very noisy day and night. Also loud, foul mouthed argument next room until 2 am. Reception agreed immediately to move us to 11th Floor but also on Lexington, still heavy trucks etc. all night. So conclusion is good hotel but demand room back of hotel, high floor. .

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: linners13
Reviews.Content: This hotel room was extremely basic but comfortable. The staff were helpful and friendly and the location was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise?”
Reviews.Author: SHOPGIRL1357
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson on Lexington for 3-nights this past weekend and had a great time. I have been coming to NYC for many years, and have stayed in a lot of hotels. This time I was fortunate enough to meet the Director of the Front Office, Kerman Lalkaka. Mr. Lalkaka went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. The hotel itself is older but well maintained the staff is friendly the rooms are clean. I especially like the steam heat in the bathroom and the window that opened. The towels stayed warm and toasty on top of the heater. There is a Starbucks in the lobby as well as two restaurants. Our room included breakfast in the morning. We were in and out in less than 45-minutes and because everything is in the hotel it made for a pleasant way to start our day. The location is perfect right up the street from Grand Central and a short walk to Rockefeller Center. We hardly used the cab or subway because everything is so close. If you do need a cab the doorman are more than happy to help you. The other reason I like this hotel is the value I would rather spend my money shopping, eating, spa treatments, cocktails at the St. Regis and seeing shows. I don't come to NYC to sleep I just need the basics and this hotel has that plus so much more. I can't wait to plan our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Clean and Comfy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brockersjules
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at the Radisson Lexington and again we have enjoyed our stay, with welcoming staff and clean and comfy rooms with plenty of room to relax, after a days exploring or shopping. Starbucks within the hotel is a bonus and the Deli across the road is worth a visit for breakfast or even a pizza. The Radisson Lexington is in a great location for exploring New York and all it's attractions and also close enough to shop till you drop for Bloomingdales and Macy's and all designer shops or bargain shops and plenty of places to stop off for a bite to eat, though we did find New York expensive this time to eat out. All travellers must get the discount travellers card from the Visitors Centres within Macy's and Bloomingdales.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: kathyDryden_Ny
Reviews.Content: Bathroom was very small, but clean. No coffee-maker in room. Sleep Number bed was very comfortable and plenty of pillows provided. Reading lights on both sides of bed. Good location for walking and easy access to subway.

Reviews.Title: “ny 2011”
Reviews.Author: nataleew08
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful, clean and modern. Rooms were basic but very clean, all staff were so helpful i couldnt of asked for anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: john h
Reviews.Content: the hotel entrance is dirty and unwelcoming. The hotel room was small with no hanging space but quite clean. The public areas had dirty carpets. The staff, almost without exception, were helpful and friendly. The breakfast room was staffed by friendly Polish staff but with limited English. The breakfast menu was dire.... everything was served with a barely warm mess of fried potatoes and peas. Most was left. Though a 4 star it was barely that maybe the upper rooms was better. We are frequent visitors to NY and would not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Good Price”
Reviews.Author: CGC-WashPA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night in Jan. 2012. The location is great for access to several areas. It is within 5-10 minutes walking distance or short taxi ride to the UN, midtown business district, Grand Central Station, Times Square, Broadway, Rockerfeller Centre. Our small room was good for the online price of less than $100, which is very low in Manhattan for a name brand hotel like Raddisson. Standard rooms were also available fot less than $120. 24 hour parking across the street is $41 with in and out privileges or $20 if purchased thru the hotel. This is a fantastic deal for parking, but is without in and out privileges and you must be out by 12:00 noon. The staff and on duty manager were veryhelpful when I need assistance. I will recommend the Radisson Lexington to friends and business associates.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Hotel, Lexington Ave Winter Escape.”
Reviews.Author: BeachPatLLC
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Radisson in January at a great price. We had a king size bed, nice linens, a desk and a great view of the Chrysler Bldg. Bathroom was small but ok. Location is good for getting around NYC. We're going again in Feb. and March.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel, mixed service - need to learn from Radisson elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: hw-in-bermuda
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early January 2012 and the first thing we noticed is that no one offered to help with bags. It has a small, busy reception, and the words "part-organised chaos" seem apt. We had a Junior Suite which was tired but comfortable. The bathroom is the oldest I have had in a hotel for years (I travel a lot and had a total of about 50 overnights in 2011). The sleep number bed was great, BUT, we had to set it each evening???? The internet was abysmal, even though we paid for the upgraded package. The front desk removed it from the bill immediately. There is no overnight room service, and no tea or coffee making facilities in room. The overnight staff invites you to go outside, cross Lexington and use an all-night deli. There is a "greeter" in reception, with a very gruff tone; we were awaiting a friend and were amused by people seemingly shaken by his "good mornings", it was an added layer of odd. I am diabetic, and my glucose readings strongly indicate that I received Coke rather than the requested Diet Coke.... Room heating was intermittent. We put our bags near the bell captain whilst waiting to leave, at the bell captains suggestion, and I heard him forbid a colleague from carrying them to the car we'd arranged??? This was a three night stay, following two short stays at the Radisson, New Providence Wharf, London, which will get a 5 on all levels!!! Location gives this a three rather than a two.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: aathacr
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excelent, it's slightly away from the chaos but easy walk to The Rockerfella Centre, Fifth Ave, Central Park, Times Square etc.... As with all New York hotels the rooms are expensive for what you get but we found the staff very friendly and the room to be clean. It's a little ran down eg / tape round the window frames, scrffy bathroom paintwork but it's comfy to sleep in and clean for a reasonable price. A little dissapointed there's no kettle in the room but there's a Starbucks joined to the hotel with an internal door. Overall I would recommend the hotel though

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience!”
Reviews.Author: Ouajdi1
Reviews.Content: We went to the Raddisson Lexington over New Year Eve. First at all it is not a Radisson. I think the are franchised or something. When we got there we couldn`t check in because the rooms were not cleaned. That was on 4.30 pm! So we waited 1 Hour. Nobody felt responsibile for it. The rooms are very,very small. Even for New York too small I guess. The breakfast was okey. We wanted to ask a concierge for a reservation, but she was very unfriendly. we know that the people in NY in the service are quiet unfriendly, but we are Guests in our hotel! and Guest is King! We will never go back there for sure! And people do go there! You will be dissapointed for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Just good enough for a 3 day solo trip”
Reviews.Author: fmaspavan
Reviews.Content: Hotels in NY have become so expensive that is very difficult to rate them. The Radisson hotel on Lexington is an average hotel, but still a $350 a night hotel. The room I had was very small, even for one person, but there are bigger ones, that's just the one I chose. Bathroom was.....not very nice. It has no restaurant, I had breakfast somewhere else, It has a sushi bar in the premises, I did not try it. I have no good or bad comments regarding the staff since I didn't spend much time in the hotel. I was looking for a $300 a night hotel and I decided to try this one, next time, I'll try something else.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to sleep and nice location!”
Reviews.Author: smcfamily
Reviews.Content: We checked in and were greeted by the hotel staff. Everybody was super nice! I booked my hotel through Priceline and then found it cheaper at the hotel's site. Priceline refunded the difference and gave us $50 for a future vacation. When I checked in I asked if they had any King beds and she said they were sold out, but could give us a queen. We said a queen would be great and then she said it wasn't ready. So, we left our bags with the doorman and explored the city until about 2am. When we got back we went to the check in desk and she gave us our room. The view was of air conditioner units, but we didn't care we just wanted sleep and that's what we got on our queen sleep number bed. Yes, I said sleep number. They upgraded us up to a queen sleep number at no extra charge. The room was at the end of the hall, on the small side and on the 4th floor. We didn't hear anything until we woke up at 10:30am to start our day. We had another full day and came back to our room. Here is why I only gave it a 4 instead of a 5 review. They didn't make up our bed or give us fresh towels. I am sure if we had called down they would have sent us fresh towels, but we were way to tired for that. We just went to bed. It is a great hotel and close to Grand Central. We walked to Times Square or took the Subway to wherever we needed to get to. I would recommend this hotel and might even go back there next time I visit!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as expected!”
Reviews.Author: montz_10
Reviews.Content: We booked our break to New York in March 2010, my husband and I were very excited until we checked the most recent reviews of the Hotel Radisson Lexington. When we arrived we were given an ample room although the bathroom could have benefitted from a refit. The staff were very friendly and not pushy or wanting tipped all the time!! Starbucks was in the foyer which was a major plus. The hotel also had a good gym which my husband used everyday. Staff were very helpful at the guest services and booked our transport back to the airport and also very knowledge. Radisson Lexington is in a great central position.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: tohhall
Reviews.Content: I was anticipating a nightmare based on travelers' pictures and reviews. I wouldn't have picked it but it was an event arranged by work so I had no choice. We had a deluxe king (corner room) with huge windows on a top floor. Not sure if the room was renovated or not (it still look slightly outdated) but it was clean and bright. There was some kind of mark/(maybe paint or make-up) stain on the wallpaper in the bathroom but otherwise the room was clean with good hot water pressure. No coffeemaker-which bothered me as I need coffee ASAP in the a.m. There's a Starbucks on Lex with a entrance in the hotel though. Breakfast was included and the staff at the Raffles restaurant was friendly, fast and efficient. The front desk and bell captain were friendly and we had no complaints. Great location; we walked to theatre, dinner, everywhere. And while we didn't pay-the $159 price would have been worth it (although I expect that was a discount for a huge group).

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back...”
Reviews.Author: gerandcol
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel several years ago, it has definitely benefitted from a lick of paint. Ideally located Midtown, this hotel offers the visitor a pleasant resting place at a reasonable price & comfort level, without too much fuss - this would be suitable for both tourist & businessman. I found each member of staff that I dealt with to be hospitable, approachable & helpful, however as we were only staying 2 nights, our requirements were minimal & probably not too demanding! On the negative side, I thought the prices for drinks & food were pitched slightly on the high side, e.g. $5 for a mini packet of cereal was rather a shock! Perhaps that's why their restaurant appeared to remain empty during our stay...

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: termnalvee
Reviews.Content: Got this place as part of a last minute deal on aa.com. It is old and it shows. Room smelled funky, bed smelled like the last person who slept there hadn't showered and the linen wasn't changed. Could not control the heat so had to open the window to counteract the Mercury-like temperature in the room. Overall not a great experience. Convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a nice hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: IssyStHelens
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip and this hotel was the perfect location at a reasonable price, there are better ones very close by that if I was with Family I would have chosen instead. The staff were excellent and speeded my check in as I had had a nine hour delay, they even gave me a voucher for a free drink in the bar!!! I ordered a car and driver for one day and this was absolutely brilliant and well organised. The door men were all very friendly and attentive. Room service was brilliant, although not too much choice, and the starbucks downstairs was fabulous - you could go in your pj's in the morning and not get a second glance. Breakfast in the hotel cafe was OK - but nothing to write home about

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Miniature Room, with Mosquitoes!”
Reviews.Author: bearsticky
Reviews.Content: Dont stay here if u dont want to be a feast for mosquitoes! My 14yr old daughter was terrified after all the disease she knows that mossies carried, and she could hardly sleep. Also, u can hear either the police, fire engine and ambulance siren passing by every 2hrs or so! There were homeless folks outside the hotel asking for money as well. For USD200 per nite, honestly, there are dozens better hotel to stay in. We didn't hv a choice coz we were cheated by Priceline.com & made a bid on the website for what they claimed u will receive 50% discount or more but in actual fact, we paid more for the room than what we cld hv paid if we book directly with the Hotel! Be smarter!

Reviews.Title: “Good Time”
Reviews.Author: LucianaMCS
Reviews.Content: El hotel esta muy bien ubicado. Cerca de la 7ma avenida y del Times Square. El desayuno es muy rico y muy buena la atencion.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: joeyboy79
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, bathrooms are very outdated. Maid was still cleaning the room when I was checkin. Only stay if you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location , great value :)”
Reviews.Author: claireandtex
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the raddison Lexington after arriving on 1st January 2012 and leaving today . Conceirge , front desk and staff were friendly and helpful we were given hotel room no 1502 which had 2 of everything , the room was awesome me and my mom felt like queens of sheba, the bathroom were slightly dated but had no effect on comfort or usability they were lovely , toiletries and towels were changed Daily also overall a good hotel and 2 very happy customers :)

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: mapgal78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night whilst visiting NYC - glad I wasn't staying any more as my room certainly could have done with a clean, and being refurbished. The entrance hall gave the hotel a great impression. But the hallway to my room were dark - maybe as I was solo traveller they put me right at the end of the corridor! I had the impression that Radisson hotels were of a high standard??? I certainly will think carefully about them in the future after this one.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable but needs updating, great staff”
Reviews.Author: kitty55
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in December with teen, and a friend joined us for one night. First 2 nights had a "standard" room (comp), second 2 reserved "junior suite". Was able to get the junior suite on check-in but only smoking floor available. My daughter wanted to try it so we did, staff offered to swap to non-smoking room the next day but the same room type was not available, so we just stayed put. Hall smelled awful, but room not too bad. Asked for extra "febreeze" treatment which helped. For some reason we didn't get maid service after the 2nd night, and had to call to get clean towels delivered. Complimentary wifi with Club Carlson membership. The junior suite was basically two tiny rooms with an open connecting door (in fact there were two entry doors into hall). Room 1 had bathroom, closet, twin sofa sleeper, desk, TV, mini fridge, climate control. Room 2 had bathroom (identical) queen bed, closet, tiny dresser, TV, climate control. On 5th floor facing 48th St. but traffic noise wasn't bad -- problem was BOOM BOOM from nightclub a couple of nights. We turned up A/C for white noise which worked. Queen bed was comfortable with nice linens, sofa not so much. Bathrooms tiny but fairly modern. Even though very clean, room had an "icky" feel. Carpet was wavy, shades sort of stained, woodwork looked like it had 50 coats of paint, electrical outlets loose, and closets were the worst but adequate to hang up your clothes I guess. As others have stated it's in a great midtown location and any basics you need are within a block. All the staff we encountered were polite and helpful. I'd stay here again if the price was right and with a little updating/deep cleaning I would easily upgrade my rating to very good. I didn't take pictures of the room at first but have included a couple of the bedroom and bath that weren't too messy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Bobbie007
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great for walking to Times Square, St Patrickâ€™s and the nearby area, including going shopping at Bloomingdales. The walk to Bloomingdales or the theaters on Broadway was 5-7 minutes depending on how quickly you walk. There are also many stores nearby the hotel in case you want to shop a little closer to the hotel. The area has a lot of hotels so it is busy but not so crowded that it â€œjam-packedâ€�. The hotel was nicely decorated for the Holidays. However there are areas that could use some updating. For example, the carpet in some areas was worn. The room itself was very nice with excellent views. My room was larger than average so I felt as though I had a lot of space. Even though I was on a high floor I could still hear street noise. The bed was comfortable. The bathrooms are very small. There is barely enough room for one person and almost NO counter space. There are ice machines on some but not all floors. There was supposed a beverage machine in the hotel but I could not find it. Itâ€™s better to buy drinks and snacks at a nearby stores. I ordered from room service. The food tasted good but some items were pricy even by NYC standards. There are a number of places to eat nearby so you could opt to try one of them instead of trying in house dining. The staff at the hotel was very pleasant and helpful. There were very willing to try to accommodate you as much as possible. I would stay there again if the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel but don't expect Radisson standards”
Reviews.Author: panditjee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights during Christmas. I must say that a I had little higher expectation from this hotel based on the fact that it is part of the Radisson chain. However, after getting our room I realized, this hotel does not live up to the Radisson standards by a stretch. The room was quite small and the beds were the smallest I have seen in any hotel I have stayed in in the USA. I immediately asked if we could change the room for one queen or king size bed. The staff was polite, but mentioned that any upgrade would cost an additional $50/night. After negotiating with the manager I brought the price down to $40/night for the upgrade. The new room was a bit bigger and had a king size bed with sleep number mattress. If I did not have to pay the extra, I would be quite satisfied with the room, though nothing about this hotel is shiny or new. On the contrary, the bathroom definitely seemed to be in need of upgrade. Having said all that, this hotel has a great location. It is within walking distance from Times Square, Rockefeller Center and within three blocks from the Grand Central station. Another major plus is having Starbucks inside the hotel. There is also a 24 hrs pharmacy within one block and liquor store across the street. Also, there are places to eat within walking distance in every direction. So if you are not paying a ransom ($150 or above/night before taxes), then this hotel is a good choice, But do not go in expecting to be wowed by anything except its location.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline and Radisson Lex....Bad News”
Reviews.Author: Frank P
Reviews.Content: SAD___Double twin room was more akin to a youth hostel room...certainly not a 3 star. Went for an upgrade but of course got screwed. Wanted to upgrade with son traveling with us at last minute. No luck since it was a Priceline booking deal. THIS IS THE DEFAULT HOTEL FOR YOUR "NAME YOUR OWN PRICE" HOTEL. Its not even worth the price I paid. No additional roll away bed left tonight, plus the room was so small that "it would be a fire hazard". Pathetic day. Thermostat doesnt work. Room is cold. Am sleeping in the lobby tonight. Manager willing to give me another room at a far higher price...but not a gratis change....BS. I travel a lot on biz. Trip was with my wife....NEVER AGAIN. 1 star is generous only because of location...otherwise 0.0. Will never use Priceline or Radisson again. (and I happen to be a Carlson Travel member) ___SAD

Reviews.Title: “Very inept”
Reviews.Author: Cryptozoan
Reviews.Content: I am not one to write negative reviews, or reviews of any kind for that matter, but this hotel deserves a negative comment. For starters there was no cover on the bed and the bathroom sink was almost completely plugged. Got a deal on the room so that's no reason to gripe. Then however the staff gave the room we were occupying to someone else at 4 in the morning and this person was only prevented from walking into our room by the security latch. On top of that housekeeping called our room at 8 in the morning, waking us up again and knocked on the door. Best to make very sure that the guests have checked out if you are going to clean a room at 8 in the morning I would say, never mind the do not disturb sign on the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Conniefay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the weekend of Dec 16 - 18, 2011. The location was great. We could walk to anything we needed to uptown -- Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, etc. We were really surprised when our room had two bathrooms, two closets, and two separate temperature controls. But if you go in the Winter, bring your own blanket, or contact the hotel to see if they can provide more blankets. The blankets were soooo thin! It is my only complaint -- I'm just grateful for my flannel pjs.

Reviews.Title: “OK if staying only a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: nuriaMoscow
Reviews.Content: I am gonna be quick as other travellers already pointed out to all the problems: dirty and small rooms (I was in petit though), everything is very dated, no cattle or small mini bar. BUT since I've payed 90$ per night in this very busy season I am not complaining. And if you come here just be prepared to face dirty curtains, torn wall paper and rusty bathroom. If you are not getting 90$ deal I would definitely advise staying somewhere else. As I truly do not understand how some travellers ended up paying 350$ per night for such a quality, take your money and walk to the nearest W hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No blankets and staff saw me naked, not a good stay.”
Reviews.Author: Amanda W
Reviews.Content: This is the first review Iâ€™ve written, only because I tend to be laid back and easy to please when it comes to hotels. That being said, I was not at all pleased with our stay this past weekend at the â€œRadissonâ€� Lexington in New York City. I have stayed at Radisson Hotels in Antwerp, Brussels and San Francisco and was shocked that they agreed to license out their name to this establishment. (There is a disclaimer at the desk, that this hotel is owned by Lexington Hotels). Anyway, hereâ€™s my beef with the hotelâ€¦ 1. I requested a room on an upper level, we were given a room on the third floor (second floor, really), directly above a night club with music thumping until 4am. 2. When we checked in there was only a sheet on the bed. I called three times and an hour and a half later (9:30pm), still no blankets. Finally, I had to go downstairs and refuse to leave the counter without a blanket in order to get one. I was given a stained, â€œdownâ€� duvet that had been washed and dried so much it was just a duvet cover filled with hard balls of feathers. 3. I was in the bathtub one night, which is about three feet away from the door, and a hotel employee used her key and walked right into our room without knocking (for no reason, we had not requested anything, it was 8pm) and saw me in allmy glory. Not good. 4. I found a dried out/crusty wash cloth under the bed????? Yeah, my thoughts exactly. 5. We werenâ€™t given any wash cloths until our last day there. Their only redeeming quality was the location. I assume they realize they can treat guests however they please since it is NYC and they know people are going to continue to stay there merely for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Quality at a Reasonable Price for Midtown”
Reviews.Author: ChrisJones5
Reviews.Content: In town for a convention at the Mid-town Hilton in prime Holiday Season, I was faced with room rates in the upper $300's to $600. While maybe not a big deal for those on a corporate expense account, for independent business travelers such as myself, the Radisson represented a solid value ($149 pre-tax) in walking distance of all that Midtown has to offer. Are the room small (it's NYC), and perhaps a bit dated (maybe, but comfortable and clean), perhaps, but if you can get the pricing differential I was able to, it's a good value. Two additional thoughts. Sign-up for the Radisson reward program and get free wifi, a big savings. Also, while convenient and quick, the hotel's coffee shop, Raffles, was mediocre and not inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm just okay - average and needs some attention”
Reviews.Author: TheBot77
Reviews.Content: Found this place at the last minute and was pretty wary about it following some reviews. In short - it's just okay but boy does it need some care and attention. The location is great (just on Lexington) and is close to Times Sq and lots of Subways - but is just a functional hotel, not really any luxury or great service. On a practical perspective it's just a average, well located place to stay and that's probably all I'd say on the positives. The lobby of the hotel looks like it's been redone however the rooms are tired, indeed of a deep clean and an upgrade. We had no major issues - more niggles that we just lived withâ€¦but would struggle to be highly recommending this one save for those who just need a bed for the night. We did complain about the noise of the air con (squeaking from 5am to 8pm for some reason) and they did nothing to address this or update us (ended up buying ear plugs). Pros * Location - it's convenient Cons * We found the rooms noisy and very warm indeed - with the air con doing very little to dent the heat. * Rooms are small - but that's what you get in Manhattan I suppose. * Bathroom was small and pretty tired - def need to be looked at. * You have to wait for a good time (we walked away 3 times due to a lengthly wait) to speak to some one and when you do it's generally not that helpful. * Wireless Internet is free in the lobby but $14 per day in the rooms - seems just greedy.

Reviews.Title: “REFURBISH REFURBISH REFURBISH”
Reviews.Author: Eyeous
Reviews.Content: Spent some serious time here in November 2011 and felt like I owe it to fellow travellers of the tripadvisor community to summarise my impressions. First the good: this hotel had availability. This is in contrast with all the other hotels which I tried to stay in which did not have availability. Sadly, it probably had availability due to the bad points belowâ€¦ The bad: I wouldnâ€™t rate this hotel as â€˜terribleâ€™ as I save this rating only for the truly appalling. I think Iâ€™ll go with poor. These are my top 5 reasons why: 1. Itâ€™s expensive and for similar fees you can stay somewhere far better in NY. The only reason I didnâ€™t was because I left it too late to book and so nothing else was available for long stay â€“ my own fault. And if youâ€™re thinking itâ€™s a â€˜great locationâ€™, well so are 1 million other hotels that are scattered up and down Lexington avenue or the immediate vicinity! 2. Everything about this hotel is old. The bed sheets are far too old, stained, dry cleaned to death with holes or ripsâ€¦etc. The exact same thing goes for the towels. I got my own. The carpet is old. The elevators are old. All the furniture is old. Everything is worn and needs a massive refurbishment. The amenities are old. 3. The bathroom is sub-standard. There was no air vent, it was small, the running water felt filthy given the prehistoric age of the plumping. And the bathroom fixturesâ€¦rusted, limescaled, worn â€¦screaming out â€˜renovationâ€™. 4. The windows are not double glazed. I was on the 20th floor and could still hear cars beep, police cars, ambulances, fire trucksâ€¦etc. The hotel is on a busy junction in mid-town and this drove me absolutely nuts. If you are on the first few floors facing the road, pack earplugs. 5. Room temperature gauge was ineffective which meant it was either freezing cold, or it was like a sauna. You may be very surprised to hear that I think the thermostat didnâ€™t work because it was OLD. Maybe if this hotel hears the word â€˜refurbishmentâ€™ enough times? r e f u r b i s h m e n t!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location / Average Room quality / Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TeamPA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location, right near all the action or at least walking distance to it. The price however, $350+ for a petite room was awfully high. The quality could be greatly enhanced by simply adding comfortable bedding. Yes it was small but thats NYC. The lobby is very impressive and the staff was very nice. Doubtful I would stay there again as the next day I stayed in another hotel around the corner for the same price and it was of much better quality.

Reviews.Title: “Super small room in need of repair”
Reviews.Author: Trav3lm0re
Reviews.Content: I booked a two night stay for business and I can say with certainty I won't return. While the doorman greeted me warmly, the surly front desk clerk was among the more rude employees I've encountered at any hotel I've ever stayed at. The problem was that the room I booked, a non-smoking queen size bed was unavailable. She offered me a regular double or twin beds instead. If I wasn't 6-2 with feet that hang off of a double bed, I would have be okay with that. But when I asked if I could be moved the following day to the room I reserved, I got nothing but excuses as to why it couldn't be done. I even offered to check all of my bags with the bellman the next day, but the clerk insisted that I couldn't be moved unless I was physically present at the hotel -- even though ALL of my belongings would have been with the bellman. When I got the room, I saw paint flaking off the walls, mildew in the bathroom and a room which would have been considered super small, even by European standards. All this for more than $250 a night? No thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: AJ392
Reviews.Content: For first trip to New York we chose the Radisson Lexington. The localtion seemed to be good and I generally find you can't go wrong with a Radisson. We weren't looking for glamour or luxury, just a good base. We stayed for 7 nights in total and at check in were given a free upgrade to a larger room. The first room we were assigned actually already had other guests belongings in it, so after a quick trip back to reception and some free drinks vouchers for our troubles we we finally got to our room. The room itself was larger than I'd expected. We had a great king size bed, adjustable either side for softness/firmness, and the usual desk and furnature. The view wasn't great but when you're in NY, how long are you really going to spend looking our your bedroom window?! The room was modern and clean, no problems at all. The bathroom was olderb and could probably do with a little refurbishment in an ideal world but it was clean which is most important and restocked everyday. The lobby is linked directly to a small restaurant (we tried this once just before our flight home, it was nothing special) and a Starbucks. Also in the lobby was a small bar and sushi bar. Concierge were all very friendly and helpful. What really sells this hotel is the location. Ten mintutes walk and you're at Central Park, Bloomingdales etc and ten minutes the other way you're at Times Square and the Rockefeller Center. There is a subway two blocks up and an endless amount of deli's, bars, restaurants and stores right on the doorstep. It's not a 5* hotel so don't go in expecting that, but for the price and location, it's just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “An okey hotel, but don't expect anything fancy”
Reviews.Author: catoha
Reviews.Content: I've visited this hotel two times this year, primarily cause I'm a Club Carlson member. The hotel is quiet and has a great location on Manhattan. The rooms are of good size (I got a large room cause of my membership status at Carlson, so I can't comment on the regular rooms), but are starting to be warn down (old). There are other hotels that might offer a more upgraded/new experience around the same location. The finishing touch of the rooms are not great. The staff is nice and check-in, check-out is problem free.

Reviews.Title: “New York with shuttle from Newark Airport.”
Reviews.Author: annabanana407
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights nice and clean staff very friendly, had a problem outwith the Hotel, I received great help from Manager Irene and Viginia at reception. We travelled from Newark Airport with Go Airlink Shuttle to New York city, just make sure you have all your belongings with you when you leave the shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Location may be good, but din't be fooled by the lobby. Rooms are circa 1979.”
Reviews.Author: Snarch
Reviews.Content: It's adequate. I have a favorite hotel I normally stay in when in NY for business, but it (as many) hotels were full as it's December in NY. I had to ask to change rooms as the initial room had so much damp in the walls the paper was bubbling and peeling. Ick. I was 'taken care of' by getting the exact same (small) room minus the damp. Am sitting in the lobby writing this rather than go to the room - it's not inviting. As a tourist this would be a good central stop if you just need a room to sleep in (I assume it is less expensive at other times). For a tired business traveller, the damp wall experience will mean I will never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, for a good price, brilliant location.....you only sleep in NY!”
Reviews.Author: Bryan-P-C
Reviews.Content: No great shakes but it is in a great location, we walked everywhere from here. Starbucks in lobby is a plus. Bar area small but good one in Marriot around the corner. Rooms are small but this is New York so didn't expect much more - enough room to sleep and for a few shopping bags. Bathroom minute but hot water and shower was good. For the price and location it fit the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: FDNYBUFF
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Lexinton is a good hotel and in a good area. Short walk to 5th Ave and the shops. Lots of great places to eat nearby. The hotel is nice clean & tidy just what you want. Starbucks to the side of the lobby and great breakfast place across the street. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: JCP88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for money, mainly due to the location! Minutes from 5th Avenue and Times Square etc. Our room size appeared very generous for New York,plenty of room for 2 ladies with luggage and shopping bags! My only negative with the hotel was that we did request a twin room when we booked and asked several times through out the stay however I can appreciate it was Thanksgiving week and the hotel was very busy so we made do with one double bed! Overall you get what you pay for,this hotel isn't luxury by any means and it's probably more of a 3 star than a 4 but for people who are after a brillantly located hotel at a reasonable price then this hotel is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel,but A Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Mick L
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel,but a great value. The room was average and rather small,but, this NYC. It is an excellent location and can easily walk to the attractions. The staff was friendly and I will return if I am in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again a lot of money for a hole of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hatchy74
Reviews.Content: We stayed over thanks giving basically there's your key your on the 3rd floor, once in the room no tea/coffee making facilities no info of the hotel peeling paint on the ceiling the water in the bathroom had to be run for a couple of mins as it smelled when first turned on, upon complaining about cigarette smoke in our room we was fobbed of with a breakfast and the smokers persisted next door we also complained about Mosquitos in the room to which the lady behind the counter said they don't fly to which I said what doesn't she replied bed bugs that's when I realised that's what we had felt a few times crawling over us my wife had been bitten a few times too.the only good thing about the hotel was the Starbucks next to the lobby, if I was you spend a bit extra for somewhere nicer

Reviews.Title: “It was a great hotel in a wonderful location! No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: sterry
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous about staying here after reading some of the previous reviews, but we didn't find even ONE of the things/complaints with our room or the hotel at all. I do have to say though that we confided in the young man at the front desk about our concerns and asked for one of the "renovated" rooms and something up higher in the building. We were given a really nice room on the 26th (top) floor and it was fabulous. No problem with cleanliness or water pressure or noise and I am picky! I checked everything and it was all good! I do think that they are willing to accomodate their guests if they aren't too full and I don't doubt that maybe some of the other rooms are run down and need renovated on other floors. I would definitely just ask to be moved to a renovated, different room on a higher floor. Hopefully they will be willing and able to help you. We were lucky too because we had reserved a deluxe room, which was fairly standard I think, but it seemed to be a step up from basic. I got this at a great price through Groupon. We will definitely go back to this hotel! Loved it, the location and the luxury of it all!

Reviews.Title: “From check-in to departure: perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Elk246
Reviews.Content: Val @ check-in was warm, gracious, efficient and immediately made me feel welcome. The rest of the stay equally perfect. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “A+ all around!”
Reviews.Author: courtko2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over the Halloween weekend and our experience was wonderful. Great location; Grand Central is a couple blocks away. Great service; Laura at the front desk was so nice and personable. The room was clean and quiet, had many tv channels, and the room temp was easy to control. The bathroom was very small but worked just fine for us. Loved the sleep number bed! Didn't go to the restaurants on site but went to the pizza place across the street, Redstone Pizzeria. Many choices for pizza by the slice and reasonably priced at around $3.00. O'Neill's Irish Bar is just around the corner on 3rd ave. and that was absolutely delicious. Priced reasonably I think: $80 for 2 dinners, 2 sodas, 1 dessert, and 5 beers. Live music was awesome and the atmosphere upstairs was so quaint. Ess-A-Bagel, also on 3rd ave., had a great cinnamon-raisin bagel and was plenty to fill up on. The line moved quickly and the staff behind the counter seemed to truly love working there! A+'s for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “very average hotel, small room, great location”
Reviews.Author: am4894
Reviews.Content: stayed for few nights on honeymoon, got a tiny room on 16th floor, hotel and room pretty average, price was ok, location was really good though

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: HHolland
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and would definitely recommend. Rooms were clean, modern and beds ultra comfy. And location was great for all sights in NY! Staff were brilliant. I'd give this hotel an A* for everything and would recommend for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Big apple/small room”
Reviews.Author: tce91
Reviews.Content: Booked thru travel agents.room small.bed very tiny about 4foot width not a British double.next door building night club . We on level 3 night club below.notuch sleep went on till 4am on 2 nights.advise get a higher floor and ring hotel before about room size. New York fantastic city enjoyed every minute other than hotel.be warned

Reviews.Title: “Trip to New York.”
Reviews.Author: elgranero5
Reviews.Content: Well worth the Trip to New York, this hotel ideal position, staff really good helpful and friendly. the rooms are excellent. And i have stayed in many hotels world wide and this is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: BritPaul
Reviews.Content: After a last-minute schedule change Amex got me a room here. For the price it is a very good hotel. You can get plusher but you pay much more for it. The room was a "large" category and had two king beds and two bathrooms. The location is excellent. Easy walking to most of the places you want to go to and subway to get downtown. The only downside is the poor restaurant but there are plenty of options nearby. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, noisy - don't believe their website”
Reviews.Author: rosepozey
Reviews.Content: The website stated the rooms were refurbished - i find this hard to believe. They were small and dirty. In the room we were assigned the bathroom sink was cracked, the phone didnt work, the bedside lamp didnt work and the bathroom ceiling was cracking and warped. When I tried to change the room we were given an "upgrade". This turned out to be the same size of room. One complaint of mine had been made that I wanted a roll out bed - but both these rooms were too small to accommodate a roll out. This meant my daughter had to sleep in bed with us which resulted in restless nights for all. Room three was the same size again but at least had a balcony and I was told by the front desk that this was the last time they could move me - so I basically had to like it or lump it. I didnt like it and frankly the room was so noisy that none of us slept. The front desk are dealing constantly with complaints and will not answer the phone - so every request results in going back down to the lobby. In a weekend who has the time, energy or desire to deal with this much aggravation. This was supposed to be a special birthday weekend and I have to say that the Radisson experience was a real let down. I fairness the staff do what they can up to a point but they are dealing with an old, dirty hotel and dissatisfied guests wanting to be either moved or have tv's etc that actually work.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rpolito2004
Reviews.Content: clean, great location, train station resturant's close by just easy it's midtown. i recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a quiet part of east side”
Reviews.Author: philadlephia19110
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at Radisson Lex. Both times I was treated like a king. Room I booked were spacious and well apointed, however I know there are some small rooms there. Decor in the hotel is classic contemporary. If you like starbucks there is one on lex which is part of the hotel. As most of the nyc hotel the only amenities they have is a gym, but you can bur your extra calories walking it off in any part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but that is about it”
Reviews.Author: Bunny-London25
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the lady that checked us in was very friendly and helpful. The room was small (as is expected for any city hotel) and dated but had a certain cuteness about it. However, there were a number of negatives including: - thin walls led to noise form people in corridors, next rooms and the lift shaft - lack of lighting in the bedroom - dirty bathroom - complained and this was cleaned very quickly but was still not clean enough - WiFi is approx $14 per day Overall the hotel is ok but it needs a make over and needs to make sure standards do not slide. I probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Two stars max- dirty, old and noisy”
Reviews.Author: mrsirin
Reviews.Content: Checked in recently to find a bathroom with peeling paint, crumbling plaster and dust and dirt all around the windows. The walls are paper thin, so you can hear everything going on next door. I switched rooms, but found the same thing. Housekeeping forgot to clean our room, and the bathroom in the new room smelled like an ashtray. The hotel charges almost $15 a day for wi-fi in the room, and leaving your bags with the hotel after check-out will cost you $2 per bag, before tip. The coffee shop attached to the hotel is like something out of 1955. All this for almost $300 a night! Check all your options before staying here.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay there”
Reviews.Author: Frequentraveler_724
Reviews.Content: Frequent business traveler in Manhattan and I got stuck here once and only two words come to mind "never again." The location is nice but there are a lot of other hotels in the locval area that are much nicer. The rooms were very worn, the bedding did not seem clean, the blanket was old and the bathroom was nasty looking. What's more this place has the nerve to charge the same prices as the other hotels in the neighborhood. It should be super deep discounts before you ever think of staying here. There was something not entirely on the up and up going on the room down the hall from me but I did not stay around to find out what it was. There was a constant flow of men into and out of the room .... Bottom line ,,,, look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Ok - but certainly not a 4.5 star!”
Reviews.Author: havick580
Reviews.Content: I got a reservation here the weekend of the NYC marathon. I found a Hotwire.com deal that listed this hotel as a 4.5 star, and promised very good rates. While we got a great deal, NOTHING about this hotel is 4.5 star. The rooms is sort of aged, with cracked/peeling paint, very loud rooms (thin walls), and poor upkept bathroom fixtures. Our toilet was crooked, and all of the caulk was cracking! The rooms are actually a decent size, for NYC. Everything was clean and it was a perfectly good place to sleep. The location is ideal for sightseeing, with a mile or less walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and Grand Central Station. All in all, it's an ok place to sleep, but it's not a fancy hotel in the least.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Business Class Room at the Radisson Lexington”
Reviews.Author: DCBob
Reviews.Content: Check in on 11/13/11 for a one-night stay at the bargain price of $119. I also will collect 50,000 Club Carlson points as part of their Big Night Giveaway Promo. Greeted warmly at the front desk by a lovely clerk name Nora. Am a newly-minted Club Carlson member with no status but was upgraded to a 24th floor large corner business class king (from a petite room) with a microwave, refrigerator, and TWO marble bathrooms! The room was fine but had an odd stale odor and I could hear noise from the room above me. It also had a Sleep Number bed, but I couldn't get the remote control to work to adjust the firmness. All in all, the stay was more than satisfactory and I would stay again at a rate under $150.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go”
Reviews.Author: ABD119
Reviews.Content: The worst value for money I ever experienced in NY. The place is so poorly maintained it's hard to tell whether it is more dirty or old. I stayed in two rooms, both had hair in the bathtub and sheets, stained carpets, peeling walls and the sense of a hostel. Room size was OK, in NY terms, but when you pay $400 per night, you still expect a place that doesn't feel like trash. Location is good but knowing all the surrounding accommodation â€“ InterCont, W, Marriott and even the Doubletree â€“ they are a much better value for your money

Reviews.Title: “Location A+ , the amenities and staff attentiveness (C or C-)”
Reviews.Author: Andrea W
Reviews.Content: I was shocked by the lack of room in our junior suite. I joined the business club and pointed that out to the manager upon check in....while checking out, i learned the business club has reserved floors with separate amenities, etc. Other issues: drains ( not working), water flowing noises, size - suite portion of the room had a foldout sofa (with no linens). The sofa bed would have the room's focal point if you could open it across the 2 sq feet. I was pretty shocked how many times i called the front desk....only to be routed to my a VM set up. Rude bell captain was the prize winner...we waited for 20+ minutes for a taxi and we were the first in line of about 14. I pointed to the cross Ave and suggested he might be more effective up there. He yelled at me. So I found his boss...who yelled at me too. It was sad that I could get a cab more effectively than the 'whistleblower in the dark'.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely service in a good location with ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: LondonOaf
Reviews.Content: For a fleeting visit, this hotel offers a good base for getting around the city. Located a few blocks from Grand Central Station you cant go wrong with the location. The service was exceptionally good with cheerful helpful staff on the front desk giving a warm welcome. The rooms were pretty average - clean at least, and humble sized with a decent comfy bed. My only criticism is that they could provide bottled water since there's no mini bar. I stayed on the 20th floor and was woken a few times from the water pipes which was a bit annoying. That aside, I think it was a good choice for a quick trip and served its purpose well. Also - free wifi in the lobby which is a blessing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in mid upper side”
Reviews.Author: ragdias
Reviews.Content: First i must say that the location of this hotel is 'my' spot in NYC. Last time i stayed in the hotel next door, so i know the area very well. Highlights for me are: great location - walking distance to broadway, central park, subway and 5th ave, clean and fair room. Lowlights - no free internet at the high rate of the hotel (big deal for me) and no breakfast included (in most cases - depends on your deal). The bathroom is small and light outside the bathroom can be tricky to find. A bit noisy too being right in front of Lexington. Comment: you can have free internet from the lobby, but does that count when you pay hundreds a night?! really ..

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: Ctk1985
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about staying here because of the reviews however I was pleasantly surprised! Perhaps Australians expect a little less because this hotel was of a really high standard compared to ones of similar prices in Australia. My only complaint is that the shower did not have very hot water, infact one morning it was cold. The staff were apologetic, it seemed there was a problem with the whole system. I would definitely stay here again, the location was unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a European Radisson...”
Reviews.Author: alpiot
Reviews.Content: if you are used to 5 stars European Radissons, don't go to the Lexington one: small rooms, even by NY standards, mediocre service, lousy b'fast. Overall pricey and aged. But the location is good. really, it is a 3 stars -even if they do not say so.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Lexington”
Reviews.Author: breebro
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is a nice hotel, nothing special but no complaints (except for the fact that we asked for a pot of hot water and were told it would be $6). Stayed for three nights with two of my girlfriends and squeezing the three of us on a queen bed was fine. Certain things (the vent, windows, bathroom tiles), seemed a bit old but the room was clean and everything went well; we were there just to sleep. The hotel's in a great location and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Poor accommodation”
Reviews.Author: JC1LondonEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson recently and although the lobby and reception look good the rooms are small and shabby and the toilet leaked every time it was flushed and the bathroom was dirty. It is quite misleading as what they call a "standard" room is anything but for a major city, particulary in America. The hotel is generally in need of refurbishment, the bar closes at 11.00 so you cant get a late drink when returning from a night out. There is a night club on the ground floor which is very noisy until the early hours of the morning. Great location but I am sure there are much better places to stay in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Simon81W
Reviews.Content: This was sold to us as a 4 star hotel and although the room was lively the bathroom was very dated and there were no tea or coffee making facilities which is a fairly standard requirement I would have thought. Location is good, it's not far from any of the major attractions but I think there are probably better hotels in better locations for better value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location small bed”
Reviews.Author: Marrgie
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Lexington expects two grownups to share a twin bed. That is unacceptable in my opinion and the only answer the lady in the reception could give was "you get what you pay for". The bathroom was smelly and full of mold. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: me-gva
Reviews.Content: Good location - a short walk to Broadway, near the subway, short walk to Bloomingdales. Front desk very helpful, people nice. However, twice we were given keys to a room that was already occupied, so there may be issues with their room management system - a raises some conern about security. Did not have any bad experiences and have stayed on several occassions. Much appreciated business centre with printing facilities available free. Free wifi in the lobby and mezzanine and a Starbucks inside the hotel, with a couple of other coffee/cafeteria places across the street. Watch out for taxis hailed by the hotel to get to the airport -- as the hotel offers car to JKF at USD 64, while NYC taxis have a flat fee of USD 46, they seem to make deals. The taxi drivers insist on the USD 64 fare.

Reviews.Title: “Beds are hard to handle, but location is great for East Side”
Reviews.Author: CSSnowshoer
Reviews.Content: This hotel building is an old one, and I have stayed here a number of times over the years- and maybe even under a different chain name. Its well located near Grand Central and the 4-5-6 lines, and on the right side of town for a quick LaGuardia departure. And without exception, the desk clerks/lobby staff/housekeepers are genuinely nice. This is hardly ever the case in New York City. Whatever it is they have, they should package it. This visit was a last minute one, due to power outages at home, so we limped in somewhat bedraggled and unwashed, but our hostess, Layla, was really nice, and found us a room an hour prior to normal check in time. (And upgraded us as well.) The furniture is all quite trendy, shiny and new, and there is a flat screen TV. Internet is pricey at $14.99. If you read the fine print, its free with Club Carlson membership. The part I least like about this hotel is the beds. The mattresses are called â€œsleep numberâ€�. Setting it can be fun at first, then you start second guessing yourself on how hard or soft you want it. The problem is if you have two people, you can never get the two sides to match somehow, so one of you ends up sloping into the other, and both sides seems to slope from the edges, even on a hard setting. I woke up with a backache after this stay, despite working hard on the settings. Forget the hotel diner- its horribly expensive. But you have the city at your doorstep so just pass it by. In fact, if you get hungry, the food court at Grand Central is well priced and located for this hotel. No coffee in the room, but a Starbucks in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “An awful place for biz travellers”
Reviews.Author: DJC46062
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early October for one night. Normally I stay in a Sheraton or Marriott when I"m in midtown, but their rates were sky high and I decided to save the company some money. Well, saving the money was no mistake, but staying here sure was. The room was cramped even by NYC standards. Peeling paint, tired furnishings. The bedding was not clean and looked like it was 10 yrs old. This is one of the very few times that I would not sleep under the bedding in a hotel (and I have stayed in hotels all around the world). The hallway smelled of smoke, but at least that diverted my attention from the filthy carpets. There is no lobby to speak of, which is a problem for biz travellers. The only worthwhile aspect of this hotel was the starbucks attached to it. It's so bad that I've had my company's travel service remove this place from our list of approved hotels.

Reviews.Title: “good position”
Reviews.Author: TillyJ6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Lexington for 4 nights 20-23rd October, we were in room 616.
