The room was adequate it was clean warm and had all the facilities we needed, the only thing with being in America we were expecting a big bed and it was just a standard double which was fine. After out first night in the hotel the outside temperature dropped and the maid left us with extra blankets which I thought was a nice touch. We were on the front of the hotel and it was very noisy but I would love to find a hotel in New York where you don't hear any traffic noise!!! For us the hotel was in a excellent position with it being a 10min walk to Grand Central Station, Chrysler Building and Empire State Building it was only a 15minute walk into Times Square passing 5th Ave on the way. We were 2 females travelling for a special birthday!!! but we felt very safe walking everywhere we did, (we were never out after midnight though). I would recommend the Radisson Lexington the staff were all friendly and helpful and did not expect or demand a tip which is what we had been warned about, we did tip but only when we received good service.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Acceptable Midtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gimpel
Reviews.Content: My one-night stay was paid for by the organization whose meeting I was attending, and they had a conference rate of $239 which is reasonable for a good Manhattan midtown location. With a good rate, the Radisson counts as perfectly acceptable in all crucial ways. â€¢ Room: my "business class" room was small but not claustrophobic. Bed was new and comfortable, nice flat-screen TV, desk and chair. Everything clean and tidy, and the climate control responsive and efficient. No obstrusive street noise. â€¢ Bathroom: small but this is an older renovated hotel, so fixtures not brand new but clean and okay. Good lighting, hair dryer on wall, good shower head and quality towels. â€¢ Location: At Lex/48th an easy walk to Grand Central Station and subways in all directions; a subway stop at Lex/51st very convenient. Easy walk to a number of shops, museums, etc.. â€¢ In general, this is a good visitor's hotel if gotten at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Raddison Lexinton New York”
Reviews.Author: jeanwolfe
Reviews.Content: Wanted to give a friend a special trip to New York so booked the more expensive Radisson only to find the twin room tiny, not clean no coffee making facilities on our first day out came back exhausted to find the room as we left it - no bins emptied, no clean towels no one had been near the room. Met a young Indian couple paying $200 per night who agreed with us the rooms were not clean and were also so disappointed with such an upmarket hotel and should have gone to a less expensive hotel with value for money and more up market facilities

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: WannaDiscover
Reviews.Content: We found the Radisson on Lexington an ideal location for our NYC trip. Close walking distance to so many NYC must-sees. Staff were courteous and the room was very nice. Towel replacement was hit and miss, but it was no bother as we had all we needed. When in NYC, there was not a lot of time spent in the room, as we were out most days, and the services were more than adequate. There was a view of a NYC back alley, not the prettiest, but it was NY interesting when we were in the room. The bed was soft and comfortable, lots of closet space (upgraded room) and we were fortunate to have his and her restrooms in our room. A nice experience, and I would not stay anywhere else when we re-visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Muy bien ubicado”
Reviews.Author: CarlaRJ
Reviews.Content: Good location and good service. Good option for your first NY visit. No breakfast is included, but you can go to Raffles dinner to have typical american breakfast. Just in front of the building you have Ambra that serves nice greek seafood (make reservations for weekends) If you want to buy cheap food just crossing ( in front of starbucks) the hotel you will find a self service to go facility. The hotel has a connection with a starbucks. There is also a good concierge for tours coordinations.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: jujumassoti
Reviews.Content: I was there with a group of friends. Excelent location and very friendly staff. Steps away from a subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy”
Reviews.Author: M J
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel during my vacations in US. Love this hotel in the heart of the Manhattan, 2 mins walk to Rockefeller's centre and also very close to time square. Rooms are nice and cozy. Free Internet available in the lobby area. Overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “francisca neves”
Reviews.Author: Heromancom
Reviews.Content: small room without frize,clean. expensive.the hotel is in a excelent location

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: RosyII
Reviews.Content: I was assigned a room so small that I could barely move around in it. But at least it was clean and I was only there for one night so I made no complaint. It was when the door slamming, knocking and wild laughter from the two (connected) rooms across the hall started that I began to complain and, eventually, to lose hope. I finally asked to be moved (at about 1 a.m.) but the new room to which I was assigned could not be entered with the card key. The second "new" room was a seedy, dingy space with two small twin beds, a bathtub with a peeling bottom, a sink drain that would not flow and anything but the "renovations" which this hotel advertises. The clock radio was unplugged but there was no outlet into which I could plug it. The place was, simply, a disaster. The staff seemed to want to help but was, ironically, apparently helpless under the circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful response to a horrible situation!”
Reviews.Author: screenwriter2006
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room for two with a double bed (gold so I was upgraded to a queen bed). The day we arrived, our daughter living in NYC was threatened in her apartment building by a deranged neighbor. She refused to go back to sleep there so we were in a fix as to how to get her belongings moved out into storage and a new apartment found. There wasn't room for a rollaway in our room, so I just asked for a pillow and duvet for her to crash on the floor. When the Housekeeping manager (Andrea) and Night manager (Irena) learned the reason why, they upgraded us to a room with two double beds for the weeklong stay. We had two reservations consecutively, so I had to check in and out after two days. Even though our room had been blocked for an incoming group, front desk agent Breda and on-duty manager Nancy V. undid the block so we would not have to change rooms. What a response! We were in such a state of upset, we weren't sure what to do. They came up with the solution on their own initiative. You don't expect such personalized service at national chains anymore. Bravo Radisson Lexington.

Reviews.Title: “Avarage at a good location”
Reviews.Author: matyovis
Reviews.Content: Good location. A walk from the subway, central park, 5th ave etc, The bath was not very clean. I stayed at the 6th floor and still could hear noices from the street. Some of the stuff was not so nice and helpfull. WIFI cost 16$ per day. Luggage storage costs 2$ per bag. So if you arrive early to youe stay or need to leave you bags until the flight be prepared to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel. Great value for money. Service could be better.”
Reviews.Author: chait123
Reviews.Content: Was at the Radisson for 5 days for work in NY and its a very good hotel, well located in the Central East Side in Manhattan... Lack of wifi in the rooms is a pain and the service could get better but all in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Colin_and_Liya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson on Lexington Ave for 6 nights in Oct 2011. The room was small but more than adequate and the service was friendly and efficient. After having read mixed reviews for this hotel prior to our stay, we were presently surprised at what we found. The hotel location is very central and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: wandylee
Reviews.Content: good location, subway just nearby, room are clean.the only complaint is that.. i was staying in a non smoking room but have to change my room 2 times due to ppl smoking in their non smoking rooms beside or around my room. hope the hotel will have more strict no smoking rules or have more smoking rooms for these inconsiderate ppl.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: andante51
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms through Priceline, and we were very pleased. The location is in easy walking distance to the Subway, Rockefeller Center, the UN, and even Times Square. Yes, it is showing some wear, but nothing serious. It was a noisy area, but that's Manhattan! The second day, we didn't receive clean linens and toiletries, but a call to the desk took care of the problem. We would definitely stay there again, if we could get a good weekend price like we did this time.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: HaveTheFreedom
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was a little hesitant to stay here but it was better than expected. Yes, the front desk staff seem bored and uninterested. Yes, the property is old and in need of some updating. But overall, the hotel was clean, the concierge was very helpful, the cleaning staff were friendly as can be and while the front desk staff seem uninterested, they are efficient. We were upgraded to a king size room which was on the small side but manageable even with a roll-away bed. I have to think the "petite rooms" are very small and I don't think I would book them but I didn't see them - just basing my thoughts on the size of the king size room. The business services area was simple but very quiet. It is out of the way but easy to get to. It is staffed and the staff were pleasant. The location of this hotel is great. It is an easy walk to Radio City Music Hall, Time Square...many areas. Central Park is a little longer of a walk but definitely doable. We would stay in this hotel again. The price was good for a hotel in the heart of the action and the need for a few updates doesn't take away from the cleanliness and value. Someone had noted previously that the wallpaper was peeling, the carpets were dirty - we did not have either of these in our room. The hall does have a stale odor but our room did not have that smell.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs turn experience into a dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: travellingBill2011
Reviews.Content: I visited the Radisson a few times and the last time was terrible and means we will not be returning. One simple phrase summed up our experience: bed bugs. The rooms were small. The location is great. The service is ok, but the hotel has a real tired look. It requires a renew. My previous experiences with the hotel were satisfying but it seems like the hotel has worsened over the last few years. The room was cleaned each day but that did not seem to counter the fact that I had bed bug bites that I did not realise until the last day or so. How very disgusting. I would expect modern hotels to get rid of blankets and use duvets which are much more hygenic. Blankets do not get washed as often as they should. Such a dissapointment!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - average room”
Reviews.Author: lovemyholidays46
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here in September 2011. Booked through our travel agents requested a twin room but given a double but the receptionist did find us a room on 20th floor with a bigger bed which was helpful as the hotel was full - 800 rooms. Staff were helpful especially concierge & reception. Room was very average. Chipped tiles - not enough towels only one small one each for the first night but did bring us extra pillows quickly when asked and sorted out the safe for us. Bed was very comfortable. Was not a bad size for a city room - we were on 20th floor. Did not eat breakfast here as a great coffee shop/deli over the road open 24hours. Also very nice upmarket Greek restaurant over the road from the front of the hotel. We did not eat in any of the restaurants as so many good ones near by. Expensive by London standards for the hotel but I understand that New York hotels are extremely expensive.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen S
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth visit to NYC, the first at this hotel. While the location is very good, the hotel itself is very dated and offers absolutely no amenities. There is no inroom coffee, no robes, the room was quite small and the bathroom tiny and very old looking. The staff was fine, but not anything outstanding; they did their job and nothing else. The bright spot was the concergie, he was very nice. Housekeeping was OK, they couldn't seem to figure out how many towels to leave. One day, all washcloths were missing, as well as a bath towel. Next day, bath towel returned, no washcloths. Basic stuff. I expected more from a Radisson and the price we paid. Also, the control for the sleep number bed was broken, however, it was fine for us. The best thing about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Auscan78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in September 2010. I had never been to NY before and was a bit stressed about the hotel. I ended up going with hotwire and ended up with this hotel. THANK GOD! The hotel itself is at a good location. It was clean and safe and actually quite nice. I remember the check in people as being so so - not overly friendly etc. That north Amercian attitude of what do you want? Not Hi can I help you today. The Concierge guy Edwin was awesome. I ran out of time and he went and posted my postcards for me and even sent me an email to let me know!! The cleaning staff for rooms were friendly as. Honestly if you are wanting to check out NY and be happy with where you stay and it not cost you too much but enough so you knows its good - this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “good location for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: Cosmimi
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Lexington enjoys an excellent position in the heart of New York. You can walk within only a few minutes to the Times Square. When you go into the hotel you will notice the amazing architecture. The staff is really friendly and can give you a lot of information concerning sightseeing. Our room was well furnished and excellent cleaned. Sleeping there was a real pleasure. The breakfast buffet offers a wide quanitiy of different items. Regarding the price, we hold the opinion that it is more than worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star Quality”
Reviews.Author: Andy B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August. We were sold the holiday on the basis that this was a 4 star hotel. Factually, and without emotion, I can avise the following; Decor - very dated and worn. Staff -friendly, but did not go the extra mile in keeping with hotel status. Rooms - for what they charge, a disgrace. Not only are they not big enough to swing a cat, but the the decor is very worn, they smell damp, and the carpets are heavily stained. AC rattled like it was about to die. And the smell of smoke along the corridors was atrocious. Coupled with a constant stream of far-eastern tourists 'camped' directly outside the entrance chain-smoking, you get the picture. Hotel facilities (bar etc.) - tried the bar once, and only once and this was near to the entrance and the constant traffic made it feel more like union square station. I think the pictures taken must date back quite some time..Overall, avoid like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Walking Distance to United Nations Plaza”
Reviews.Author: FireflySanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a decent hotel within walking range of the United Nations. This was the best price I could find for the location. The hotel room - the smallest one for business travelers- was ok and the bed was comfortable. As a Radisson member, I had free hardwire Internet access and I saw people in the lobby using wifi. The hotel is attached to a Starbucks - which was open until 11:00 p.m. where I could grab sandwiches, fruit, bakery goods and a good coffee to go. The hotel is also attached to a coffee shop which has a varied menu and attracts a business and tourist crowd. The service was excellent. There is also a hotel restaurant on an upper floor and a ground floor bar that I did not have time to visit. A well-stocked pharmacy is 2 blocks away. The bell hop helped me get my taxi to the airport and the hotel staff in general were very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: A I
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Lexington cashes in on it's location. The rooms are Okay.they smelt damp. They were clean.the room tariffs are really high for what you get in return. I am not able to comment on all the rooms but going bybthe standards of the room I stayed in,it needs a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Three star, certainly no more and perhaps less”
Reviews.Author: MacWilder
Reviews.Content: It's a perfectly satisfactory New York City Three Star. It's a little shabby and the hallway rugs could productively be replaced, but it certainly is convenient to Grand Central Terminal and serves its purpose as long as one is not expecting too much. Rather strangely, the room didn't have a blanket on the bed, thereby requiring a call to get one reasonably promptly delivered. Two warnings: The address says "Lexington Ave." but it's really on the south side of 49th (not 48th) about 50 feet from corner of Lexington. Also, the bell-hops charge $2 a bag to store temporarily for the guests. That's new to me. When questioned, they explain that this charge was incorporated into the recent union negotiations, which is merely another way of saying they are sneaking yet another hidden charge into the hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good...just the location!”
Reviews.Author: MaiteQatar
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband for a couple of nights...staff at check in treated us like we were idiots...they tried to persuade us to wait until 7 pm for our room in order to get an "upgrade", when we firmly said no thank you, we want now our room, they said oh well, we will give you the upgrade anyway... Our room was smelly and dirty! Thanks it was in NYC so you don't spend lot of time in the room...we had to call housekeeping in order to change the towels...were used!!! Trashcan had garbage, etc, etc...oh and this was the best room in the hotel! Al least the lady at reception said so... They need to refurnish as soon as possible, get their people trained and please! Take care of the housekeeping team! Don't stay here, is not worthy even with the superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Small well worn room”
Reviews.Author: RTH10
Reviews.Content: The room was very small, wallpaper was peeling off the wall in the bathroom and bedroom, The bathroom fixture were in need of being updated and the chair in the room was scratched and worn. We had a roll in bed brought in and there was no room to walk around it. The location on the East side is convenient for subway access, however it is difficult to go across town to Penn Station if you take the Long Island Railroad from JFK. I would recommend taking the train into Atlantic Yards and catching the 4 train to Grand Central Station which is just a couple of blocks from the hotel. Wireless internet access from the room was expensive but they do have free service in the lobby. Their was no coffee or fridge in the room but there was a Starbucks just off of the lobby. Expensive Hotel for what you recieve.

Reviews.Title: “A Week in New York”
Reviews.Author: rbrtbmw
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in New York the beginning of September. The first thing we noticed when we arrived is that the staff behind the front desk were not the most polite people. No friendliness was detected and no smile. They did what they have to do or say. The room was small but very good for a stay in this amazing city. The shower was good and the AC was working very well. The people who were friendly was the housekeeping. There is a concierge in the lobby who is very friendly and helpful. She took her time to explain us things and listen to what we had to say and ask. We booked it without breakfast. There's a small place on the other side of the road where you can buy fresh fruit, warm food and groceries and take it to your room. In the same building as the hotel is also a Starbucks (slow personal but no mistakes) , so we had our morning coffee. Overall the hotel was perfect for this kind of holiday. The most of the time your not in the hotel but seeing NY. If everything goes well you don't need the front desk people for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Tata_and_husband
Reviews.Content: At the time we went (2009), the hotel was really good. It is very well located and the room was very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Brill”
Reviews.Author: skydiversomerset6
Reviews.Content: I travelled to New York as a disabled traveller, i stayed at the Lexington hotel, i found the hotel to be very clean, the staff were very helpful, and friendly, the food in the Raffle resturant was very good, and reasonably priced, all in all a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and dull”
Reviews.Author: TishTish1
Reviews.Content: My main point would be - for the money you can get much better hotels in NYC The rooms are dark and dingy, not particuarly clean, small even by NYC standards On the plus side, the staff were very friendly and helpful - The duty manager even came up to the room herself to deal with the cockroach in our bathroom! Location wise its great just a few minutes walk in any direction will get you into the thick of it My advise would be to shop around

Reviews.Title: “Staff pretty good but could of done more.”
Reviews.Author: millseybum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a bespoke holiday "Vegas & New York". On arrival there was confusion as the company had booked a triple room as we were on a birthday present for my sons 21st. We were not given a twin doulble bedded room as booked but were given a double bed and a put up bed. I did complain but as the US open was on were told that this was all available, and to see the duty manager in the morning. As we were very tired, we accepted this and went to bed. The next day, I saw the Duty manager and explained my problem. His attitude was that it was my problem not his, and I was to contact my travel agent. I explain that the problem was between his company and the booking company "Netflights". I also told him that I had paid netflights for the correct room, but he said that unless I paid an additional $60 per night then we stayed in our existing room. I paid the additional fee and we upgraded to a bigger room. On contacting my travel agent "Thomas Cook" they contacted the hotel and we had the charges refunded.( this is why I would not book with another cheaper alternative). On a postive note the hotel was clean, safe, and the concierge very helpful, and Kevin the bell captain/doorman was a absolute legend.He advised where we would have good food, attractions etc. We could not fault him and earned his tips....

Reviews.Title: “Didn't make the 4 star rating!”
Reviews.Author: M W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nice location to Grand Central and walking distance to Time Square. However, it is still not a 4 star hotel! While the staff were very nice (which is a plus), information that they provided regarding my reservation amount, they were not so accommodating. Calling management and corporate proved to be useless! Beware of the false advertisement of lower pricing and not following through when you arrive. I paid $50 more each night which totaled $1,099! For the price I paid, it was not worth the inconveniences and coming home with difficulties breathing. Spacious yes! Horrible mildew smell, out dated and rusting decor, unworkable outlets, and malfunctioning air conditioning (rm 2404) were not listed in their description! Overall, if you do not have a choice, looking for somewhere close to Grand Central, want to pay more than you expected and don't mind the things that I experienced... then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Handy for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Baltan
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night. Good location, enough space, nothing special but this should be a better end as a hotel in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Room too small, breakfast awful I will not be back”
Reviews.Author: Eve H
Reviews.Content: I booked for B &B executive room was upgraded to Business was very small no cupboards or draw space for cloths breakfast was poor coffee horrible they advertised comp newspapers never delivered turndown service not received very busy no attention to details. I do not recommend this hotel, no value for money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but clean room for a good price -- only worth it if you get a discounted rate”
Reviews.Author: kw947
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the petite at the Radisson on Lexington for two nights in June 2011. I was in town for buiness and then a bachelorette party, so I was sans-husband. The room truly was "petite" but very clean and comfortable enough for one person, as long as you don't plan on spending too much time in the room. The bathroom was also clean, but in desperate need of some updating. I secured a deal on the rate and only paid about $180 per night. Definitely worth it at that price and I would stay there again if they are offering that deal the next time I am in town. Definitely NOT worth it at the full rate. Tip: do NOT pay for the breakfast package -- the hotel "restaurant" is a nasty diner dowstairs. I made the mistake of eating there one morning and it was the grossest breakfast I've ever had. Walk over to 1st or 2nd aves for brunch, or if you are rushed, go to the Starbucks that is basically in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average room, Great location, a little noisy next door”
Reviews.Author: Calebhand
Reviews.Content: Overall, for the price, it's phenomenal. We paid $150/night for a mid-town Radisson. That was great in my opinion. We only got a full size bed, which was a little tight for two of us. Don't expect a mini-bar or fridge or breakfast. We didn't have a view. But overall, it was just fine. The bathroom and room were clean. The staff was friendly. And it's very close to Times Square, Rockefellar Center, and the Theater District. Only real problem was that you could hear the neighboring rooms flush toilets, use showers, and sometimes sneeze. Other than that, just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, well located...”
Reviews.Author: Bruna S
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, nice staff, GREAT LOCATION. Rooms are comfortable and well decorated. The location is really good, close to subway station, you can easily walk to Times Square. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: the_rover_syracuse
Reviews.Content: We were scared about staying anywhere in NYC after a bedbug scare in a previous visit. This hotel changed our minds about staying in NYC hotels and the city itself. The location is perfect. Make sure you don't bring a car because you'll be laying through the nose for parking but if it is unavoidable, there is parking across the street for 40 usd per night or something like that. The hotel is clean, well-maintained; the staff is courteous and helpful; valet parking is a plus. Internet is available but at a price and that is, perhaps, the only flaw in this otherwise perfect place. Frankly, having such a great location and clean rooms was enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Worried about mixed reviews so I checked this out in advance but...”
Reviews.Author: 2Magellans
Reviews.Content: DID NOT STAY! I had booked a reservation in June through a special deal at travel ticker. The price was excellent under $215 per night for a stay in October of this year which is the middle of high season in the city. The price since then has been averaging about $269 per night. I stayed with a friend for a few days in June because her roommate was traveling and went there in person to check it out. If I had not I probably would have stayed and been upset. You would think it was fine from the street view and because it was a Radisson and on Lexington Avenue but I was disappointed almost immediately when I walked in. The condition of the lobby was old and worn looking. I was still trying to keep an open mind and proceeded to the front desk and told them I had a reservation in October but was concerned because of some bad reviews and asked to see a room . I waited for over a half an hour for someone to come out and show me and nobody came out until I asked what was taking so long despite the fact I told them I posted regular reviews on Trip Advisor. I think they were hoping I would leave. I watched the front desk and while there were lots of people checking in I was not impressed with the attention paid to patrons at the front desk by the staff. When someone did come out she was very pleasant and we took the elevator to a room. The condition of the hallways and the carpeting on the way to the room was disgusting and filthy. The room much to my surprise was very small but lovely. It was a standard queen. It turned out I was told the room I booked was even smaller, a petite room. Now I have stayed in small rooms in NYC before but this was already pretty small. I was told all the rooms were in similar condition but the overall condition of the hotel was dilapidated and not for me. I canceled my reservation.The only good thing I can say about my experience and the hotel is that it is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Awesome Location, Slightly Dated room”
Reviews.Author: honesttim
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was quite unplanned and we literally just stumbled upon the hotel when we could bear to walk the NYC streets anymore! That said the checkin was relatively painless and given that we were scheduled to take a flight out next morning our interactions with the hotel travel desk and conceirge were extremely pleasant. We were given a room upgrade (pity we were staying there for only 8 hours!) and by new york standards and for the price the rooms was quite large and reasonably appointed but there was clearly a sense of it being dated in terms of its architecture (but not crummy or damp). The bathroom was a reasonable size but this is where you most realised you were in a building which was at least from the 1960s? (could be wrong there). Overall however in whatever little time we spent there it was quite a good stay and the location was extremely good especially if you are a tourist wanting to explore or the city or in our case tourists who were just about to collapse exploring the city! Very Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the worst hotels I have stayed in around the world”
Reviews.Author: Beatrice762
Reviews.Content: The room was dirty, some of the towels were dirty, the ceiling in the bathroom was falling down and the service was non-existent. More one star than four star.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A BUSINESS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: BrigidONeill
Reviews.Content: Having read the existing reviews, I knew to expect a slightly tired (read needing renovation) hotel. I was a little surprised, particularly for a radisson to also experience the following: (1) Business Centre: it may be open 24 hours but it is merely an internet cafe with printing capabilities from the Radisson computer terminals. There is nowhere to sit and work on your own laptop, connect to printers or scanners etc. You also have to put up with literally queues of people trying to get onto the existing terminals (in case you wanted to sit down at one of the desks to use your own laptop). There is no-where to sit to discuss issues or have a mini meeting with your colleagues away from the loud lobby music. The hotel suggested that we hold meetings in my bedroom (which, given that I'm a femle is not really acceptable). The best the hotel could offer us was access to one of their business meeting rooms at $70 an hour. (2) Wifi: The free wifi (available only in the lobby) is very weak and despite sitting right next to the router, our wifi would drop out regularly to "limited or no conectivity". To have any other wifi or to have access elsewhere in the hotel is $40 per day. (3) Service: I dealt quite a bit with the front desk staff, bell boys and concierge over my 5 day stay and surprising for a Radisson, I have to say they were quite sullen and unhelpful. I'm used to "American" service in NY - even the staff at Starbucks next door were friendlier! (4) Rooms: are tiny. I had a queen size room and it must have been about 20m2. The beds are also very hard - but that's an issue of personal taste. Summary:- Fine is you are here for a family holiday or shopping weekend but this is NOT a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Radisson I have ever stayed and got scammed on the room”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Smith_2301
Reviews.Content: This is indeed a very bad review about Radisson Lexinton I have stayed between Aug 13-18th. First I have reserved an Executive room, plenty of time ahead. When I got there they only had ONE room available in the strangest 28th floor which used to be a storage and force you to take 2 elevators.to make matters worst there was a huge column in the middle of the room that easily used up at least 25 sqft of the room. They only that room because a cancelled airline flight blocked all other rooms. Next day I was changed into a regular DELUXE ROOM, and nevertheless pointed out how small the room was the answer was.. This is our business class in NY :( now check on the web the picture of their web site DELUXE ROOM matches exactlythe room 2202 I stayed, so I got scammed, charged but not delivered the proper room. In addition wallpaper were falling apart, room cramped and if you want to talk to front desk between 11am until 4pm, good look.... It rings, rings, rings.... As an example I called the operator from my mobile and anked him to transfer, a few moments he came back saying he was sorry and not even he was not able to throught ... As described above, little respect for committed reservation, failing to resolve given a second chance, charging for a room and delivering and inferior one and very poor service makes this hotel a disaster. Avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy S
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel, fantastic service, very very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: beach_mom_leesburg
Reviews.Content: This was my first overnight stay in New York City and this was a great hotel. One of the definite plus it was easy on and off of I-95, its just a couple of blocks walking to Rockefeller center and subways. The rooms were a good size, the bed was awesome comfortable! We had a huge king size. The rooms were very clean and it had a Starbucks in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great price!”
Reviews.Author: dzchix
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel back in January, and spent two nights during the weekend. The standard room is clean and very nice, just like in the hotel website pictures. It is cozy but just perfect for two people! Bathroom is also standard, but clean and functional which was perfect! Room does not have a mini-fridge though. Time Square, shops on 5th Ave and Central Park, subway station are walking distance. Lobby has wi-fi, concierge is very helpful. TIPS: booking in January after New Year's has the best deals for the month of January and February! the hotel room was 76$USD a night (regular 229$USD), and with a valet parking package, it was 96$USD a night! Also, make sure to book directly from the website and not from other hotel search engines, it will come out less expensive!

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: rick00001967
Reviews.Content: we stayed in NY at the radisson on lexington ave for two nights. we were pleasantly surprised. even though we booked a petite room, it was like any other nice hotel room. maybe even better. it had a nice clean decor, no smells, a sleep number bed etc. it was very nice. and it was the best price we found in manhatten for a decent hotel. it was close to all kinds of shopping and restaurants. of course it would have been nice to be a bit closer to times square but then the price would be a lot higher. one word of advice for travellers to NY......watch out for the guys giving rides in those "bicycle rickshaws". what a scam. we took a taxi from the hotel to the phantom and it cost 10 bucks. we were walking back when approached by one of those guys. we were already about half way back. he took us about 6 or 7 blocks. then he asks for 36 dollars. YA RIGHT !! we had some choice words and he left empty handed after being offered a lesser amount. i would also be careful which taxi driver you use. from lga to the hotel was great. 27 dollars with tip. from the hotel to lga he wanted cash upfront (before he turned his gps on) when we refuesed, he took us way out of the way and charged us 35 dollars before tip. being unhappy with the ride we offered him only a 2 dollar tip. needless to say he was not happy. so if the hotel loby man gives you a taxi driver that looks scetchy, get another. all in all the staff and the room exceeded our expectations. i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Hidden" gem, low cost, great value!”
Reviews.Author: jtgraddy
Reviews.Content: I am always surprised about how great this place is. Almost always the cheapest brand-name hotel within blocks, and the service is great and the rooms are nice, clean, and sizable. If you want to say in midtown for 30% less than average prices at a nice hotel that is great for business travelers, then this is your place. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: love2Et
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was in a good neighborhood convenient to shopping and the sites. Also, pricewise, it was a lot more economical than other hotels we researched for NYC. And what I can say was that is was no more than so-so. The staff were very helpful and the lobby was nicely appointed. And it seemed clean enough, but our rooms were small and drab as were the hallways above the lobby floor. The hotel could stand a good renovation. The decor was more than a little depressing.

Reviews.Title: “well located but dirty and with bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Flor72Zurich
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson for 4 days and the room was really dirty, I even had to ask to please clean the room as there were hairs on my bed and on the toillet from other people, plus dust,etc... They cleaned the room but not very good... still the hairs were there on the toillet so I gave up after the 2nd night. After the first day I had bites on my legs that were itching, I did not have this before and I had this the morning after my first night. I asked them to change the sheets but I got more bites. I also ordered a non-smoking room and I had to buy a febreeze to kill the cigarette odors since these were coming form the ventilator...I will not stay there again for sure and honestly Im not a picky person the only thing I expect is only that the room is cleaned and it is quite disgusting to have this feeling like yuck I have to go to my room hotel again..I was so happy my trip in NY was over in order not to sleep there again. It was a prepaid room otherwise I would have left.

Reviews.Title: “Small room...average hotel”
Reviews.Author: purple_247
Reviews.Content: Made the mistake of booking through Priceline and did not get a great rate. Upon arrival, was booked into 2 very small twin beds, however it worked perfectly for my friend and I. Conveniently located, close to the train and sightseeing. Overall, was good enough, but next time I will spend the extra money to stay at a nicer place - could stand to be remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in mid town and good value”
Reviews.Author: JenMSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in mid town Manhattan. It's clearly an older hotel that has been upgraded. This means that while the room decor is up to date, the room is small, bathroom is small and worn, and the closet is very small. There is a bar and two restaurants off the lobby as well as a Starbucks which makes it easy to grab breakfast or a glass of wine without going out. I'd consider staying here again if paying for the room myself, but i will also be looking for a hotel that is perhaps a bit more upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “The location is very good.”
Reviews.Author: ayhanbalim
Reviews.Content: The front desk is very helpful.The concierge has good offers.The location is very good.We loved it and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay/Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: Nellyg077
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the centre of New York. I would class it as 3/4 star. It bristles with life in the lobby. The staff were great and have a load of time for the guest. The tourist info is very good and the rooms are comfortable with good air con and ice machines in the hall etc. ALL the staff were excellent with Breda particularly helpful in assisting us to phone the Uk back home. We would use this hotel again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “solidly 3 stars - but with a very good business center”
Reviews.Author: dash1_98
Reviews.Content: This is a utilitarian hotel -- nothing fancy. The room was small, in OK shape. There was no fridge or mini bar. Closet was small, bathroom was small, fixtures were old. The check in process was quick and so was the check out, and the staff was very helpful. $19 for internet was pricey. The business center was excellent -- got on 1 of the 6 computers and was able to print a document I needed -- for free. Excellent location for mid-town activities Overall not a bad experience, good for a business traveler.. . nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Small, dirty but centrally located”
Reviews.Author: kn1901
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in april. Hotel seems nice. Front desk staff is polite, and houskeeping maids are very friendly, always nice to chat with them. However, our room was quite dirty as soon as we looked under the bed, in the corners, on the window shades etc. Our heater was broken and when I lifted up the top panel to look at it, it was extremely dusty, there must have ben at least 0,5 cm thick layer of old dust on top of it. Very unappealing. I informed the reception staff and they got someone to llok at it. It was repaired, but the dust was not removed. Was our last nigth so I didn't bother to nag about it anymore. The Chinese restaurant at the hotel was very good. Decadent food, fresh ingredients and great taste. Highly recommended! As for the other restaurant; we did not eat there so I cannot comment on it. All in all, great location, great restaurant, small rooms with so-so cleaning. Paid quite alot for this hotel and expected more as I've stayed at similar hotels in NYC at other occations.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain in NYC”
Reviews.Author: bverbos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in mid-July and were very pleased. It is an older building, of course, but very nicely appointed. Rooms were small-ish, as is typical of New York, but we had plenty of room to open suitcases, get around beds, etc. so no complaint. The bathroom was small and could use some re-grouting but I think small bathrooms and rooms are part of the NYC experience! The hotel has a Starbucks, a nice bar, a good restaurant, business center, and all you might need. Staff very helpful: I have a broken foot and therefore preferred 2 beds (so my husband didn't inadvertantly kick me!) and they let us change rooms with no extra charge. We had used Priceline so they could've said "Sorry, no changes" but they didn't. The rate was excellent, and LOCATION perfect. The hotel is about 5 easy blocks from Grand Central Terminal, & several other subway stops are right up Lexington so getting anywhere is a breeze. It's easy to walk to Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral. Lots of restaurants/bars are located a short walk away on 2nd and 3rd Avenues, and we enjoyed breakfast at the little deli across the street every morning. This hotel is fine and we had no complaints. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located business hotel, needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: PDS63
Reviews.Content: This hotel would have seen better days. It is in a great location on Lexington, within walking distance of anything that one wants to do in Manhattan. The rooms are decent sized, but have a worn look about them. The hotel messed up my reservation and kept me waiting for 1 hour at 9pm to check me in, even though I had a confirmed reservation. They did provide me a consolation free breakfast coupon, but to have to wait after a long flight at 9pm to check in is not something that can realistically be consoled. The breakfast and dinner options in the formal restaurants were average, but the sushi at the Sushi Bar was outstanding. Did not get to check out an interesting Portuguese Restaurant that they have, but the food served in room service from the same restaurant was finger licking good and the service very prompt. There is a great breakfast joint just outside the hotel, across the street. They also charge you $2.00 if you store luggage with the concierge. That maybe common in downtown Manhattan, but was a first time for me.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for NY but small small rooms”
Reviews.Author: HanoriaC
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my then boyfriend( now husband) rooms were extremely small and very compact closing doors to get around and bed was uncomfortable. handy little restaurant on bottom floor but wouldn't plan taking your breakfast there every morning unless you want to gain lbs! hotel staff nice and friendly and it's located few blocks from grand central.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: ErlendWD
Reviews.Content: Got a terrible first impression on arrival. As an elite Club Carlson member, I requested early check-in. This was not available, which is fair enough, but then subsequently had to store our bags at the hotel until we could check in. For this service they charge $2 per bag. I have never experienced this before, even at the dodgiest of hotels. It's not the amount, it's the principle. Ridiculous. But, arriving back at the hotel later that day we met a different lady in the reception who was very nice. She gave us a bag with water and nuts, and upgraded our room. Also, as it was our honeymoon, she comped breakfast for our entire stay. The only downside to this is that the breakfast options at Raffles are crap. No hotel buffet, just a choice of oatmeal or eggs and "bacon". The room was OK, but nothing special. All in all, a very average hotel. I will definitely choose another hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Ropires
Reviews.Content: Small room and bed (just a full bed). Do not ask for couples bed, ask for 2 twins. Pricy breakfast. Good service and price benefit.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: smythNI
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights from the 2nd july - 6th july, the check in lady was lovely, she upgraded us to a queen size room for me and my daughter on the 19th floor and i was also given a fridge for my insulin within 15 mins of us arriving, and gave my husband and my son a newly renovated room on the 28th floor, although the rooms are small they are not much bigger than you would get at the hilton anyway, they are big enough for what you need them for, ie sleep, shower change and then out you go! the staff where friendly and helpfull, we found our rooms clean and tidy and cleaned everyday, must thank the housekeeper for getting rid of all our starbucks cartons. Our beds were made everyday the room was cleaned and the bathroom was cleaned and all the bins emptied and refilled paper ect everyday. We saw NO bugs and we had the best sleep, the beds where comfy, our rooms where clean and pleasent to sleep in, no noise at all. The straff were great i am sorry i cant remember the lady who checked us in but she was really nice, and the guys who took our bags up where nice too, kevin and stanley outside where great, very informative and good to talk to as where all the staff. I have no complaintes at all.. If i had to niggle, was just one night i woke up and cld smell something bad in the room, but this was rubbish from the street which hadnt been collected yet, hardley the hotels fault and i didnt complain because it never happend again, plus i had turned the de-humidifier off that night, and everythinh else was great both me my daughter, husband and son enjoyed staying here, great location and staff work very hard and were very helpful and polite. starbuck is great to have for your coffee in the morning, thankyou for a great stay, our first time in NY and it was just fab, would stay again. The smyth family northern ireland

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience I have ever had. Not feel safety.”
Reviews.Author: jackal0001
Reviews.Content: i had one of worst experience whole my life. Somebody open and step into my room when I was sleeping, then front man called after minuit. Asked me somebody name then just hung up. I could not even have sleep. I made claim when I came back to hotel next day after I went out, mgr also need good training, he talked over me did not listen,,,, room did not clean at 7 pm, fry was buthering me in the room, could not even have shower,,,, more and more,,, I have been traveling and using hotels all of the times. But never had this much problem. I strongly say You should not use this hotel. You won't be happy. I do not want any one have same problem

Reviews.Title: “Even for New York - this was a depressing experience”
Reviews.Author: BexleyStuart
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on business, and were profoundly unimpressed. My experience of the Radisson brand is pretty positive - I've stayed in a fair few of its hotels around the world. However from the moment of arrival when the porter practically demanded a tip, and then slapped us with a $15 dollar freight charge because we had 10 bags, customer service was very low down the list of priorities. My room was non-smoking, yet it smelt strongly of cigarettes. I complained to be told the only thing that could be done was to send someone up with a can of air freshener. The following day, thanks to the one helpful person on reception, I was moved - to a room where the lock didn't work. The hotel's location is good for the UN - and the attached diner and Starbucks were useful, but I wouldn't choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but you can find better value for money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Ruoska
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in this hotel in July 2011. The location is very central which is great. Although we asked for a room on the quiet side you can still some of the traffic from the streets (hardly completely avoidable). The room we had was ok size and clean and most importantly, no bedbugs. However, in the room (and the hotel itself) you see it could use a little bit renovation. In our room we could not close the bathroom door completely. We did not complaint about this as we were only staying for one night. There is a free fitness room in this hotel which is great. There was no breakfast included in our hotel price. The luggage storage automatically costs you extra 2 dollars. No free wifi in the room (in the lobby you have this though). We stayed previous nights in the Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott New York Manhattan (breakfast included, more quiet, more clean, free gym). I would definitely go back to that hotel on my next trip to New York but not the radisson for the same amount of money.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLY RUDE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: colive201
Reviews.Content: I had the worst hotel experience in my life in this hotel. This hotel is awful, has small overpriced rooms extremely noise. The staff is incredibly rude and unhelpful in special the manager Michael Menezes, that was extremely disrespectful with me and my wife that was recovering from a surgery. I donâ€™t recommend to anyone to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small room... large bill”
Reviews.Author: BusTraveler40
Reviews.Content: One of the smallest hotel rooms I have seen -- even for Manhattan GOOD SERVICE at check-in (Julia was GREAT), in the restaurant and during check-out. I was AMAZED that as a hotel guest you are charged for checking your bags after check-out. I have not seen this in my frequent travels. Lobby area is quite small with limited seating.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel with very noisy windows!”
Reviews.Author: PolarYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through priceline & after reading the reviews we were worried. Check in was a breeze & we had a room on the 12th floor. Room was compact but in need of repair. There was peeling wallpaper & the windows let in a lot of noise. It sounded like you had the windows open! Wi-fi was silly, it was charged if you wanted it in your room but the free wi-fi in the lobby was difficult to connect to. The hotel was lovely especially the location it just needs some TLC and better Wi-Fi services.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality, Management, and Service!! Please read all of this!”
Reviews.Author: Chrisla2082
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I've written a lengthy report of our experience if you are interested, but if you are one of those who prefers a shorter review.... This hotel was awful. As I've detailed below, the rooms are old and have obviously not been checked for quality (see below), only some contain the "Sleep Number" beds that Radisson boasts, the management is horrible and treats you as though "you should be lucky we let you stay here" attitude if you book on sites such as Priceline, and is an overall terrible experience. I am not one of those that looks for much out of a hotel besides a comfortable bed, good service, and cleanliness, but this hotel does not have any of them! Our first image of the hotel was an extraordinarily busy lobby (about 2:00pm on a Thursday) with only one guest service attendant. After a short wait (totally unacceptable for a desk that could accommodate 3-4 GS Reps) we were called over to a small desk by an Asian female who we were later told was a manager on duty. She checked us in silently accept to ask for my ID and credit card. I jokingly said that is was my birthday so please make sure I have a great room to which she responded with a sarcastic (ha ha) and kept silently about her business. My partner and I were lifelessly directed to the elevators and entered a very small room that had 1 very small double bed when the reservation was made for two people. I called down to ask about changing to a larger room. The phone was answered by the same lifeless personality that checked us in, and after expressing my issue, she asked for my room number and what my room number was and that she would return my call momentarily. During the next ten minutes we looked around the room only to find paint peeling from the ceiling and a not so pleasant smell. After my call went un-returned (10 minutes later) I called the desk, was answered by the same lifeless personality and was told I would again be given a call back - all with no answer to my complaint. This time the call was returned after about 2 minutes. I was told that because I booked through Priceline, I automatically got the smallest room despite my reservation being for two. However, she would, "as a courtesy", upgrade the room if there was something available. After two more five minute waits I was told that all larger beds were sold out for the evening but to check back later that night. Having worked in the hotel industry before an knowing that this is a common falsity I checked the Radisson websites availability for the evening an low and behold it had queens and kings available. My partner asked to speak with the general manager , and explained not only our issue about the room, but also the fact that we were lied to. This gentlemen (which I will identify as being of Middle Eastern or Indian decent) apologized for the lie by saying that previous manager only had limited access to the hotel's availability and that's was the reason for the inconsistency. Instead of handling the remainder of the issue himself, he stood by while he had a gentlemen he introduce as his "assistant" checked availability (he did however step in to say that if he was given the opportunity to make money off of us he would do what he could) and then once larger rooms were found he offered to upgrade the room for a fee! We explained the previous offer for a courtesy upgrade and he replied that he didn't know why she would offer this and that he would need to call her. At this point he disappeared into a back room. His assistant Michael followed him and returned saying that he would process our courtesy upgrade. We were then told to leave our original keys in the room after "moving our things as soon as possible." Upon exiting the original room, a housekeeper in the hall asked if we had "messed anything up in the room" with the connotation that she did not want to go in and clean it. He apologized and stated that the only room he had available to upgrade us to was on the noisiest level of the hotel. We accepted and were sent to a room that had a foul odor and a 5 inch square hole in the wall's vent paneling that blocked the electrical system. ( Prime exposure for bugs, rats dust, etc.) As if that were not bad enough we the ledge outside was covered with cigarette butts! We of course felt uncomfortable in this room and notified the manager again by phone, and were told to wait so he could come down and see what I was talking about. After another 10 minute wait we went upstairs to find him sitting at the desk talking to other guests. He changed the room to another on the same level which, as I tried to enter, was blocked by the housekeeper's closet left open with a broom. After she closed the door, we entered the room to be greeted by an even worse foul odor (smelled like a dumpster had been emptied), a dirty stained window, and a view cinder blocks, and loud air conditioning units. After returning to the desk, we were given a fourth room room on the hotel's top floor *which takes to elevators to get to). The room was much better with the exception of the chipped paint on the bathroom fixtures,missing handles on the dressers, broken iron, and incomplete towel set (which we had to wait about 35 minutes for to be replaced) As it was my birthday, and more than two hours after our arrival, we chose to ignore these things and kept the room. The remainder of our stay was filled with inconveniences and overheard constant complaints of others: 1. When we left and returned to our room, our keys did no longer worked and had to take 2 trips on the 2 elevator ride to the top level to get back to our room. 2. We heard several other guests complain about false charges, $100 hikes in rate to extend their stays, and one guest even expressed that his hair dryer was sparking and he felt unsafe during his stay. During checkout, that I could not wait for!! I waited about 10 minutes at the again under-manned desk, while the Middle Eastern rude manager who disappeared and never returned the day before stood and watched the slow progression of guests checking out. I was asked about my stay, and explained my problems only to be told that nothing could be done to accommodate me because I booked with Priceline, but that I should have a nice day! Do yourself a favor..never stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved New York, and enjoyed staying at the Lexington.”
Reviews.Author: canport0873
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on July 1st to 3rd. I hadn't been to New York in almost 20 years. I loved it and enjoyed my stay at the Lexington. Great hotel, close to everything. Service was really good especially the guidance I got from the concierge Martha, who was a myriad of information about New York. If you stay there see her for great tips and tickets for tours and tickets to attractions. Room was very comfortable and clean. A great experience overall. If you want to visit the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, go nice and early to avoid the long cues.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teacherbear
Reviews.Content: The location is out standing. The room was large with a nice bathroom and was veyr clean. I jad a high floor so there was little noise from the street. Check in was extremely fast. The carpets in the hallways are begining to show their age but are clean. All of the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in radisson lexington”
Reviews.Author: Sienna059
Reviews.Content: I read some negative reviews on here after booking so was kinda worried, but our 4 night turned out fine. Very friendly staff (apart from one blonde girl who seemed to hate her job), clean room. We were upgraded from a queen to a king bed for free. The internet thing was somewhat confusing (we booked a room that included wifi yet we had to pay with credit card for internet, but they said the money woud not be taken from my account..) Loved that there was a doorman to call a cab at all times. Great location! Our room was on the 4th floor and yes at 7am they started working outside but it didn't really other us. Fair price for midtown/upper east!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly noisy, would AVOID”
Reviews.Author: Kittyfer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Radisson then could not take any more so checked into the W Hotel for the remainder of our stay. We arrived at 11pm to be given a room on the 9th floor that was on the apex of both streets. It was so incredibly noisy neither if us got a inch of sleep. This entirely ruined our first day in NY. We asked to change rooms but were told we could not do so until 3pm (so could not catch up on sleep until then which led to us having to cancel our first nights dinner with friends since I felt so ill). Our new room on the 19th floor was still noisy, but to have such a difference in room quality at near $300 a night was unbelievable. In contrast, our room at the W Hotel in the 4th floor was super quiet. We didn't receive one apology throughout and the manager said he could do nothing about street noise (see contrast to W Hotel / do not let this room in comparison to higher floor away from street). Their moto says "if we can't fix it, you won't pay". Downgrading our room at 3pm the next day is not considered fixed and we only had a $70 discount off a $270 room. Not worth my trip to NY! On top of this we had maintenance call who decided they wanted to fix our bathroom roof "because of rubble", housekeeping removed towels and forgot to replace, and our room keys worked intermittently. Incredibly noisy, rude staff and tired rooms. Will be recommending ALL to avoid (or request rooms on floors 20+ at a minimum).

Reviews.Title: “DONT USE PRICELINE & RADISSON LEXINGTON!”
Reviews.Author: bearsticky
Reviews.Content: Be wary of this Hotel, esp if u book thru Priceline.com! We are Australians & planning to visit Big Apple this Xmas. Aft saving our hard earn $, cost us USD10K in air tickets, I offer a bid of $150 per nite for a 3star Hotel in NYC & was accepted by Radisson Lexington. Instead of offering us a decent size room, we were given the cheapest & smallest room, called "petite room", which has a going rate of $158per nite if booked directly w Radisson! The deceitful thing is; Priceline.com ad ertised on its website a savings of 40-60% if we bid for a hotel room. In our case, we only save $8per nite & not the 40-60% as claimed. When I contacted Priceline, they asked me to contact Hotel directly. I did that & Radisson pushed the responsibility back to Priceline. After many emails later, Radisson said they are happy to upgrade us to bigger room w King bed but have to pay upgrade fee! When I ask how much is the upgrade fee, both Priceline & Radisson would not tell me! How dodgy! We feel very cheated by both Priceline & Radisson! So beware folks!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok, position was very good”
Reviews.Author: lachaplin
Reviews.Content: Put down for 2 beds but they didn't have any in non smoking so the room smelled a bit. Only 2 single beds and quite a small room, but for half the price of most hotels in the area it was 100% worth the money and very near to main attractions like 5th avenue and the rock plaza. Gym was quite good with a nice selection of machines. Would stay here again but not in a non smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: MexfanDos
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here during a recent trip to New York. Like many New York hotels, this is an older hotel that has now been branded (Radisson) and updated. Because we anticipated being out most of the time, we chose the "petite" room. When we checked in, the registration assistant offered us a free upgrade to a corner king room. The room was very clean and roomy enough to hold the king bed, a desk and other furniture. Like other Radissons, there is a "sleep number bed" to ensure a great sleep. The bathroom was somewhat small but adequate. All of the staff were professional and helpful. We did not try any of the hotel's restaurants which were all extremely pricey. For a simple breakfast, you can find any number of small cafes nearby. If you are a walker, this is a GREAT location. We walked to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, the UN and even to our daughter's apartment in the East Village.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MagVeg
Reviews.Content: Booked a jr. suite on line for a reasonable rate and enjoyed the two rooms and bathrooms. Room was very spacious, modern, and clean. The location is midtown Manhattan walking distance to 5th Ave, Times Square, many restaurants. Like the service, Starbucks in lobby, diner in lobby, rooms are modern and clean, location is perfect. Staff very cordial and helpful. Look forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not so wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mike_g30
Reviews.Content: Recently had a 3-night stay here for the first time... Overall disappointed. Room and bathroom size aside (typical NY.. quaint..), a few things stuck out in my mind that will cause me not to return there... There was only a sheet on the bed (and that little footer cover). No quilt/comforter. I know its summer, but come on. Towels - might as well been sandpaper. And there are no hand towels - just 2 bath sheets and 2 washclothes. Odd... Service staff started cleaning at 7:30am..... either make it quiet or don't use the vacuum until later.... Noisy - road noise was above average for being on the 24th floor... windows drafty it seems. Cleanliness - some mold growing in the corners of the bathroom... Lights haven't been dusted in years...

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay, it's the absolute pits.”
Reviews.Author: Aalman
Reviews.Content: Withdoubt the rudest and most ignorant staff ever employed in a hotel. The only saving grace was the cleaning lady. Reception staff were officious and curt, one concierge had manners and wasn't hinting at a payback, and as for a bell boy called Ralp... I would lose him without a second thought..grumpy, verbally rude and probably hated his job... Why is he there . Would never ever stay there again and would certainly Warne friends from doing so....

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: kingofthemile
Reviews.Content: Irina Borukhov was the definition of a hospitality manager. Absolutely enjoyed my stay because of her efforts. A+ to her. Room was a decent size for the city. Only complaint was cab horns blaring. But a very nice hotel in a great location overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny uncomfortable room, slept with my computer case.”
Reviews.Author: hatetoflySFbayArea
Reviews.Content: A place to avoid. Had to ask for washclothes, never figured out how to control the temperature, no blanket in room (there was a heat wave the week before, and maybe they took the blankets out?). I should have stayed in Jersey.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location & affordable”
Reviews.Author: akimaro
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in May. The room was small but had enough space. The room was quiet and clean and aircondition worked well (it was hot when I visited NY). Subway #6 station was nearby and bus stop was close. Very convenient location and affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable”
Reviews.Author: tobywonder
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for $189 a night. Very expensive for what you get on absolute terms, but relative to other hotels in NY was cheaper by $100+. Those hotels would indeed be better, but I was looking to save money. Staff here are very good. I did not request anything special, but I felt they were all i) Nice, ii) Energetic, and iii) Capable. Bell hops are non-intrusive and ask you if you need help or not, without the angle for a tip. Check-in is fast. Honestly that was the best thing about the place. The "cons" - Value - Bathrooms could be improved. The toilet is like one of the models you see in an airport washroom.. a manual flush with a big steel handle on the side. You know the kind. - No separate soap for shower and sink - Key cards may stop working and will need to be refreshed - Thin walls/doors; I could hear those coming and going and talking quite easily from my room (and I was not near an elevator) - During the day, I could hear the noise from the street quite easily, although I was > 10 floors up. The whistle from the bellhop for example. Pros - Friendly staff - Location (starbucks connects to lobby) and Grand Central not a far walk - Clean - Informal vibe All in all a serviceable stay. I wouldn't stay here to impress anyone. But if I was nervous about staying somewhere else (safety, cleanliness, staff, stuffiness, etc.) I would stay here. I don't think this place is $189/night, but it is NY.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spacious room in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: windyliberty
Reviews.Content: Booking this off a special seen on Travelzoo definitely made this visit worthwhile. We booked a Jr. Suite and a Lexington Large. Although there was some minor confusion at check-in, overall our stay was pleasant. We ended up staying in the Lexington Large, which had a King Bed in 1 room, a pull out sofa in the living space, and two full bathrooms. The room was comfortable, clean, spacious, and was within a few blocks from the train. The Starbucks downstairs was convenient, although I personally recommend getting coffee from the locals in the carts (delicious coffee!). The hotel's driver delivered us back to the airport in a comfortable Lexus for slightly more than the average cab fair, money well spent! If you like to walk, the location is only 1 mile from Central Park South. Some nearby upscale hotels also put us at ease and helped us feel comfortable and safe in the location.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for exploring The Big Apple!”
Reviews.Author: k10044
Reviews.Content: Staff : Friendly and helpful upon check in. The bag storage was a bit steep at $2 a bag for a regular necessity for many travellers and is also offered free at many hotels. Good information was given by the concierge and the door man gave good advice on our return trip to the airport and saved us a lot of money by explaining the huge cost of going to Newark & said the best way was to go by train (how we got to Manhattan when we arrived.) The room : Not as bad as expected after reading some of the reviews on here. Quite a good view of Lexington avenue. A bit scruffy around the edges - marks on the walls, the sprinkler seemed to have sellotape wrapped around it?!? :S and the paint on the ceilings looked a bit tired. As my title says however it was a great base and as we were in the city which 'never sleeps' we literally only used the room for sleeping. Its more of a 3 star quality and lacks the luxury of a fridge. The bed was small by U.S standards but it did the job and we had no trouble sleeping. Raffles : We ate there for dinner one night and enjoyed the food. The prices were reasonable and the menu offered something for everyone. Staff were friendly and helpful. Overall : A wonderful holiday with a decent hotel. You are paying for the location but the seems to be the same case for all hotels in New York. I would stay again for the location as it was nice to be able to step just outside of the main busy tourist areas to rest and recuperate each night after days packed with shopping and sightseeing. Only about a ten minute walk from Times Square and everything else we wanted was close enough to walk to. Hotel didn't make the holiday but it was adequate for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Suit shredded to bits in laundry, no reimbursement”
Reviews.Author: fransbadenhorst
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here again. Their laundry department damaged my suit (20cm hole in the trousers) and shirt (2 x 5cm holes in the shirt), but declined to provide reimbursement for the suit. I was told that I had damaged the suit myself before handing in the suit, but they did confirm that they were responsible for the shirt... Seems very unlikely to me. Also, they claimed that they had not cleaned the suit, only pressed it, therefore there was no way they were at fault. Again, this is very unlikely as why would they press a damaged suit! All in all - very poor customer relationship.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel. near the action-but not directly in it”
Reviews.Author: asha314
Reviews.Content: we made a family trip to NYC with grandparents, us and children. the radisson was well located, comfortable, and value for money. A bit away from all the times square action, it was still close enough for the 2nd generation to walk. the grandp's had to take a cab, but it wasnt too expensive. the rooms are very comfy, and the one we stayed in had a small den attached- which a sofa bed for the children. it had 2 bathrooms, and was perfect for a family of 4. They even sent us a microwave oven to heat milk for the babies. There is a little coffee shop on the ground floor which serves amazing coffee and tea. McDonalds is a 2 minute walk, so the kids were happy. The staff was courteous and efficient. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for location”
Reviews.Author: tcan1122
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small but clean and tidy, the bed was small and very uncomfortable, the loo overflowed on the first night but was sorted the next morning, thankfully it was clean water. We had no greeting when we arrived, the front desk on checking in took about 20mins, the guy could'nt find our booking, he then asked for a credit card to secure 100 dollars it would be refunded once we left, which was fine but when we went shopping the next day we found that he had taken all the money which was pre loaded on to thae card before leaving the uk. When we queried it, the manager made us feel as though it was our fault, he agreed after a while that he would give us the full amount back, all we had was 1 sorry. The hotel was central with most things within walking distance, which made this the best thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Go for it !!!”
Reviews.Author: binita_kp
Reviews.Content: I feel at home here.the staff is exceptionally warm and helpful. Infact I now know them by name. I can figure out getting to anyplace from here. Its in d heart of d city. Bustling.a home away from home!!if its another vacation in ny its at d radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in New York city”
Reviews.Author: Shanklin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and found it to be all we could have wanted - clean tidy quiet in a safe area and with friendly helpful staff. The subway is only a couple of streets away and we walked to times square in next to no time - an enjoyable stroll in the evening and felt very safe. Surprised at some of the negative comments on here - we are New Zealanders and would say that for your average kiwi or aussie they would find this hotel would fulfill their needs more than adequately - cant really comment on other nationalities as they may be more fussy. We didnt eat in the hotel - had some snacks with us for breakfast and then happily ate the nearby street cart food - delicious and cheap. Be a bit advventurous and go with the spirit of New York City - do what the locals do and you will really enjoy this hotel. Again the staff were great - real friendly and helpful which seems to be the American way. Also our room was quiet and restful. Thanks for a great stay - we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and hopefully someday we will be back in this great city!

Reviews.Title: “Average-Great location!”
Reviews.Author: SimTennessee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a friend for 3 nights. I booked it on Priceline for $160 a night and called the hotel to request double beds and they said that they couldn't promise double beds. At check in, the front desk staff said that the hotel was booked but we could get double beds for $40 additional per night. Uh...no! Anyway, we checked in and our room literally was the smallest room in the hotel, which is what the front desk staff told us. The bed was soooo small it was supposed to be a full but I think it was a twin. Other than the size, the room was nice and had a flatscreen TV and a desk, which we didn't need. I would have preferred a frig and a microwave. The bathroom sink was slow to drain and we had to request extra wash cloths everyday because they kept giving us only one even though there were two people in the room. I went to the ice machine to get ice and the entire front of the machine fell off but the machine still worked however, the next night, the machine was fixed. All and all, the location was great, close to Grand Central and 51st street subway. Starbucks is in the hotel so that was a plus. Redstone Cafe is across the street and has great breakfast and lunch. I would stay in the hotel again if I had a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but not very central”
Reviews.Author: felicity1958
Reviews.Content: stayed at the above for 4 days, room clean & fit for purpose. lobby staff friendly & helpful depending who was on duty. whilst it was in NY to walk to times square was at least 20mins, if you can't walk very far at one time like my spouse it meant taxis all the time. I would reccomend somewhere like the Wellington near central park, at least its near times & there are a lot of coffee shops to stop at. The Raddison is in what I would call a very corporate area, lots of offices etc. but, they have a coffee shop attached to the hotel called Raffles, prices very expensive, breakfast costed at least $50 dollars & that was for scrambled eggs & toast, a cheesburger & frozen chips for two + 1 beer 1 glass of wine $80 dollars!!!! wouldn't have minded but the cheese was slices not even grated cheddar. Not a lot of cheap deli's near by. the other problem was they decided to set up road works on sat night! all night! the same again on sunday night, it was very noisy & impossible to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: alhlms
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here May 20-23 and were very impressed with the staff and how helpful they were.
