Breda at the front desk checked us in and was fantastic, the hotel checked our bags for us because we arrived early in the morning and they had our room ready earlier than expected too. Romel (sp?) and another woman at the Concierge desk were also great. He made a reservation at a wonderful restaurant for us and also called ahead to let them know we had a show to get to. He also gave us advice on modes of transportation to take too for different areas in the city. The hotel has nice features like a business center, Starbucks in one of it's entrances and "Sleep Number" beds. I've been to NYC a few times and liked this hotel's location the best, so close to 5th Avenue for anyone looking to be close to the shopping action and Rockefeller Center. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but otherwise outdated and in serious need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: nachto
Reviews.Content: Old and Shabby hotel. Room was cold to the point of shivering. No heating in May as a matter of policy, so had to get a heater into the room in order to make it livable. WiFi charged at the regular outrageous rates (when will that ever stop?). Location the only thing it has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “toilet did not flush,poor room service, AC was not working right!”
Reviews.Author: afcc426
Reviews.Content: checked in for 3 nights. since day 1, the ac was not working well. we had to call engineering to check the ac. HE said it was working fine but clearly the thermostat wasnt right. he advised us to OPEN THE WINDOWS if we wanted cooler air. the toilet flush wasnt working so they had to send up someone everytime we used the toilet. imagine the hassle. we paid 300+ per night because we wanted a 3 star hotel quality but to our dismay this was way worse than the service of a cheap hotel. on the 2nd day i finally went to speak with the hotel manager, irina. she was not very helpful. they said they were fully booked so they couldnt move us to another room. she was not very accommodating and was rolling her eyes every so often. we tried to talk to her in a polite manner but we did not like the way she treated us generally, the location was good but better find a hotel room near the area but dont book with radisson lexington! the experience was horrible

Reviews.Title: “High price for good location”
Reviews.Author: KasperJ
Reviews.Content: Located not to far away from Grand Central, this is a nice location. The hotel is ok for business, but we paid 320 per night. Ok room. my collegues were not too happy with their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alexis171
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March 2011 for 5 nights and while the hotel is not 5 star deluxe I think it is really really good! The rooms are small but then again it's New York and how much time do you really spend in your room! We found all the staff to be very helpful especially Yelena, Armanda and Laylaa. The location is perfect if you want to be in the heart of it all but still able to get a nights sleep! The Starbucks is a real blessing, everytime you pop back with your shopping you can get a caffine hit! I work in a Travel Agents and I would definately recommend this hotel to all of my customers!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: Mouchoir
Reviews.Content: Dimly-lit oppressive corridors led to a room which had seen better days. There were no duvets on the beds and only one towel in the bathroom and we ended up waiting an hour for these to be fetched. The man at the door passed them to us and we were left to make the beds ourselves. Oddly another member of staff arrived for a 'room check' and we never did discern the true purpose of his visit. The window wouldn't shut, and to our horror, the shower and bath didn't work. A stand-up wash proved equally difficult as the sink wouldn't drain. The pillows smelt musty and we woke every morning with bad allergy symptoms. Starbucks downstairs was the only consolation - and we certainly needed the caffeine after a night in this room!

Reviews.Title: “'Service' is focused on handling customer complaints rather than preventing them in the first place”
Reviews.Author: SMCTM
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel in central Manhattan is very good but this then supports a price which is not justified by the service. We had paid for the room only in advance and somehow this gave us the feeling that we were treated in an inferior way.Over a period of 5 days we faced the following issues; -Although we reserved a double room 2 months previously, upon arrival we were allocated a twin and were told that only 'smoking' double rooms were available -The twin beds were separated by a desk and not possible to put together because the room was so small. -No room service or breakfast menus available in the room. -The airconditioning did not work and needed to be fixed twice. -One day we left the room at 9 am but the room was not serviced when we returned at 4 pm. After complaining twice someone came to service the room at 4.45 but then,due to 'staff regulations' we were obliged to leave the room whicle it was being cleaned. As compensation we were given a free breakfast but only with a limited menu -It is not possible to order a coffee in the lounge/bar area-you have to queue at the adjoining Starbucks. For this hotel good service seems to be interpreted as dealing with customer complaints and offering tokens as compensation rather than preventing complaints in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - brilliant location & rooms - would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: curly_karensa
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel during the sale for my 27th birthday and would highly recommend it. Superb location within walking distance of grand central station, rockafella centre etc. On arrival we were told we had a free upgrade as we were goldpoints members - this isn't as fancy as it sounds it was a card we got free of charge for staying at a radisson in Birmingham, so get one if you can as we really appreciated the upgrade. Room was spotless and though not spacious by other city standards, for NY was really quite roomy! Trip was amazing - everyone should visit New York at least once. My only complaint was that the concierges didn't seem to know what they were takiing about - although the porter was good. Would definately recommend the Radisson!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Karanpanthaky
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very good location, and great staff. The hotel is very well maintained, lovely staff, lots of great shopping close by. Its very close to the subway so travelling in and around the city is a breeze. The rooms are very nice and feature all the luxuries you'd expect from a 5star property. I definitely recommend staying at this magnificent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: niklashalen
Reviews.Content: As part of our honeymoon in early April 2011 we stayed at this hotel. From our previous experiences in New York we were very happy with this hotel. Location good, only like 10 min walk from time square. Rooms were in our opinion surprisingly spacious for NY Hotel. We never tried the room service but the breakfast restaurant downstairs made our mornings. There are as well a sushi bar and an indian restaurant in the lobby. Overall, nice and clean, enough space and within a decent price range for a NY hotel. We recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: KentTraveller1
Reviews.Content: The only reason that we chose to stay in this hotel was that we were planning to travel around the US and wanted somewhere where we could leave our luggage. Very few hotels in NY offer this so when the Radisson charged us $2 a day per bag we decided to go with this hotel even though from reading the reviews it appeared to be a very average choice. The hotel is in a great location a few blocks from 5th Ave and the subway is about a 5-10mins walk. The hotel itself is very busy as it caters for the airline crews. Front reception looked fine but on the 2 occasions that we stayed we found the rooms were small (usual for NY standards). Once the suitcases were in the room there wasn't much walking space. Rooms were very basic looked like they needed a refurb as some of the wallpaper was peeling away from the walls. I didn't feel comfortable walking around bare feet on the carpet as it felt a bit tacky. Beds weren't particularly comfortable it was OK considering we only spent a few nights and we always came back to our rooms exhausted. Bathroom was also a be shabby looking but it was a fair size bathroom. The only reason I would recommend this hotel is for its location and if you need to leave any luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but a bit tired at the edges”
Reviews.Author: TeamCervinia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my brother for four nights in February. I know New York is expensive but given this is a four star hotel, the room was pretty small and the decor quite tired. There was no fridge, which although not essential would have been useful for keeping drinks cool and I expect to see one in a four star hotel. The bathroom was very clean and the room itself, although the windows were filthy which spoiled the view a bit. The heating/air-con system seems dated and was quite noisy as a result, and the windows could do with some double glazing to help shut out the noise of other air-con units and traffic not to mention the cold February air. The desk staff were friendly and helpful, although we did request more than once that our towels and bed sheets not be changed everyday (this seems totally unnecessary to me) but this was ignored. Also, is a $10 per day charge for using the internet really reasonable?? Overall, we were pleased with the location of the hotel as it's handy for exploring Midtown and not too far from the Downtown area, but I wouldn't rush back. The price was reasonable and it was largely clean and comfortable, but next time I think I'd like a little more New York glamour...

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend, but only if you get a good price”
Reviews.Author: djmccreedy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. That's the best point. The rooms are small, ok... but at least they were clean. Like many hotels in NY, it could do with a bit of a renovation, but don't let that put you off. I must say that we had to change rooms twice, because of huge air conditioning units right outside the window making a lot of noise. While we got a better and quieter room on the six floor (the other two were on the 3rd) the service given by the receptionist left a lot to be desired. She was the only member of staff who showed this lack of customer care, however. Everyone else was very friendly and gave us great service. The restaurant, we went to once, and we enjoyed it. It is, however, overpriced. So is Raffles, the American Bistro. While I don't want to take business away from them, if you want a cheaper breakfast then go over the road to Longwood Gourmet Deli (on Lex Ave). All in all, a pleasant stay, but I will shop around a bit the next time I go. If all else fails, then I would be happy to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Iceageprincess
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel. It was my first time in New York and I had no difficulty making my way there from the station. On arrival I found the reception staff super friendly and I was upgraded to a bigger room on the 24th floor with a good view which I was more than happy with. All I would say against the room was that it was a bit cold for me and took a long time to get warm when I came back to the hotel at night, then the switchover from "just warm" to "stuffy" was very quick so then I turned the heating off and woke up cold in the morning. Perhaps an extra blanket would have helped! I also echo what previous posters have said about there being a lack of tea and coffee making facilities and very few plug sockets. Also the furniture was a little tired. However, I wasn't disturbed by any noise, the staff were helpful and there were no bedbugs! Which I had been paranoid about before arriving in New York due to all the news lately about them. So despite the cold I would stay again. With one warning... when it came to billing I was billed the cost of the room and then also the cost of the room plus a $200 "pre-authorisation" fee. According to the Radisson Lexington accounts dept. my (Irish) bank should have treated this as one transaction in two parts, but as it treated it as two transactions I was effectively billed twice, although the second payment will eventually come back to me. It was a pain to end a generaly pleasant experience to coming home $800 the worse off due to this "pre-authorisation" business! *dislike*

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Papalisa
Reviews.Content: First of all the good point about the hotel was the location, it was very central and was a good base to discover New York. The room was very small but we has expected that due to it being in the centre of New York. The hotel itself and the room that we stayed in was well decorated but not very clean which is a shame because that let it down a lot and could easilly be rectified. The heating system in the room was very noisey and even when we turned it off we still couldn't sleep because it was still very loud. Although we didnt see any, we suspect that there was bed bugs in our room as after a couple of days I had a few very large itchy marks on my legs! I know this is common in New York but it's still not what you would expect from a 4 star hotel. What was most disappointing about the hotel was that on our last day we recieved a sheet of paper which was posted through the bottom of our door it stated we owed money and that it would be charged to our credit card, it did not say what the money was for. When we checked out we queried what the charge was for and we were told by the receptionist that it was for drinks that we had in the hotel bar. We explained that we had not had any drinks in the bar and that there must be some mistake! The receptionist apologised and said she had removed the charge. On return when my husband checked our credit card statement he noticed that we had been charged!! We e-mailed the hotel asking them to refund the money and we have still not heard anything from them!!! Very disappointed!! and for that reason we would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was just right for our stay”
Reviews.Author: shoes1965
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on Priceline for $120. I emailed them ahead of time to ask for a room with 2 beds which they were able to give us, but for an additional $80. Since we had our son and his friend with us, we had no choice. I still feel that it was a good deal for $200, in NYC. The location was excellent. We arrived by train at Grand Central station which was a 5 minute walk away. The common areas of the hotel are very impressive with a lovely lobby. Times Square, Central Park , Rockefeller Center, Chrylser Building, St. Patrick's Cathedral were all less than 20-25 minutes away by foot. Desk staff was surprisingly aloof when we checked in, but because our stay was short, only one night, it didn't matter. The room we ended up with was plenty large enough with 2 bathrooms which was great. It was clean with modern amenities, but they had missed some details during renovation. For example, paint and paper were peeling in places and paint on the trim was chipping in some areas. None of this was enough to bother us. What did bother us was the bed. They had sleep number beds which some folks might like, but it was incredibly uncomfortable for us, and caused me to have a terrible night's sleep. We ate breakfast at a deli across the street which was awesome. We made the decision to stay clear of the onsite restaurant due to steep prices. Having Starbucks in the hotel was a definite plus for my husband who is a huge fan. Overall, our stay was great and we have no major complaints. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: liv_ad84
Reviews.Content: March 11: What can I say about this Hotel? From the moment we arrived, we had a completely hassle free, enjoyable stay. They say first impressions are important and this hotel doesn't disappoint. The lobby is very impressive and all the staff so friendly and helpful; not only that, but it is clean and well looked after. It was busy which is always a good sign and had a good vibrant atmosphere. The hotel managers were close by at reception and so friendly and helpful which, again, I think says a lot about the class of hotel. I had only booked a petite room and so was expecting a very small room - however it was what i would call a normal size and very neat and tidy with fantastic views. It was also very clean with good decor. Perfect for what my mum and I needed on our NY shopping trip! Handily there was an adjoining Starbucks and Raffles cafe to the hotel which made early morning jetlag barable. But i'm yet to get to the bonus points of this hotel... The location! Amazing. Right next to Lexington avenue, it is perfect for shopping, sight seeing and within easy reach of the subway if you want to go further. The hotel were very helpful in advising good places to eat and drink, although a couple of nights we had room service and ate at the hotel's own restaurant which was also very good. I will definately be booking to stay at this hotel again when i return to New York for next year's trip.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: rockstar89
Reviews.Content: First of all, I didn't pay for this, my company did, so there are only a few things I can complain about. Other things were great. The location is out of this world. Only blocks to Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Plaza, Times Square and other great sights. The lobby is very nice. When I checked in they said they were upgrading me to a Jr. Suite 'just because.' That ended up coming in handy as my family was joining me a couple of days later. So far, I am very happy. Upon first exam, the room was just plain old and plain. The carpet was threadbare indoor/outdoor carpet. The bathroom had super old fixtures and a badly stained bathtub. The couch cushions were extremely stained. There was however a large HD flatscreen TV and nice king size bed. I got in the bed and pumped up the Sleep Number bed and watched a little tube. No problems. Until 3 am when I woke up 'in a hole.' The sleep number bed had deflated and wouldn't go back up! Ugh. It worked this way sporadically throughout the trip. When my family joined on Saturday night we couldn't even begin to relax as the club two doors down BLASTED hip hop music that was literally FELT as well as heard. It had already started around 10p when we arrived back in our room. We 'took it' for about an hour and then I called guest services to complain. She nonchalantly said it was gonna go on until 4am and then hung up on me! I immediately called the manager who came to our room to discuss with us. She was very helpful in 'trying' to remedy, but of course the hotel was oversold and there was no where to move us. So, we were stuck, along with our neighbors who popped their heads out to complain as well. She promised to call the club and complain. It must have worked because around 1am the music miraculously stopped and we were able to sleep. The manager graciously gave us free breakfast during our stay which was nice, esp. since we wouldn't have eaten at Raffles to save our lives since a simple breakfast of 2 eggs, toast and coffee was $18.95! So, I hear the price of this place is better than many. Just make sure you are on a high floor (away from the club) and make sure you get a remodeled room and you will be fine. A cheap price and wonderful location could be worth putting up with a few inconveniences in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor rooms...”
Reviews.Author: sandraregina
Reviews.Content: Very well located, close to Metro Stations, restaurants, stores... Good reception desk. Room was very small, unconfortable. Bed was terrible, too small, no sleep quality. Very noisy. Lobby was allways full, many air companies people around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Great Place”
Reviews.Author: amarilis_abreu
Reviews.Content: We got it for $100 a night at Priceline Bidding Place so we had no idea what to expect. Everything was great, we got a 'Petite Room w/Full size bed for 2' whitch was way too small but came to the lobby and switched it to a queen room w/a sleep number bed and it was great. Service is impecable, have not seen a bug and it has everything you need to make your stay pleasant and relaxing. Room size is not too big but realisticly, how long are you planning on staying in the room in the heart of NYC? Great Location, blocks away from Rockefeller and Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best experience”
Reviews.Author: austinwb
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a large group and unfortunately everyone in our group had a bad experience with hotel booking prior to arrival and hotel billing at the end of our stay. The rooms are small and drafty and I was in an upgraded room. I did enjoy the bar area and the fact a Starbucks is connected.

Reviews.Title: “I don't want to recommend at all.”
Reviews.Author: tampopo79
Reviews.Content: The location was good. I think it's the only good point. If you're fortunate, you won't meet the roaches in your room & bathroom. Moreover, the bed isn't clean either. I will never stay at ths hotel. If you don't mind cleanliness, it could be not bad. but if you want to stay at the clean & cozy hotel, this hotel will be the worst choice.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings: Great Location, Good Staff but tired decor - could be better”
Reviews.Author: 007solotraveler
Reviews.Content: Mixed feelings on this hotel - had a great large room King size executive on 14th floor - with 2 bathrooms which were on small side considering the room. Storage in room could do with being better, the furniture was modern and sleek - had a fridge, microwave - didn't work very well the one time I used it for popcorn on Oscar night! But no coffee or tea making facility which was odd - probably explains the Starbucks adjacent to the lobby! Room felt that it needed decorating as was dark - common areas of hotels lifts/corridors needed refreshing. Coffee Shop cafe was great. Location excellent - everywhere easily accessable by walking or subway. Been to New York many times - but first at this hotel - overall Good value for the rate paid - but compared to other Radissons that I've stayed at around the world this one was a disappointment. So as I say mixed feelings! For the right price I would recommend it but not at a high rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: 26travellers
Reviews.Content: Prompt check in on arrival at hotel, we called our room the penthouse suite (more like small attic room) as it was located at the very top of the hotel with a velux type window. The room was very clean and comfortable and as we spent very little time in it it wasn't a problem. The girl on the concierge desk was very helpful but we did get ripped off buying our theatre tickets through her rather than direct from the theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: KirstyG81
Reviews.Content: I had no idea we were even going to NYC for Valentines day! Having been before, but only stayed in a Youth Hostel I was very excited. On arrival at the hotel - which was easy to get to using the subway and train from Newark Airport - we were met with a free room upgrade. Once I saw the size of the room I was glad we'd got one. I knew before we went that NYC hotel rooms were small (the same as most big cities in the world) so it was nice to have a room that you could easily walk around the bed, dump 2 big suitcases wherever we wanted and have a bathroom big enough for the both of us to get ready in. I must admit, our 5 day stay was MADE by the concierge service at the hotel - and especially by Yelena Kreper. What a brilliant person! She was permanently happy to see us (and everyone else) and knew EVERYTHING! She was a font of knowledge and a big ray of sunshine to us jet lagged and tired Brits. In short, a great hotel, in a great location (with a Starbucks in it - that was a saviour!), with great staff. I'd love to stay there again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to the Bar is a must!”
Reviews.Author: Mj_dalive1
Reviews.Content: Was out for Christmas at the hotel and everything was within walking distance to the hotel. Loved the bartender, very chatty and informative, seemed like he liked his job and made us feel welcome. Only bummer was the Valet parking.....they would park for you but you would have to get it on your own......not a biggie as the other amenities were fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but.....”
Reviews.Author: PurpleWorldUk
Reviews.Content: the room (we had an 8th floor executive king) needs the details fixing. The soft furnishings are very good, the bed is large and comfortable but as shown in other guests photo's the corners of the room, bathroom and the cupboard for the safe all need improving. Despite this we walked out to all the sights from this hotel as it is an excellent location. Be aware that as with all major cities the noise from street level in 24 hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, price and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Helena_Brazil
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in February .. I arrived on a Sunday and leave on Thursday, my friend and I got a promotion and pay $ 79 per night, room petite is wonderful, the staff are very polite! despite breakfast was not included there is a Starbucks beside the hotel! I loved it..

Reviews.Title: “Sealed windows would be great...”
Reviews.Author: msspiderman
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights on a business trip and have choose it just because of the location. HD TV is ok but not too many channels available. WiFi costs a fortune in rooms -> is this really 2011? The mattress can be individually changed from weak to strong which we have never seen before - kind of cool but it doesn't really help if the noise from Lexington Ave. is so dominant that you can hardly sleep. Heating was great (seperate from AC) but as it was freezing outside so you could see the curtains streaming in the wind even if windows were closed. Other than the TV and the fancy bed the furniture is old and the bathroom is nothing special. However, our room was clean (so you could see the "patina" of everything). But one has to say - the price was OK! We compared it with the W Hotel on Lex which is just one block up north and it was half the price. We rather spent the difference at the Whiskey Blue bar! There is a Starbucks within the lobby which is very convenient if you ain't happy with the prices of the breakfast buffet. Would we go there again? Maybe, but we would ask for a room on the backside!

Reviews.Title: “unpleasant mishap”
Reviews.Author: nuthurralt
Reviews.Content: We booked ( directly at the hotel internet site ) an "executive room" bigger and more expensive than a "superior room" ( both with king bed). When we arrived, they gave us a very small "superior" room, but at the end of our stay, we payed it as an executive room! Useless complaints! Second, and very important, on 2 over 4 days, they didnt' clean the room! Hotel to avoid

Reviews.Title: “Small and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Greg7200
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, smallest room i have ever slept in including my bathroom. 150 square feet. Walls were peeling and windows did not work. No pressure in the shower and we had to travel 8 floors for ice. Rug was indoor outdoor carpet and bed was lumpy and sheets did not fit. Bed was at least 5 years old based on tag. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: dgor82
Reviews.Content: room 1732: 30.01.2010 - red spots on the bathroom floor towel - 2 curly black hair in bed - wireless lan unusably slow - much smaller room than described and showed on the website as "executive" - general cleanliness (spots and scratches on the main door) - long black hair on the hair dryer - no free plugs next to bed - no shower gel (only shampoo) - white stains on bed over-cover - room is too cold, heating can't be adjusted, window lets cold air in rooom 1521: 31.01.2011 -"high speed internet" not available, front desk hung up on me, when I inquired about it - blanket / comforter: red stains and black dust, request for new one at front disk ignored, i call again after 20 min, and again after 10 min. the new blanket was ALSO dirty and it came without sheets - vent filter completely airtight from thick dust and dirt - large amount of dust and dirt on the windows - water in the shower / bath tub does NOT drain 01.02.2011: - room-service was there but did not provide new shampoo and conditioner (open, almost used-up packages in the shower) 02.02.2011 - extremely loud water tap - room-service did not put new shampoo and condt. - ironing board has a sharp bulge - cupboard keeps opening because it is standing downhill, my girl hurt herself Conclusion: NEVER AGAIN! P.S. After hearing my complaints, the front-desk had the decency of upgrading my room and waiving the "third bed fee" for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, value for money but room lacked the basics”
Reviews.Author: EnjoythejourneySA
Reviews.Content: After plenty hours of searching TripAdvisor we came across a special being offered by Radisson, very excited we booked and paid, and although some of the online review were critical they were not wrong, this is a Radisson after all! Overall the room could have been more comfortable and guest friendly but considering all we wanted was a clean room in a good area for a few nights it was sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless!”
Reviews.Author: Michael_S570
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on a standard room on the hotel's website, and they gave me a complementary upgrade to a junior suite on arrival! The suite was very nicely furnished and spotlessly clean. Check in and check out were a breeze. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location was perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: cougs88
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel primarily due to the location and we weren't disappointed. It was perfect for walking to all the main attractions. I had emailed the hotel in advance to say it was my boyfriends birthday and to our surprise when we checked in we were given an upgrade. The receptionist and all other staff could not have been more friendly with the exception of the girl who checked us out whom was extremely bored and rude. The rooms were a good size for New York. Yes the rooms are a bit dated in that there are chips in the bathroom and the decor could be updated but they were spotlessly clean and the bed was comfortable and for the amount of time you spend in the hotel it was perfect. It has a Starbucks in the lobby perfect for early morning coffee in bed! For what we wanted out of our NY hotel and for the price we paid I couldn't fault this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again here”
Reviews.Author: sparling1952
Reviews.Content: Judging by other comments about this hotel, it must have changed a bit since we stayed there in 1995. The room we had was small, dark, smelt as if someone had chucked breadfast cereal and milk under the bed, and the sheets & blankets looked as if they hadn't been changed for weeks. I've seen bigger understair cupboards. The carpet in the outside hall was threadbare and missing in places. The previous occupant's case and jacket were still in the room, as was some of the rubbish. In spite of a visit to the front desk and then a phone call, no-one came to move the stuff out. It was only when I threatened to put the bag and everything else outside in the corridor that any action was taken. The evening before we were due to leave (and had only stayed at this hotel because it was where our Cosmos Coach trip was picking up from) I had an irate desk clerk ring me and say what were we doing in that room as we should have been in another! Would we like to move. I said no. For about 12 hours? No. On the strength of that visit I would never go back to the Lexington

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Tasmangr77
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is it's location and nothing else! We went with my wife for our honey moon and our reservations clearly indicated that and we also told them on checkin! Of course they are not obliged to upgrade the room but you would expect that knowing we were coming around six months in advance that at least the room even a normal one would be a descent room and ready upon arrival at 4 in the afternoon instead we waited for a while till she found a room that was smaller than my cabin in the cruise we went later the next week. I would describe it as hole! Extremely small and ugly. Adding on that the indiference of the reception staff was truly annoying. They were in no apparent mood to help with nothing. I asked them to book me a taxi for next morning for the airport for any early flight and the lady after looking at me in contempt she suggested I walk out and call a cab in the street since there are hundreds passing by!

Reviews.Title: “First New York visit, and would stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: wastingtime33
Reviews.Content: My first time to New York and I chose the Radisson based off a family members suggestion. He wasn't wrong one bit about recommending this hotel. It was clean, we had a spacious executive room with 2 bathrooms, king bed, desk and television. It was located next to the elevator shafts so there was a little noise heard in the room, but not a big deal to us. The room was clean, the hotel staff was nice and helpful when we asked for recommendations on things to do. The location of the hotel we thought was great. Within walking distance to Rockefeller, Times Square and surrounding areas, and we even walked the mile to The Empire State building. There are plenty of places to eat around the hotel so you won't have to worry about that. It's location 4/5 blocks north of Grand Central turned out to be great for us because that is where we came into the city at, and we were able to walk from there to the hotel. Would definitely stay again the next time we are in New York!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and great Staff”
Reviews.Author: 321duesseldorf
Reviews.Content: We went to the Lexington the second time after our first visit in 2009. Had a very good deal because the hotels own website showed a cheaper price than radisson.com so we got the "Best online rate guarantee" from Radisson what took another 25% off from the cheapest price. Our room was not ready upon arrival 12pm so we had to leave our luggage at the hotel (for no charge) and come back later what was no problem for us. When coming back we received a very friendly and warm welcome (thanks again to Irina). Our Executive room was upgraded to Junior Suite (we are goldpoints gold elite member) and we had free Internet in our room (all goldpoints members get that but you have to ask at front desk). As an extra we got vouchers for the hotel bar (very friendly staff in the bar too) and 2 bottles of water for the room. The room actually had 2 bathrooms (great in the morning, saved a lot time), a small living room with working desk, TV and sofa and the bedroom with slepp number bed. Although you can see that the hotel is old, the rooms were well maintained. Windows could have been better isolated but heating worked good enough to keep the room warm. The dust wiping could have been better. WiFi in the room worked good except of day 3 when we were not able to make a connection. In the fourth night a 6-7 cm cockroach was walking right through our room. We killed it with a bottle and put it in the toilet. DidnÂ´t want to call front desk at midnight and wait til they send somebody. Checkout was another experience... the woman who checked us out was chewing gum and not very interested in us. DidnÂ´t look at us, no "How was your stay"...nothing. So we did not mention the cockroach...what would it change. All other members of staff were very heplful and friendly when asking questions. The Lexingtons location is perfect to explore the city. From JFK Airtrain Station Suthpin Blvd. you can take the "E" train to 53rd/Lexington and walk in 5 minutes to hotel. The "Habana Room" Bar in the hotel offers breakfast too, tried it one morning and have to say that it was okay but you can get more for the same price when checking out Cafe Metro or Pret a Manger just 2 minutes from hotel when you walk on Lexington to Grand Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: UrquhartHK
Reviews.Content: Headline says it all. Rooms are on the smaller side. Often tend to be grubby or slightly worn. Service so so. Location is very good but I find the hotel very noisy. Its cheap but it has to be.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, but location makes up for it”
Reviews.Author: ruthiepoole
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, you can walk to Times Square, central Park, Empire state all very easily. The hotel is huge, 26 floors. Our first room was on floor 25 & you can still hear the buzz of Manhattan from up here. We had to move as the bed was broken, this was done quite easily & not much of a hastle. Our second room was floor 12 & the noise was quite loud from outside. We had no problem with bed bugs at all. We had a standard room & this was quite small, would not have wanted a petite room. The bathroom is quite small & a little dated but we were not in the room much. Opposite is a great pizza bar call Aperitivo, it was delicious. If you get a good rate this is a great hotel to stay in because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & value; NO bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: MtDiablo
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay at the Radisson/Lexington because of some recent TripAdvisor reports of bedbugs. No worries. I had a modest-sized -- but well-equipped (TV & WiFi) -- clean, well-lit room, with comfortable queen size bed. Due to the winter storm approaching January 11, 2011, I had to check out one day early and 2+ hours after the noon checkout -- no additional day or cancel fee. Cheerful, prompt service. This is not a luxury hotel, but it is really nice. Location is terrific. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in new york”
Reviews.Author: RobertsPaul1
Reviews.Content: Booked it through ebooker got a good deal hotel was good for the value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in mid town Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: rosared1
Reviews.Content: We spent one week in the hotel and were very impressed by the professionalism of all the staff we had contact with. Front desk, bell hops, restaurant and housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast and parking package is a great value. The rooms are very clean, linen and bed were totally modern. The room itself was fairly up to date and large. The hotel location at 48th is a very convenient 15-minute walk or very short taxi ride to Broadway and most theaters.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jon7099
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 1/7/2011 to 1/10/2011 and had a great experience. Was the room small, yes. Did it need to be updated, yes. That being said, this hotel is in an excellent location. The staff were just great and were very helpful. They even let me check in a bit early and gave me an upgrade! The room was very comfortable and I slept very well on the mattress which is a sleep adjustable mattress. Very little noise as I was on the 20th floor but you do hear the normal street sounds that come with being in NYC. if it bothers you that much bring ear plugs. The fitness center was more then acceptable. I did not eat in the hotel but come on, you are in one of the greatest cities in the world with incredible restaurants! All in all I will definitely stay at the Radisson again and I would not hesitate to recommend it. You cannot beat the value and location!

Reviews.Title: “really i love it”
Reviews.Author: koookyEgypt
Reviews.Content: the hotel has a wounderful location it is located in 5th avenue which is considered one of the most elegant avenues in new york it is very close to time square ,shopping area and most of newyork attraction the staff was very friendly ,the hotel itself was very clean ,the room was very big and totally quite really i love it and i will return to newyork next summer and i will stay again in this charming hotel really i recommended it to every body

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: Firenze2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from the 18th to the 23rd of December. I'd always wanted to go to New York at Christmas and I wasn't disappointed. The hotel is in an excellent location for all of the major sights. The lady at the front desk was lovely and allowed us to check in early. The room was much bigger than I was expecting after reading the comments on here, and everything was very clean and in order. The bed was most comfortable and we slept like babies every night. Yes there was some traffic noise (we were on the 14th floor) but you're in New York; the city that never sleeps. Besides, after all of the sightseeing it didn't keep us awake. A special thank you must go to Edwin the conceirge who helped us to locate a few places we wanted to see, and who also recommended and arranged a table for us at a jazz club in Greenwich Village (Garage) which was amazing. Across the road there's a good little Deli (Longwood I think it was called) where you can get a bagel with lox for $2.50. One small gripe is that due to a late flight we needed to leave our luggage at the hotel in order to be able to look around. Each bag at left luggage was charged at $2, and with extra Christmas purchases this proved quite expensive. I've never heard of a 4 star hotel doing this before. But this wouldn't stop me from staying here again. All members of staff that we encountered were very friendly, and we would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an excellent location in comfortable surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rangers1956
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Raisson NYC and although the staff were very pleasant and helpful, it is definately not a 4 star hotel. The first room we were allocated was tiny, had no cold water and no drawer space. The air conditioning did not work properly. We asked to be moved which they did immediately but the next room was over a generator which started and stopped all night. The rooms are badly in need of renovation and the cleaners although pleasant are careless. On returning to my room one day my mobile phone was missing from the charger. I thought it had been stolen but eventually found it under the bed. The cleaner must have knocked it with her sweeper and not bothered picking it up. We flew out to Dublin where we booked in to a 4 star hotel and that was what a 4 star hotel should be!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: CarolNorthWalesUk
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Radisson Lexington on the 18th Dec 2010, for my husbands 50th birthday, and we were very pleased.The service was excellent, the staff couldnt do enough. The Lobby was very impressive with a beautiful christmas tree. Our room was 1117, with NO complaints at all.(and NO bedbugs). We were in a standard room, it was lovely and warm, the bed was so comfy when we got home we've deceided to buy a new bed, (i always thought my bed was comfy). We had a Starbucks next to the lobby for our early morning coffee and Raffles for our evening meal were they served gorgeous food. All in all our 4 night stay in New York was excellent. Thank you very much Radisson Lexington X

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Trvlchic5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Lexington Hotel from December 24- December 25th. We booked a package through the website for free parking and 2 free american breakfast at Raffles. Check in was very quick and the staff was very professional. During the check in, it was identified that we were gold points members and we received a complimentary upgrade. The room the booked us in was the deluxe room. The room was very clean and spacious (for NYC). The hotel is very close to the major attractions. The breakfast was OK, nothing special. If the breakfast was not included in the package we would not have eaten at Raffles. The food was expensive. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a hotel close to all the mid town Manhattan attractions in a mid range price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BrissieTraveller83
Reviews.Content: When looking for this hotel, there were two websites to book it on. www.radisson.com and the other was www.radissonlexingtonnyc.com. The later had much cheaper rates then the former. When I phoned to ask why, they said that the only legit website was radisson.com. So we booked on radisson.com and then completed a price beat form, and what do ya know, they beat it. So it turned out very cheap. The rooms are small, so I wouldn't have anything below the Executive room with King bed. We were on the 10th floor and there was still a fair bit of street noise - perhaps ask for a higher up room. Great location in mid town Manhatten. Only a few blocks to 5th and about 10-15mins to the Park. 5 mins to Grand Central Station. Staff were very good, however found it a bit strange that housekeeping tended to clean up our belongings maybe too much. Great place across the road Cnr Lexington and 48th for breakfast. $2.49 for egg and bacon roll!! The cafe downstairs next to the Starbucks was a bit expensive and even charged for a pot of hot water! Overall, good location and hotel, just get a big room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, small but comfortable room with a few issues.”
Reviews.Author: lobo218
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Lexington after winning on Priceline for $160 but the room was way too small so we upgraded to a Junior Suite fon the 26th floor for an additional $80/night. This gave us a one bedroom suite with a queen bed and a "living room" with a pull out sleeper sofa and a second bathroom. WIth the sofa open, my daughter and granddaughter could not manuever around the room at all, we were not provided any bedding at all for the sofabed and waited almost an hour after calling down for it. There was a mini fridge in that room but, again, with the sofabed open, we could not access it. The bathtub in the livingroom bath did not drain and was not fixed during our stay. We have stayed in many Manhattan hotels, visiting 1 -2 times a year and this was by far the smallest room we have encountered but the location was good, easy walk to Grand Central. That being said, our sleep number bed was great but the pillows were the best I have ever experienced in a hotel and I would like to find out how/where I can buy some. We had no bedbug problems. Another nice feature was the Starbucks in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value and no problems.....”
Reviews.Author: alwaysevol000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel between Dec. 17th and Dec. 20th. Payed about 165 a night via a priceline auction (including taxes and fees). The good: - They let us check in early - good front desk service - room was clean - no bed bugs (There were reports that there have been - I checked everything very carefully when we arrived) - decent location close to subway, 5th ave., park, times square - I liked the shower pressure The not so good: - drafty window in the bathrooms which has been mentioned multiple times - room has been updated, but not 100% updated - noisy at night via the streets below and hallways

Reviews.Title: “great service and location”
Reviews.Author: mrcraven
Reviews.Content: we stayed during the last week of november when we arrived we were greeted by the hotel staff which were very helpful in giving us directions to the nearest attractions and reccomending places of intrest. the room was an ok but a bit on the small size. the location is perfect and you can easily walk to time square and central park in about twenty minutes. i would like to thank the concierge yelena kreeper who recommended a great broadway show and got us great seats. i would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently suprised”
Reviews.Author: oldgrump
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the other reviews of this hotel , my wife & I were slightly apprehensive , but our fears were unfounded. The hotel is in a great location , a few blocks from the Rockafeller centre & ideally placed for the subway at Grand central , it is within walking distance of Times square 5th avenue etc . The staff were extremely plaesent & helpful particuarly the concierge's , the rooms were cleaned to an excellent standard & all staff said hello etc whenever you met them. The hotel can be a bit noisy durung the night as the rooms are tigthly packed & the traffic is constant but I would be suprised if that wasnt the case in all areas of NYC . We would definetly visit both the city & this hotel again & would throughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: apk_80
Reviews.Content: The main attraction of this hotel is the location, its within walking distance of the main attractions such as Times Square without being right in the middle and therefore noisy. We got a free upgrade and the room and bed were a good size, I did see the basic room though and it was very small (which is the way in New York I believe). We didnt eat in the hotel at all as there are so many places to eat but it looked fine. I wouldnt stay there again as I like to try different places but I have recommended this hotel to friends and would do again.

Reviews.Title: “great location hotel near everything”
Reviews.Author: boylanamy
Reviews.Content: what a goog location walking distance to everything staff very friendly rooms very clean all in all very enjoyable trip

Reviews.Title: “No Problem Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: caffeitalia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last month while visiting my parents. I was VERY apprehensive after reading some of the reviews on Tripadvisor. I experienced none of the problems described by other travelers. The Front Desk was very nice to me, and I enjoyed having a free gift as a "Goldpoints" client. I have stayed at Radisson hotels around the world, and though this building is slightly older, the room decorations and "benefits" are all up to par. I thoroughly inspected my room each night, due to the comments on this site. I found nothing. I enjoyed the plasma TV in my room, slept well every night, as it was actually quiet for a New York Hotel. (I recommend requesting a higher floor as you are in the "heart" of New York". And every morning, I slipped down to Starbucks on the ground floor for a nice coffee. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is central to everything if you are visiting New York. My family actually came to my hotel on our way to Central Park one day.

Reviews.Title: “Sad and dumpy”
Reviews.Author: JMfromTO
Reviews.Content: The lobby isn't bad but don't be fooled, the rooms are sad and dumpy. Opened the door to faded carpet, a view of some heating equipment buzzing right outside the window and a very uncomfortable bed. The towels had stains and crusty things on them and the maid in the hall insisted on coming in and adding blankets when my girlfriend was changing. I had to tell her 3 times to come back later before she stopped knocking. Stay somewhere else. We did, we turned right around and went across the street to the Marriott. Much nicer. One plus, a Starbucks in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Staff great and very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: AMderry
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the lexington during the last week in November as my sister and I wanted to go to Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. The staff were very polite and professional upon arrival and throughout our visit. Our room was not a bad size expeically for NYC and the rooms were very clean. The view from our room was good, looking down onto 48th Street and Lexington. The location is great for anybody who wishes to stay near to the Chrysler Buidling, Rockefeller Centre and Times Square. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel to anybody visiting NYC, as the location, staff and price are unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: rconnell2222
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if you like waking up with bed bug bites all over you body. Never again....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, adequate accommodation at a good price, great service.”
Reviews.Author: EiboNewbury
Reviews.Content: We booked on the recommendation of a friend who summed it up as above. She was right. We booked a Junior Suite which is essentially an average size double room with the door knocked through to what was once a single room, so you get two bathrooms! Basic decor and a little tatty as some others have described but perfectly ok. And the price was about two thirds less than for some of the more upmarket hotels Id originally considered. Front desk and room service really friendly and efficient. Raffles was great for breakfast and light snacks , not cheap but great service. The Habana Room did a great good value dinner ( although I was a little surprised it didn't have wine by the bottle) Centrally located it was easy to get around and not dangerous at night. We were concerned about bedbugs after the reviews but found no evidence of any. Only bad point in my view was the very poor wireless connection. As a Goldpoints member, I did t have to pay extra for WiFi, I would have complained if Id had to pay for it. Only managed successful connection for more than two minutes, once in 4 days. I guess it's a capacity issue. All in all great value and good service. If you want more trimmings pay three times more and go to the Waldorf up the street!

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant staff, "Business Class" not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: gsh_1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 days with Business Class upgrade promotion. 1. There was virtually no wireless reception in my room. When I pointed that out to the front desk, all they did was to give me a 1-800 number that I was supposed to call. When I said what is "Business Class" worth if I don't have internet, she said I have to call the 1-800 number. 2. When I had my breakfast at "Raffles" on Friday, I asked the staff there how long they will serve breakfast on Saturday. Answer: "All Day". When I went for breakfast on Saturday at 12noon, the waitress told me that my "Business Class" breakfast voucher was only valid until 11am. But neither was that stated on the voucher nor was I told at check in or by the waitress on Friday. I went to the front desk again. Answer: "In every hotel in the world breakfast is only in the morning." When I said that then it should either be told me on arrival or stated on the voucher, the answer was: "These vouchers are printed centrally for all US. It would be too much effort to change them individually". 3. As mentioned, I had a late day on that Saturday and went for breakfast around 12noon. As a result, nobody ever came back to make my room, neither were my amenities in the bathroom replenished. 4. When checking out any paying a bill of almost $900, I do not expect from a hotel of your class to have to pay $2 for storage of my suitcase until departure. All in all: Wonderful room, excellent location. But the service really made it difficult to like the stay. And that is supposed to be business class?

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: wholeysmoke
Reviews.Content: The room is small, but it was okay. However, the morning after our first night's stay, my friend said she felt itchy. I looked down on my bed and saw a bug. When I killed it with a tissue, blood came out! I then looked and saw another one. We called down to the desk and she said she would send someone. right away, but no one ever came. After about 40 minutes I couldn't stay in the room any longer so we went downstairs. They said sorry but it was pretty casual. We did not want another room as I am sure many have the bedbugs. We were able to get a refurnd for out other two nighs. The next day I woke up with six huge red bites! We ended up staying at the Roger Smith Hotel near by without a problem. I would not stay here again or another Radisson. We should have been refunded all nights including the one we stayed and been placed in a sister hotel somewhere else in the city.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS NY”
Reviews.Author: Debs079
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say first time in NY and couldn't have picked a better hotel and location, but what really makes the Radisson stand out from the crowd is the staff, and in particular one of the members of the concierge team -Yelena Kruper. Nothing was too much trouble for Yelena, she was always helpful, polite and gave us the most amazing tips. Make sure you look after her, she is a real asset. Hope it will not be too long before we visit NY again. Debbie & Tony Deacon Southampton, UK

Reviews.Title: “Just right for us”
Reviews.Author: amybristolBristol
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights early November. Not sure if we were just lucky but our room was lovely. It was small in comparison with European hotel rooms but I think it is the same size as all standard hotel rooms in New York. Location was perfect, close to Times Square, Grand Central, Central Park and Rockefeller. We only used the subway a couple of times as walked to most places. Tips: Get Broadway tickets from half price ticket booth in Times Square when you get there. Go up Rockefeller as oppose to Empire State - much better views. Go to Stardust Diner for breakfast (opposite Novotel on Times Square)...the waiters/waitresses sing while serving! Get free ferry to Staten Island for great views on Statue of Liberty. For the best atmosphere on a night out go to St Marks, East Village - has New York's oldest pub. For cheap designer shopping go to Century 21 (opposite Ground Zero). Final tip - pack loads of jumpers, scarves, hats etc...wind chill factor made weather feel ten times colder than it was! Have a good trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Comfort and Service”
Reviews.Author: hemit
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great with a lot of amenities and the service is quick and great. Pretty close by to a lot of shopping in the city and time square and broadways are pretty close by. Public transport is available from that location and there is a lot of great restaurants right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly if expensive”
Reviews.Author: caferrigno
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Lex on Nov. 3 and 4 2010 and found it to be a very nice, clean, and convenient place. Unfortunately, we used Priceline's "Name your own price" feature which was horrible because it did not take into account that we were travelling with two kids (8 and 11) so by the time everything was cleared up, I actually had to pay an additional $100 per night to Radisson to get the room we wanted. It was clearly two singles that had a wall knocked down since it contained two bathrooms (which was great for us) and was very clean. Only one issue: Both nights someone near us on the non-smoking floor was smoking because we could smell the smoke coming through the vents. Finally, I know a lot of people complained about the staff here and the issue of bugs, etc. but the staff was very nice and the rooms were clean. Yes, the had been rehabed recently and the bathrooms did smell a bit mildewy (no windows at all), but as someone who has travelled quite a bit, I thought they were very adequate and the location was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: techruiter
Reviews.Content: We got the room through Priceline and it was a tiny room with a tiny bathroom and some peeling paint in the bathroom, but overall it was pleasant & clean. The best thing about the hotel is that it is located about 15 minutes walk in a straight line West to Times Square. We walked everywhere. The Staff were helpfull and kowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in NY”
Reviews.Author: Mariana_Ferraz
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s location is fantastic. Very near from the Grand Central Station. The room is very good and has everything you need. The staff was great. ItÂ´s a good option to stay when you are in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: efwise
Reviews.Content: When I walked up to the check-in to see if I could get my room a little early, I was invited off to a separate desk and checked in within moments of arriving, nice. I had bid on my room through a popular site, unlike other properties I've stayed at Radisson did not treat me like an outsider. Clean, fast elevators, nice location. I'll stay here again, and that's important to me. I'm frugal and it takes alot to convince me to stay at a hotel at the regular posted rate, so next trip maybe I'll be back to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ana-Mirela
Reviews.Content: I have to say that prior to my travel I was freaked out about the bed bugs issue in NY and also the bed bugs reports for this hotel. I've stayed at Radisson Lexington for 11 nights end of October and didn't have any bed bug problems so was very happy about it :) Indeed the rooms look a bit old and would need some refurbishment. Bathroom is small and there is no ventilation. Carpet/ couch could be cleaner, but again it's not something noticeable if you're not a very picky person. I've stayed in many hotels in Europe and I would say that the Radisson Lexington provides an overall good experience. Staff was helpful with the minor questions I had. Location is great, close to major attractions. As a tip for NY: visit Rockefeller Center, view is better than from Empire and you don't have to queue up

Reviews.Title: “Lexington Hotel at NY”
Reviews.Author: Alfri43
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, well located and confortable. Not so roomy, but who stays on bed at Manhattan anyway?Clean and a cosy service. Booked from Sao Paulo, Brazil. Worth the value. Few blocks to Times square, Central Park and Museums.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central hotel”
Reviews.Author: thricechampions
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a very enjoyable few days in New York. Having read some reviews i was a little hasty in travelling to this hotel. We arrived at the hotel by mid afternoon and were given our rooms straightaway. We booked one triple and 1 double.The triple room was large and in good condition,clean and had 2 bathrooms!! The double room we were first given had a naked lady in and surprised me,my son and the lady!!! Our 2nd room was small,clean and yes could have done with a makeover but still adequate for what we required..........no naked lady unfortuneatly.....i did ask reception if i could have a younger model in this one!!!! The hotel staff were excellent for our stay,always polite,happy and always willing to help. They were a credit to the hotel. The hotel has a starbucks next to the foyer and a great place called raffles that served a great breakfast. I would definately recomend this hotel and will be booking it again when i hope to return next year. Thankyou radisson lexington for giving me a great central base for my experiance of your wonderful city

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Nicat06
Reviews.Content: The Radisson on Lexington was a great hotel. The room was a small double but perfectly adequate for a 4 night stay. It was very clean and tidy. The bathroom had a small tub with shower, basin and toilet. Also a hair dryer. The towels were changed daily if requested. The room had large LCD TV, safety deposit box, iron and ironing board. We had ample drawer and wardrobe space. The staff were very efficient and friendly when we were there. My only "concern" was that I emailed to confirm my reservation and received an email back stating that replies could take up to two weeks! I never received a response. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York. It was ideally located for all major sights.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: stevenr35
Reviews.Content: Stayed September for a business meeting. Location good but not exactly lively. Very nice staff: very helpful and smiley. Room was quite small (despite being upgraded, apparently). Room needed some updating and a bit of tlc. Bathroom quite old and dated and stank of mildew. It was very clean but I could not get rid of the smell (think the extractor fan in the bathroom wasn't working). Had to leave the window open for the first day until it got better. Would have changed it on the first day had it not been for the jet-lag etc. Okay lobby bar. There's a diner and a Starbucks attached. Diner had excellent breakfasts. Wifi was not free in rooms but was free in the lobby. Overall, it was okay. Probably wouldn't stay here again unless I couldn't find anything else and was really stuck. In Europe, the Radisson is usually pretty plush. This was certainly not plush.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay wants I was moved.”
Reviews.Author: Travelingcindy9
Reviews.Content: The resort was very convienent. The only issue I had was upon arrival I was given a smoking room after requesting non-smoking. They did move me," said it was a non-smoking room so the preovious guest will be charged." What I dont understand it should of been cleaned and inspected prior to my arrival. They did have a service to hold your luggage after check-out which was convienent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location to Mid-Town”
Reviews.Author: ErinLynn120
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights. Yes, the room is small & so is the bathroom. There were no plug outlets in the bathroom for curling iron. had to plug it in across the room. The bathroom had no fan. So you had to shower with the door cracked open. I could hear the people in the other room throught the vents in the bathroom. We stayed on the 5th floor (smoking floor). Our room was in the back of the hotel & we looked out onto a roof & big fan/vent. The fan/vent was loud in the morning. There is a Starbucks conected to the Hotel. On Sunday Lexington Ave was closed off for 5 blockes each direction & there was a "Street Fair" right outside the hotel. We did a lot of shopping at the street fair. Then dropped everything off in our room & was back out on the streets. All in all, was a nice hotel with a good location to mid-town & subway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Thomas_and_Sarah
Reviews.Content: Well maybe it's just that everything in Mid Town Manhattan is expensive, but I've never paid so much for such a small room. Beautifully done out, very trendy feel to the lobby and small bar. Internet didn't work at first, couple of calls to get it fixed and I wasn't charged for it so no harm done. Location impeccable for mid-town, three blocks to the metro and a steady stream of cabs outside, so made the trip very easy. First room I was offered was miniscule and opened out onto the whirring aircon extractors, I asked to change and got one higher up on the 10th floor which was much better. Staff all very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Severe Bed Bug Infestation”
Reviews.Author: Pageanttraveler
Reviews.Content: When we first checked in, the woman at the front desk was not too friendly. Rather than checking into a room with 2 double beds, we were checked into a room with 2 twin beds. We went out all day.. came back and got dressed for the night club.. We got back into our room at about 6 am..went to sleep and at 8 am, one of my friends woke up freaking out because there were bed bugs crawling all over her pillow.. We turned on the lights only to see BOTH beds infested with bed bugs. There were babies all over and inside the pillows and big ones crawling under the sheets. My friend has over 40 bites and I have too many to count. When we checked out, the gentleman at the front desk, Hoshedar thought the complaint was humourous until I became IRATE. Then they refunded our room and our parking.. WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER!!! THE ONLY GOOD THING WAS THE BELL MAN.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Davlyn1234
Reviews.Content: Pretty average hotel with the usual extortionate New York price tag Friendly welcoming reception staff Decent size clean rooms. No tea/coffee facilities etc. Starbucks and a cafe are next to the lobby Hotel is well situated for all the sites and as a place to rest Would recommend the bus/cruise excursions - staff wear yellow uniforms just near hotel. Excellent value for money for us tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Maza2010
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is absolutely great. Close to the subway and in walking distance to many of NYC attractions. However, the hotel is in desperate need of refurbishment. While the double rooms are small, more concerning was how dirty they were and remained that way for our entire stay. The front desk staff need to understand the concept of hospitality and when asked where's a nice place for weekend brunch not simply point to the 2 places that are within the hotel! fyi Penelope's at 159 Lexington Av is a fantastic place for brunch and only 25 mins walking distance from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “My room was 15 foot long by ten feet wide”
Reviews.Author: Grizzly78
Reviews.Content: ... And it cost $350 a night! Am I mad to have expected more? Oh and it stank of stale smoke. Oh, and in this 24 hour city, room service stops at midnight. Useless if your plane into town was delayer.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: luisrjorge
Reviews.Content: Very nice location , just a few minuts from central park, broadway and rockfeller center. the double was very small but very cozya and Comfortable ,also have good lcd room tv. the bathroom it wasnt very good, very old school. the internet is not free as some users say , you have to pay 5dls a day.

Reviews.Title: “moderate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chiara1339
Reviews.Content: I stayed only 2 nights in this hotel on august 2010. The lobby is good, but my double rooms use single was very small, with mold smeel. Also the bathrooms was very old. With a free business center. I suggest to customers without expectations and who are in transit.

Reviews.Title: “What's the Big Deal???”
Reviews.Author: shoelessrose
Reviews.Content: We booked a one night stay in a suite here this past weekend. For NYC standards- the size would equate to a spacious one bedroom apartment. It had a separate living room, two full baths, a separate bedroom and several closets - all of which is great but the room lacked cleanliness which is my #1. It was interesting being there with all of the dignitaries attending the UN Summit, but the coolness of that experience comes from NYC and not this hotel. One major perk is the location is amazing, close to the subway and many popular attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: arrobo
Reviews.Content: Customer service is very good and coffee shop in house is very convenient. Location is excellent, close to grand central and walking distance from times square and other attractions. Rooms feel old but with relatively new furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad standard”
Reviews.Author: Lostmarbles
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to New York for his 50th birthday, thought going to a Radisson Hotel would be a good choice, location wise couldn't have picked any better everything within walking distance, but the hotel itself wasn't up to standard. Our room was so small and we had an upgrade i knew they were small but i did expect it to be bigger than our bedroom at home and the bathroom, well all i can say is i am glad i am not a large person otherwise i wouldn't have fitted in it! Our room wasn't vacumed the whole 5 days we were there, we had to ask every day for towels and bath mat(which you needed when you had marble floors) we had no top ups of shampoo etc.. on the whole we just weren't impressed with it at all, have stayed in Radisson hotels before and this didn't come close.

Reviews.Title: “Never come back here again”
Reviews.Author: Nokveedz
Reviews.Content: We were on ours ten days business trip in NYC, we fly across the continent for 26 hours plus domestic flight from Los Angeles, first two night we were stay at W hotel, also stay and great vibe, a bit too happening at lobby bar but it's did kick out a few of ours jet lag, we planned to try around hotel in NYC as much as we can because we are also hotelier and we do write review in magazine, so ours next try is Radisson on 48 st, Lexington avenue, we were at the hotel around 10am, we were told that ours room will not be ready until 2pm, never mind we leaved ours luggages at bell counter and paid 2dollars for each back and went out for a walk around, when we came back we already dead tired because it's was already midnight where we came from,we checked in at the front desk and went to get ours stuff, none of the bell offer to take ours luggages to ours room, so we thought it's was a bit odd but we positive thinking that may be it's a hotel courtesy to do so, so we try ours best to brought all ours belonging up to ours room in one goes, the room was clean but very small, no complaint there, bed was comfort, I flip my suitcase to open and fou d a big broke hole on the other side, I rang the front desk to told them about my suitcase, she claimed that why I did not tell the bell man earlier, so I said I did not expect to found a hole in my suitcase and plus I was very very sleepy and need a long nap, she said she will offer us a free breakfast, I said I don't think free breakfast and hole in my polo Ralph Laurent will compensated with free breakfast, please call us back when you have a better solution for this matter, she never did. We plan to check out as soon as we get up. In the morning there was a lound knoced on ours door at 9 am, half awake I open the door, and the housekeeping casually say that just checking if we still here,i rang the front desk and asked what time is the checked out time and found out that not until noon, so much for that we pack immediately we ready to leave this hotel and never to return, When we paying for ours bill, they asked about how was ours stay so I told them what was happened, the duty manager have been quite helpful and she designed to call on the GM, The GM was very rude and un professional, never in my career in hotelier to see how badly GM handling this small issue so poorly, he was blaming us for ours suitcase and imply in a way that we somehow try to get a freebies out of this by fake complaint, the GM insulting us and using a lound tone with us and people starting to notice the issue, so I ran out of my patient and did not want to carry on pointless conversation with someone of such manner, so I said ok we just going to leaved now let's just leaved it there, he asked about my occupation so I said I work as a hotelier consultant and he look at me from head to toe and make a sneer, this is more than a slap in the face, We hope nothing like this happen to any one and we advice to stay away from this hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Great service and within a New York minute of local attractions”
Reviews.Author: nkl_83
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Room was a bit small for a King size room, but that is to be expected in New York. Bathroom could have done with being upgraded. Excellent location in midtown manhattan within walking distance to Times Square, Grand Central station, and the Rockefeller center. Close to the subway station aswell (less than 5 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BearsdenBrian
Reviews.Content: We stayed last weekend after a cruise from NY and we couldn't fault this hotel. Location very central with enough restaurants and shops nearby to keep us fed and entertained. Staff nice and friendly and added bonus was that my wife met Andy Murray the tennis player in the lobby. There seemed to be quite a number of tennis people staying here during the US Open. Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel for a visitor to NY.

Reviews.Title: “quality”
Reviews.Author: richie009
Reviews.Content: visited the radisson at end of august for 7 days. service and advice was excellent . the staff who cleaned the rooms on the 12 floor were top quality the door staff were very good at getting a taxi for you and giving you advise.the hotel was close to time square and rockerfellar centre and grand central.. hope to use the radisson hotel in the near future

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: EnglishTeacher2
Reviews.Content: We went to the city for birthday treat and really enjoyed our stay in the Radisson Lexington. The room was a good size and really comfortable, we really liked the adjustable bed for comfort. Our view was a bit disappointing, some sort of air con unit but it's not like we went to sit in our room! The location of the hotel was great and walking around the streets was simply amazing. The front staff were really helpful, hailing taxis and advising us of the best shops and sights that we were looking for. We also liked the Starbucks within the hotel! When we return to NY for my big birthday we will definately consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: CornwallMole
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lexington Radisson Hotel for a 2 week holiday. The room was extremely spacious and kept clean by the friendly staff. We had a small kitchen with fridge, coffee maker and microwave,which was useful. In - room safe, excellent hairdryer and an iron & ironing board! The bed was extremely comfortable. Clean linen and towels throughout our stay. IT suite was excellent, with free access to guests. The breakfast (included) was limited to a separate "vouchers" menu and was slightly limited from the main menu choices. However, staff were friendly and there were 5 choices. Communal areas were clean & comfortable in a very busy hotel. The concierge service which booked us tickets for "Chicago" was friendly & polite. Would have no hesitation in returning or recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC! CENTRAL, CLEAN & FRIENDLY!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinegirl2233
Reviews.Content: Having visted NY for the second time at Christmas, Me and my friend decided to stay a little closer to 5th Avenue end as before we stayed more nearer Times Square. The Radission Lexington was Fab. Beautiful Decor, Stunning Christmas decorations, Clean, Rooms were modern, Reception was lovely staff and also had a Starbucks inside too! So Close to 5th Avenue. One subway stop from Bloomingdales. I absolutely love NY, being my second time visiting, i knew exactly what I wanted to do etc. If you ever go at Christmas PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE Book tickets at Radio City to go watch Christmas Spectacular it was the best $90 I've ever spent so magical, all ages as well. Last time I visited I done Rocka Fella, this time i done Empire State but I prefered Rocka Fella.
