Also go Ice Skating as well in Central Park if you go in Winter So magical and fun, also Brooklyn Bridge, But get the Subway to Brooklyn and walk BACK over to Manhattan so many people were walking over from Manhattan and the view is so beautiful walking over from Brooklyn. Also DONT forget Bloomingdales , Tiffanys and M&M Factory - Have fun. When i do return I will DEFIENTLY be returning to the Radisson Lexington x

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: clairelouise1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson with my boyfriend in December 2009 and we were there for the new year. I thought it was beautifully decorated for Christmas and found the staff to be very helpful at all times. We had no problems with our room and was cleaned every day and had fresh towels. It was a good location and we found our way around fairly easily from where it was located. I think the only criticism I would have is the nightclub attached to the hotel. My boyfriend and I are fairly young so wanted to enjoy some night life whilst in New York and thought it would be ideal to go the club but everytime we went to go we were told we could not enter because of a private party. We found the bar staff really helpful when deceiding where to go for dinner at night and the restaurant across the road was out of this world, we would definatley pay it a visit if I returned to New York. All in all it was a fantastic holiday and the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fix Your Toilet and Phone issues and all will be well!!”
Reviews.Author: Hnstwrldtrvlr
Reviews.Content: O.K. prior to booking my hotel reservation, I came on to Trip Advisor and read all kinds of reviews on the Radisson Lexington. The reviews were mixed, some not too good, but I booked there anyways. I hope my feedback will be taken seriously and management can see ways where they can improve on the little things that may make or break a customer's decision on a return stay to the hotel. The check-in process was OK for the most part. I think the clerks at the counter should show a little more enthusiasm and helpfulness when welcoming the guests upon check-in. I did not get that from the young hispanic guy that eventually checked me into the first room. Customer Service goes such a long way when it's managed properly. To summarize, all in all my stay turned out to be quite enjoyable, I slept well after changing rooms for the third time. The first room, the phone message system and the toilet did not work properly. Thanks to the Senior Engineer whose first intial start with the letter "J", who went above and beyond to ensure that the toilet and the phone was fixed after I rang so many times about the same problems. The last room I was switched to did not have a properly functioning toilet either. I'm not sure what the problems are at the Radisson regarding this vital amenity, however, it was frustrating to have to be ringing down to the operator to complain about the same thing over and over. Front Desk Manager whose initials are N.S, I want to thank you for all that you've done to turn things around and making our staying an enjoyable one after all. My daughter commented too that you were an extremely patient and pleasant person to deal with, as well you had a smile on your face all the time. The location was quite ideal and the food at the restaurants attached to the hotel was great! We will return for any future stay. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: isawapeach
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Lexington is a great hotel, it's modern stylish, and in a great location, about 3 blocks from Grand Central, and a short walk to Times Square, Broadway and 5th Avenue. The staff are very helpful, there was a bit of a mix up with the rooms when we got there, but it was sorted out, and the staff were very nice about it. The rooms aren't that big, but it's New York, so you can't expect big rooms. They're very clean and air conditioned though, so I have no complaints. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, affordable NY hotel in convenient location, great service”
Reviews.Author: ohiofoodlovers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few nights before leaving for an overseas trip. I wanted a Midtown hotel close to the subway, Bryant Park and within reasonable (by NY standards) walking distance of shopping. I didn't want to pay $200-300 a night. And preferably a hotel with some style. Check, on all fronts. Rooms were stylish and small, but still larger than some NY hotel rooms, and included nice work desks and adjustable beds (comfy... though I did feel like I was in one of those late-night bed commercials). The subway was just a few blocks away, and you could look down Lexington Ave and see the Chrysler Building. With tax, I spent less than $140 a night. Service was outstanding. My flight arrived in NY early, and I was exhausted. The front desk staff person found me a quiet room on a floor that had already been cleaned. On checkout, I stored my luggage for part of the day, and the bellman quickly found my bags despite the chaos of so many people retrieving bags at the same time. The only downside: no decent in-room safe storage for laptops or other valuables.

Reviews.Title: “Breath of fresh air!”
Reviews.Author: Missy_Aussie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a disaster moment with the site AirBnB and decided to grab a hotel at the last minute. We were greeted by the doorman, the concierge and reception. It was a complete and utter relief. Bell boy "Ralph" remembered our names for our entire stay. Our room was clean and comfortable although on the small-ish side. Not alot of room for 2 full suitcases but we managed. Breakfast was included in our room rate which we only ate 1 day. Didn't find it particularly interesting however it was included. About a 15 min walk to Times Square. Short walk to Grand Central Terminal. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed...”
Reviews.Author: RioTraveler103
Reviews.Content: I checked in on 8/7 and stayed two nights and requested a room on a low floor by the elevator. I was put in room 335 - DON'T EVER STAY IN THIS ROOM. The front desk woman failed to mention that it is right by some crew lounge (not sure if it's for hotel employees or pilots/flight attendants that stay overnight), but my room smelled like a combination of smoke and/or food?! I didn't realize this until later that night since I was gone most of they day and when I complained about the smell of smoke (btw, I had to go down to the front desk instead of call because the phone in the room had no marked buttons), they said it was a non-smoking floor and didn't offer to change my room. I requested a room change the next day which they honored (room 1826 which was MUCH better), but the front desk gentleman never asked why I was changing rooms and had a slight attitude as well. I've stayed at the Marriott right next door and had a much better experience there - I won't stay at this hotel the next time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sammie51
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson Lexington on our recent trip to NYC. The hotel was very nice an our room was small but clean and very cute. The staff was nice and helpful to us the entire time we stayed. The maid service was excellent. We would definitely stay there again. **The fitness room was a big positive.**

Reviews.Title: “Been there.....don't do it”
Reviews.Author: Gustafz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 6 nights with my wife. This was our first travel together without out children in 7 years so we had been looking forward to this stay for a while (We're both in our early thirties). When we checked in (30/7) we were informed that we could only get a small room to start with as everything was fully booked but if we were not satisfied we could get a larger room the following morning. When we got up to the 15th floor we saw that our room wasn't that big but we weren't planning on staying in the room all that much so that was something we could have lived with. Our bed was however only a 1,5 x single size which was far too small for us to sleep comfortably in. After a sleepless night, mainly caused by lack of a bed suitable for 2 grownups + noises from the next bedroom (but you could literally hear everything that went on there, which gave you the feeling you were on a cheap model in stead of a Radison) we went down to the lobby to ask for a new room. The employee that assisted us that morning was extremely rude and basically said that we could not get another room and she doubted that the employee who checked us in had promised that. She furthermore stated that this was a full size bed in spite of our claims. I asked if this was a king size but she just repeated herself by saying this was a full size. We were little amazed by the treatment we got but in stead of making troubles (which we should have done) we decided to try to enjoy our first day in NY and try too see whether we could find a little less hostile employee in the afternoon. When we got back we were informed that we could try to check again in the morning, which we did. The third time we got down we were informed that we could at the very first get a larger room on the 2nd-3rd of August and it would going to cost us extra money. This employee acknowledged that this was neither a king size nor a queen size. After that we sort of gave up from the idea of getting a larger room and decided to stick with this one. There are several other things worth mentioning, 1) during the day and nights it got really warm in the room so we decided to turn on the air-conditioner ....if you are interested in having a conversation or watch the TV when its on then rather accept the heat, it's was abnormally noisy when the air-conditioning was on 2) if you decide to close the bathroom door when showering, make sure that you have a partner with you on the other side or a mobile to call for help as our door alway got shut due to the moisture and needed to be lightly "kicked in" by the other individual 3) there is a gap between the floor and the door to the bedroom so you hear everything at all hours from the corridor, the gap was around 4 cm where largest. 4) The safe did not work 5) We bathroom was messy once we arrived and had obviously not been cleaned well enough, we e.g. saw a pubic hair in the tub before we used it. The hotel had one good thing that one cannot complain about but the location was excellent, you are very well centered in Manhattan and many locations are in walking range. Coming from Scandinavia I've stayed several times in Radision in more then 4 countries. I've always been pleased but this was a very bad experience and I would rather recommend couples to stay in a different hotel. We paid for this stay with bonus points from the airline I do most business with but I don't know if that was the reason for the treatment we got. I used tripadvisor before we booked our stay and also checked the homepage of the hotel. The general manager of the hotel comments every review in this forum which gave me a comfort but you could read a large number of dissatisfied customers, his comments gave you the notion that if one was not pleased every measures would be taken to address the problem. As previously described than that is not our experience of the hotel so if you decide to stay then embrace yourselves for a bad experience. NY is however one of the best cities if visited and I'll come back there for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “OVER PRICED”
Reviews.Author: mommalisa50
Reviews.Content: stayed at lexington New York for my 50th birthday expected lots from description boy what a disappointment never saw the latin club on site diner gave a choice of 6 things for rooms that came with breakfast not good ,and deluxe room that i paid extra for was on 6th floor facing street where construction was loud asked manager for higher room and didnt get it she advised staff too tell us they were to booked BS, lONG STORY SHORT VERY DISSAPPOINTED. Stay at marriott or intercontinental all on same block.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel. No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Terryteztez
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights while on a larger trip around the States. This was our first hotel. We got to new york in the afternoon and they upgraded our room to a queen size. As we were in New York we didn't really spend much time in the room as we were out all day. The time we spent in the room was perfect though. Clean, room service speedy, easy to get around. They had the beds that you can adjust the hardness/softness with a remote for each side of the double bed - personally i was not so keen on this but i can see that most other people would prefer it. We didn't have the best view but that happens and we didn't mind. It is a really good location for getting up to Central Park. Just a 20 minute walk away. 5th Avenue is really close as is 42nd street so it is a prime location hotel. Would definatley stay there again next time i go.

Reviews.Title: “Prime NYC Location!”
Reviews.Author: elouise82
Reviews.Content: I've been to NYC before and stayed in the Marriott next to the Radisson. However this time I was travelling with friends and wanted to find somewhere a little cheaper, therefore I chose the Radisson. I was a little weary about staying here beforehand as the price of the room was so cheap, so I thought there would have to be something wrong with it! However it was amazing; the staff were super friendly, the lobby had a nice relaxing atmosphere and the room was nice and tidy. The only slight issue was that the room was a little on the small side, but what do you expect in New York City? If you're going to New York with friends I certainly recommend staying here as the price when I paid for it was extremely good! The location is the best aspect of the hotel; central park, the rockerfeller center, bloomingdales, grand central station and fifth avenue are all within a close walking distance. We walked everywhere, and therefore saved lots of money on taxi cabs and subway fares!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: joanne_m_thomson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Radisson Lexington July 16-19. We had booked this holiday extremely last minute on the evening of wedensday 14th July, staying 3 nights at the hotel and then sailing back across to Southampton on the QM2. We had no choice in what hotel we stayed at. We arrived at JFK and then taxi'd to the hotel. We checked in quickly, the girl at reception was very friendly and we were given room 628. This was a standard double room with a huge comfy bed. The room was comparable to travel inn or holiday inn express in the UK, and we were delighted with it. The bathroom was clean although slightly worn around the edges, but this was not a problem. We were really looking for a base to explore the city and this was excellent. Location of this hotel speaks for itself, and every member of staff we encountered was courteous and helpful. This was my 3rd time staying in New York, and I was worried about the hotel, knowing from past experience what accomodation in the city can be like. Worries were completely unfounded and we would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: kaitensushiman
Reviews.Content: A great deal right in midtown Manhattan! Surprisingly big rooms, great concierge, great value. Unable to afford a brownstone, I use this hotel as my New York pied-a-terre!

Reviews.Title: “I don't think I'll stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Trishmare1
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel on Quikbook for July 5th thru the 7th. There were three tier of rates - 149 for a mini room, 159 for a standard double and 179 for a larger room. I chose the 159 rate. We arrived at the hotel before 12 noon and there was no reservation. I have booked thru quikbook for decades and never had a problem. I showed "Juan" the confirmation,and he took my credit card to the back room to check the room avalilability. About 10 minutes later Juan came back,gave me back the card and asked for a picture ID which was on another credit card. He said a room was ready on the 22 floor. We went to the room - a closet would have been a step up. The two of us girls couldn't pass by the bottom of the bed without hitting the wall and the air conditioning wasn't working. We phoned the front desk and in about 15 minutes a very nice maintenance man came up. He could not fix the air and recommended us to another room on a lower floor which was much more adequate. The room was very clean and the maintenance man was very accomodating. Check out on the 7th was uneventful. I spoke to Edna about my disappointment with the gliches and she offer to pay for breakfast but we had already eaten and were about to leave to catch the train. Approx a week later I recieved the credit card bill which I promptly paid. Friday ,7/23, I recieved another charge on another credit card for a charge for 6/30 to 7/1 - on night at the Radisson. I didn not stay at the Radisson on 6/30. I don't know if I'll ever stay at the Radisson again. Too many issues.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff....noisy air conditioning!!!”
Reviews.Author: hbmsh
Reviews.Content: We have stayed with a few hotels in the radisson group and have always had a great stay. Hence, why we booked with the radisson lexington on our trip to nyc. great location for everything...especially subway! However, after a long flight and checking in quite late in the night we could not wait to lie down!! We were disappointed that trying to sleep proved to be tricky as directly outside the window we were faced with a noisy air conditioning unit for the whole hotel whirring on/off.and the bathroom wasn't of best quality either. we went to the front desk who informed us that there were no rooms they could move us to but if we saw them the next day they would be able to move us. So the next day, we did just that and they moved us to a different room a few floors higher but still within sight and sound of the air con unit. but the noise was nothing to what it was the previous night. the room was pretty much the same as our previous one but the bathroom was worse. the bath needed a good clean and the tiles had been repeadetly been repaired and looked worse for wear. overall, we can not fault the staff as they moved rooms and they were not fussy or unhelpful at all. they even swapped some of our larger dollar notes without fuss-which was a great help to us as tourists!!! the only thing we can think of us is the bathrooms could be updated, but you only sleep there as the rest of the day you're out. all in all, great base, helpful staff and a starbucks attatched to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: stacey03
Reviews.Content: Me and my mam stayed at this hotel at the end of may which was memorial weekend, we went for my 21st birthday and found the hotel lovely. The rooms were reasonable sized very clean and cool. The mattress was great as you could control how hard or soft you wanted it. The hotel is close to times square, 5th avenue and bloomingdales which is fab for shopping, We walked everywhere and found it easy to see all the sites would recommend the sight seeing buses. We plan on returning hopefully soon and would stay at the radisson again. Fab Weekend unforgetable birthday.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hcog2003
Reviews.Content: PROS: *Clean, comfortable room (excellent beds) *Wonderful shower (very strong) *Very friendly, knowledgeable staff *Allowed us to arrive/confirm stay early and store our bags ($2/bag) *Air conditioning worked great for unusually hot weather *Only a short walk from the subway (around 10 minutes) *Restaurants/services on site *Excellent rates available! CONS: *None

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: zarabanda001
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a superior king suite. Stayed for two nights, and hardly got any sleep daily construction noise from the adjacent building even at the 19th floor was awful we had to be moved. We were placed into a room on the 24th floor next to an elevator shaft (not any better!). The staff was very pleasant which was good. Both rooms had sleep number beds and I have to say it was the worst sleep I have ever had. both nights I woke up with a back ache. We have stayed at other hotels in New York and we stayed at the Distrikt and it was 100% more clean and quiet with a more comfortable bed. Here's a tip if you are the manager of this hotel 1) get better beds those sleep number beds are atrocious 2) get ice machines on all the floors (no one wants to go 10 floors down to get ice) 3) check out your competition and see what they are doing for the price.

Reviews.Title: “I WOULDNT STAY IN THIS HOTEL AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: debga
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days, I found the reception staff very rude and ignorant, however the concierge staff were great and very helpful, We were on floor 5, which was a smoking floor, which i didnt request and absolutely reeked off cigarettes, Im a smoker and the smell even turned my stomach, The room was tiny, relatively clean apart from the Bathroom, layer of scum on the bath and sink which had to be cleaned before using it, Items of clothing went missing from my room, took 3 days to eventually speak to the General Manager, after being passed from pillar to post, who point blank refused to believe that any items had been removed from my room, he was very difficult to converse with,preferred to talk over me rather than listen. he eventually offered to reimburse me as a goodwill gesture with a small amount which did not even begin to cover one of the items, to date i am still waiting for the amount to be credited to my account. On a plus side we had free internet connection in our room, however be careful as they will still try to charge you for it at the end of your stay. It is in a good location for Time Square, Theatre district and 5th Avenue. Would i stay here again, most definitely not.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall experience”
Reviews.Author: DesertDweller32
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our visit to NY and our stay at the Radisson in general. It's true, the location is a plus. It's also true that the rooms are quite small (yes, I realize I can book a larger one, but I must pay attention to finances!!) We always had the Chrysler Building in our sights, which was a good marker. Loved the extensive business center with lots of internet stations. Loved the workout facility with a view of the street below. Didn't find the room itself at all noisy. Did bring it to the management's attention about the marble threshold between the room and bathroom. We stubbed our toes more than a few times on it ~ it really does need to be altered for guest comfort. All in all, a decent experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Dirtiest bathroom in NYC”
Reviews.Author: traveller16180
Reviews.Content: My advice is to stay away from this place. The sink and the bathtub had a layer of skum. Have stayed in many hotels before, but have never seen anything like this. Although the linens were fine, the bed was not firm enough. will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Great Radisson”
Reviews.Author: Washington66
Reviews.Content: Hi. We are travelling to NY and staying at the Radisson in September. 5 Nights. My Travel Agent told me it was a 4 Star rated Hotel and that we would enjoy the stay there. Now the reason we are going to begin with is to go to the NY Jets vs Patriots match at the Jets Stadium. Because the Tickets can only be shipped to a USA Postal Address, I have contacted this Hotel so many times. Customer Care have even given me their Direct email address to the Front Desk Manager. NEVER received a reply. So I complained to Customer Care. Was going to change Hotels, but because of some UN Convention on that weekend, the cheapest Hotel would now become more expensive now, if we were to change. If this is the service I am getting from the Radisson NOW, GOD only knows what the stay is going to be like. And looking at the previous reviews here, I most certainly am not looking forward to our stay. 5 nights and return flight from Dublin â‚¬2550. NFL tickets NOT included!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there but OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ash76
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel in May & june for 9 nights in total. Plus point in the hotel were it is close to times square, close to the office of my clients and friendly staff. However they charge me $217 w/o breakfast and paid internet connection in the room (they provide free wireless connection in the lobby but that is not comfortable for everyone), and comparitively small rooms. They charged me more then Holiday inn Express in 45th street, 5th Avenue. Cause my friend booked that hotel during the same period where it cost him 160$/night with deal stay 2 night and get 1 free. And breakfast in the restaurant din't have too many choices. I'd rather prefer buffet breakfast in other small hotels around. Anyway it's average hotel and not too many complaints but not upto the mark. They can improve the quality by changing small small things.

Reviews.Title: “The great Manhattan robbery”
Reviews.Author: Honeybambel
Reviews.Content: The bedbugs which you find in the meantime in many NYC hotels were the friendliest part of my trip. Never ever have I been cheated like in that hotel. I checked in at 11:30pm and immediately connected to the internet until 1:00am. In this hotel I had to pay for 2 days (always until midnight) after I complained at check-out they removed one day internet only to cheat even harder afterwards. At check-out my room-rate was $282. When I received my credit card account I realized that they changed the room rate to $309. Now they refuse to discuss this with me and I have already instructed a lawyer to act on this. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel if you're not spending much time in the room.”
Reviews.Author: PaulusHookJC
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for an overnight in the city. I only needed the room to get ready for a graduation ceremony and sleep a few hours before checking out in the morning. The location of the hotel is fine for getting around the city. I was able to walk to St. Patrick's Cathedral in just a few minutes. So if you're interested in the major mid-town attractions, this hotel would be great. My only issue upon being dropped off was the large number of people sitting and standing out front of the hotel smoking. You had to walk through a deep wave of smoke just to get to the revolving door. Of course, there's little a hotel can do about guests smoking out front, but it wasn't very welcoming. The check-in was very smooth and the staff at the reception desk were very professional and friendly. A+ The room itself was TINY. The bed was comfortable and there was little noise from the street below. The bathroom could use an update. The grout was discolored, the tiles were coming away from the wall, etc. It just looked like it got a half-renovation a number of years ago, and then they forgot about it. Overall, it's OK if your plan is to sleep, but it's not the sort of place I'd want to spend much time.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: daffy85
Reviews.Content: we arrived in our room on the 19th floor, and had to admit our first comment was 'isn't that a small bed for a usa hotel' and 'we've had bigger rooms in other hotels' - but we need not have worried, once we settled in the room it was just what we required and once we got into that bed - wow what a nights sleep we had - just perfect! even having the window open and the hooting of those yellow taxis didn't stop us having a pefect nights sleep - we want one of those mattresses at home in the UK!!! The hotel was just great for what we wanted - a mid town hotel that could get us to all our destinations within walking distance, friendly staff that could answer our everyday questions and ever so smiley cleaning staff. The room was cleaned to perfection every day, and when we got back after a long days 'touristey stuff' we got a starbucks coffee with the obligatory doughnut from downstairs and settled in to our room. There was plenty of films to choose from from the hotel list but we where so tired we never stayed awake to finish one! The only thing that we could give a negative comment about was the bar, which was 13 dollars for 1/2 lager and 1/2 coke and you had to sit in the sushi bar to drink it, we would have preferred a lounge area to sit in comfortable seats after a long day, however we where told we had to sit in the bar. Not a major thing, but thought it was worth commenting on. We had a brilliant 5 nights stay at this hotel and would recommend it to our family and friends without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Small Bed”
Reviews.Author: VAFLYERS
Reviews.Content: I was a little surprised at the size of the bed in the room which appeared to be small but actually was probably average for a New York hotel. The bed gave me a great night sleep after a long day of work.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthernMonkey80
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel as part of a package by our independent travel agent and after reading reviews we were a little sceptical as to what we would find however we were pleasantly surprised. The initial reception by the staff was polite and professional. When booking we had asked for a room above the 5th floor (as we were advised to, to avoid street noise) when we came to check in they had put us on the 3rd floor, but it seemed no problem to them when we pointed out the error and they switched us to the 17 floor. The room was basic but not a bad size for inner city hotels - bigger than one we had in London last year. The room was very clean and although obviously well used it was not too tired looking. Massive TV. Even with the window open the daytime street noise was not awful, although we slept with the window closed as the weather was cool. There was plenty of space to store clothes and a safe too for the valuable bits and bobs! There was a little noise from next rooms and corridor but as a light sleeper I was not troubled by it. Plenty of places to eat close by from sushi to chops and a good store across the street open 24 hours. Also great for transport links with bus, train and subway really close by and loads of tourist attractions within easy walking distance. When organising transport back to Newark airport for our return the concierge service was really helpful giving us plenty of information and prices for all our option. We decided on an executive taxi which they booked for us which made the system run smoothly. The bell boy will also take bags for the day $2 per bag which we found brilliant as we had a night flight. The location of this hotel is excellent, the service professional and the hotel is not the Ritz but comfortable, affordable and great for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay in to get around the city”
Reviews.Author: gilloconnell11
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in this hotel because of its central location and the Radisson's excellent name, but were very disappointed. We arrived for our 5 night stay really excited only to be welcomed by the staff advising me that my credit card had been declined!!! although I knew there was more than enough money on my credit card for our stay. Then she advised me that it had been accepted at a lesser limit and that I was not to use my credit card on anything else!!!!! We then went to our room, which was the smallest room I have ever seen in the USA (we booked a standard room), with two single beds!!!! The room needed some refurbishment and outside our window was a very noisy air conditioning unit. The bathroom I can only describe as disgusting. The basin had a large crack in it, the sink tap was broken, the shower was moldy and the walls were moldy. There was no extractor fan in the bathroom so got very hot and stuffy, I presume that was why it was moldy. We went to reception to complain about the bathroom only to be confronted by someone who could not speak English and could not understand what we were trying to tell her!!!! She finally, I think, understood what we were trying to explain and proceeded to say she would get someone to look at the bathroom, but we heard no more about this and got no feed back regards our complaint The room was cleaned every day but we were not given a change of towels on the first night, then not given enough towels the following days. The bed sheets were torn!!!! We booked a breakfast included package. Breakfast was in the Raffles restaurant and was good and staff were very welcoming. The hotel is in a very convenient area of New York, with many places easy to visit. The staff overall where all very friendly and helpful. We did enjoy our visit to New York and also visited Washington, which is an excellent city. On our next visit to New York we will not, I am sorry to say, be staying at the Radisson Lexington again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a clean, standard chain hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: nlgladstone
Reviews.Content: Which is what I was expecting. We were in NYC for a week and didn't want any surprises so we booked what we figured would be a standard chain hotel. Instead, we got rude service, a disgusting room with stains on the carpets, peeling paint, and mold in the bathroom. The only friendly people at the hotel were the cleaning workers, who were lovely. We called in advance to make sure we could do an early check in, which was denied. Additionally, there "Best Price Guarantee" was not honored. The main reason I cannot recommend this hotel is just how dirty and moldy and run down it was.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel, truly a gem and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: TravelinPinky
Reviews.Content: I just love, love, love this hotel and tell anyone I know going to NYC about it. It's a truly hidden gem. The price is almost always great at about $175/night and the location is UNBELIEVABLE! You can get to everything from here! Central Park, 5th Avenue, many Subway lines to get around town, easy walk to Times Square. The rooms are average sized and nice enough to feel like you are in a nice hotel - not the Waldorf (though I've never stayed there!) but not a dump like some others I've stayed in in NYC. Truly a gem that should be considered because for the price and location, it can't be beat.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Santo Domingo de Heredia, Costa Rica
Reviews.Title: “Great service, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: pwheatley
Reviews.Content: At first we were concerned about coming to the Radisson as there were some bad reviews. However, they seemed to relate to a period a few years ago. That period now seems to be over. We had a great time and stayed - owning to the volcano - twice. Second time the room was a bit small - though they had warned us about this. I have to say the service and staff were great. the place is central and reasonably priced. I would make sure i got the room i wanted before booking but all in all we were impressed and enjoyed both our stays.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable place to stay in the heart of manhattan”
Reviews.Author: gautammohta
Reviews.Content: the most conveniet part about this hotel was its location, on the lexington ave. from where everything in manhattan is a walking distance. the metro is just a block away, and the 5th ave, times sq. and central park are all within 5-15 mins walking distance. amenities in the hotel are good. toilets are clean and the room is comfortable. internet was workin fine and the morning breakfast was decent . i found the prices to be on a lil bit higher side at $230 a night(incl taxes). over all i would recommend the hotel to busines as welll as leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: amuyres
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience with this hotel. Everyone has been so nice and treated me awesome. I loved EDNA and CAROL. Keep up the good work!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing - just one problem after another”
Reviews.Author: bristolal
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the poor reviews about this hotel, but decided to give it a go anyway. That was a big mistake. - When I arrived,the first room I was given was already in use by somebody else! I walked into the room to find a shocked German guy asking what I was doing in his room. - The second room I was given had not been cleaned, and there were some unpleasant crusty green stains on the sheets! The room had a small sign by the phone saying "If you have any problems or requests, please call 8444. You will get immediate attention." (or something similar). I called, and nobody answered, forcing me to go back downstairs, only to once again be offered a different room. (The receptionist mumbled "second time today" to a colleague after I told her the problem). - The third room seemed okay, until: a) I noticed there were no towels in the bathroom. I called 8444 (this time answered) and was told some would be sent up. After waiting an hour, I tried to call again, but once again, no answer. So I had to go downstairs to reception, where I was offered an apology, free breakfast during my stay, and promised that towels would arrive in five minutes, which they finally did. b) I got into bed later that evening, to hear the [drip] [drip] [drip] of water from the air conditioning onto the carpet next to the bed. By this point, I was so sick of changing rooms that I just switched it off, leaving the room a little too hot, but at least quiet. The hotel's website also boasts about its "Complimentary high-speed, wired and wireless Internet", which helped to persuade me to stay there. Despite this, there is nothing complimentary about it - it actually costs about $10 per day. I tried to call 8444 to enquire, but again, no answer. So, another trip to reception, to be told that nothing could be done about this ("change of company policy, I'm afraid"). Only after complaining to a different staff member was I was told that the charges could be waived. The instructions on how to use the 'Sleep Number' bed were missing, making the hotel's boasts about these meaningless. I had to sleep on the bed as it came. On the last night, the air con started dripping again (despite being switched off), which I guessed was because the room next door had started using theirs. I had a terrible night's sleep, for which I was told $50 would be knocked off my bill as an apology. Altogether, my stay at this hotel was characterised by one problem after another. The staff are apologetic, and they did provide free breakfast, waive the internet charges, and knock $50 off the final bill. However, there comes a point where no amount of apologising can make up for the frustration and annoyance of repeated trips to the reception desk (especially when they don't answer the phone, after promising 'immediate attention). I certainly wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: laura15090
Reviews.Content: I would definately stay there again. It was close to the subway & close to my shuttle bus which was near the Waldorf Astoria. Room was small and a little noisy but it was clean and had plenty of hot water. A decent value! The small restaurant downstairs was amazing! We had breakfast vouchers - and the service & food was great! Eggs, bacon, potatoes, coffee, juice, toast - all came promptly and very tasty (not greasy!! ) Amazing service & food! The service staff at the restaurant are definate workers!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, not the best”
Reviews.Author: helzio
Reviews.Content: We went to New York for my 21st, although our trip was cut 2 days short by cancelled flights due to the ash cloud. We went to reception to check in and were told to sit at a desk where one of their receptionists sat and never spoke to us once. She typed away on the computer chatting to her collegue paying no attention to myself or my partner until she asked for our credit card. Of course. We went up to our room to find a small, hardly a double bed room. The room and bathroom was clean and the housekeepers were really friendly and chatty, wishing us a good day everytime we passed them in the hall. As it was my 21st we went to the concierge to ask where was good to eat. He recommended a few places and we said we would be bak later as we were going for a wander. Having stayed in New York before I decided to visit the hotel we stayed at which was top class, one of the best I've stayed in. We asked their concierge where was good to eat and he recomended Bobby Flay's restaurant. We went back to our hotel to book the table only to be met with firing questions about why we went to that hotel to ask. I felt like I was getting in trouble for crying out loud! Really rude staff (apart from the housekeepers!) I dont think I would stay again due to the sheer stuck-up-ness of the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, comfortable NYC hotel, has perhaps seen better days”
Reviews.Author: Sennockian55
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome at reception and a complimentary upgrade was much appreciated. Disappointed that no tea or coffee making facility was to be found in the room. Bathroom small and cramped, nowhere to leave toilet bags. Breakfast was a disaster - poor quality food and service, plus expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great for location, but not so good for bad backs”
Reviews.Author: Heluerto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location, easy to get to the sights. The staff are great and helpful, the rooms are clean and spacious. The beds however, whilst thrilled at the thought of being able to change how soft or hard they were, found that they appeared to be not much more than an aired that you could electronically inflate or deflate. For a couple like us with bad backs, we needed something a bit more comfortable, but for the two nights we were there, it did. The price was also not bad for central Manhatten. And room service was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: amyc85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for 5 nights and had a really good time. All the staff were lovely especially Dennis, who was there if you had any questions. The hotel is in a great location near all the best tourist attractions and only a couple of minutes work to the subway. Will stay at the Radisson Lexington whenever I return to New York City, which hopefully wont be too far away! Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Amazingly lucky--super special price-booked at the last minute!”
Reviews.Author: sandypeters
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the very last minute, a few hours before driving to NYC, only because I happened to check online and found a last minute rate special. I know you're not going to believe me, but really, we reserved two rooms for $89 each with breakfast!!!!! I am NOT LYING! I was so excited, I called all the other parents (a group of us were traveling to watch our kids run in a cross-country race) and several others changed their plans to stay at the Radisson Lexington too. We LOVED the bar area, and the location was absolutely perfect. A quick walk to everything, in a super safe area of NYC. A few subway stops to Times Square, and walking distance to Rockefeller Center. In June we are planning on going to NYC again, and I reserved a room for $424 a night. Of course, I'm hoping for a last minute deal again, but even at $424 a night the location is ideal and the hotel is clean and the staff friendly. The parking is across the street, and it was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Philo10
Reviews.Content: We spent eight nights in the hotel, everybody was very friendly and helpfull, nice spacious rooms. Very good beds. If we ever go back to New York we will choose the radisson again, thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Great Central Location Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Birdie2010
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews on here about the Radisson on Lexington Avenue. On arrival the room wasn't ready and my friend and I had been booked into a double and not a twin! We were asked if we could come back in half an hour and they would try to change rooms for us. We went out to begin our sight seeing, when we returned 4 hrs later, the room had been changed and we were given a "free" voucher for breakfast for the inconvenience. The room was a little on the small side, but comfortable and for the amount of time we spent in it, fine for our needs. The staff are friendly, concerige helpful and there is a Starbucks attached (what more could you want or need). Located on 48th, we were well placed for Grand Central Terminal, Chrylser Building, Empire State, etc. Don't go here if you want 5 star luxury, but if you want a fair priced 3/4 star then I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: xxsxxRachelxxsxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the radison Lexington for 4 night in April 2010, The hotel was very easy to find and check in went smoothy and got took straight to our room on the 22nd floor. The room was pleasant but quite small which is expected of new York. The bathroom could of really done with a good clean and some updating. The view from our room was just of the building opposite which again is what i expected of New York with all the buildings being so tall. The bar and the staff in the bar were all lovely and very helpful, recomending resturants to us and helping us find our way round. The location was suberb, 5mins from 5th Ave, 5mins Grand central station, 5mins from Bloomingdales, 5mins from Rocekerfella centre. There was a starbuck in the hotel which was great but always very busy. All in all we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...there is room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: ViajeroESQ
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely nice. An inviting lobby and unbeatable location. The room was of a decent size for New York and nicely appointed with a brand new LCD, complimentary high speed internet, comfortable "sleep number" bed, good linens and work chair. The bathroom was tiny but.. we are in NYC... Direct access to a diner type place called Raffles which has excelent service for breakfast. Also direct access to a walk through Starbucks.. It beat my expectations but apparently not every room is so new. Make sure you get a renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Well”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Gustafsson
Reviews.Content: Me and my son stayed here for a week and the rooms are in need of refurbishment but generally it is a quit good hotel to the money you spend. Don't eat the breakfast at the Cuban restaurant, it isn't worth the money (but at which hotel is it?). The location is very good if you are there for shopping the big department stores and if you want to be kind of close to Times Square. Good restaurants in the neighborhoud. Go to Bobby Vans for a steak or Naples 45 for really different pizzas...

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: neil-amy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years ago and was not disappointed. Great location and a short walk to Grand Central Station and Central Park. The reception area is very grand and you feel a little disappointed when you reach the rooms however, the rooms were still excellent and excellent value for money. Room service was pretty good too. We were too tired to go out for dinner one night and ate in the room and the food and service was good. Very helpful staff which helped us organise our journey back to JFK airport. If you are looking for a good base to explore NY then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean, tidy and smart”
Reviews.Author: Natalie2627
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Raddison and were very impressed with the hotel. The lobby is smart and very clean, the reception staff are very helpful and friendly. We were on the 3rd floor, we were pleased with our room. It had a flat screen TV, had a comfortable bed and the room and bathroom were very clean and tidy. The bar in the hotel is expensive (1 x beer and 1 x cocktail came to $23!) The resturant Raffles is also expensive but lovely! We had waffles, pancakes an OJ and a coffee which came to $50 odd dollars (including a tip). I would recommend it, we ate there twice. The staff here are very friendly. Check out San Martin (Italian) on 49th between 3rd and Lexington and Mama Mexico on 49th between 2nd and 3rd, both do lovely food and very resonable price wise. I would def stay here again and would recommend it to anyone, it is a very nice hotel and centrally placed for everything.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: d2952
Reviews.Content: i know every one has differrent experiences, but i can not fault this hotel in anyway, we have recently spent 6 nights at the hotel, whilst there cabin crew were checking in, and as i work for a major airline i know the high standards that hotels have to meet and continue to meet for airlines to use them, so dont be put off by some of the comments on this site. when we arrived we were able to check into our rooms straight away and after long flight was very welcome. the receptionist was friendly nad helpful, the rooms were fine, clean well presented with flat screen telly and clean bathroom - people are moaning on this site about the rooms, get real, your staying in new york (all rooms in america are on the small side) and are there for the city not to sit in your hotel room, the rooms more than met our needs, as for the corridors yes the carpets were a little worn on the corridors but considering how many people who stay there carpets are going to get worn, but on the whole the hotel was clean, well presented the staff were so friendly, the conciege anita is a wealth of local knowledge as is so friendly and can not do enough to help you, this is the same for all the staff we came into contact with from the receptionist to the maids who clean your rooms on the first night we ate in raffles the restaurant attached to the hotel - the food was excellent, reasonably priced with good service, yes you can get food cheaper at local diners but on our first night we didnt want to go too far from hotel, breakfast is another thing, we didnt have breakfast at the hotel far far too expensive and limited choice, there are lots of places to eat near by the 24 hours shops/diners are excellent for breakfast if you come out the hotel and go past grand central station, there is an excellent diner called blooms just up from grand central station food is top class and service is excellent i cant understand the negative comments on here, we had great time and cant waite to go back, i would certainly reccomend this hotel, remember your in new york to see the city not stay in your room, its a great location centrally located, if your get the grey line city bus tour tickets - the nearest stop is just up the road outside the astoria hotel. great time, thanks everyone at the raddison for your hospitality, friendliness and for making our stay so enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “more than value for money”
Reviews.Author: jempie145
Reviews.Content: the service we received was great. the room we had was noisy, but the staff did everthing to have us to another more quite room. the manager did all she could to help us immediately with results. the price quality for this quality was great, and we do not understand where some negative comments come from. For us they get a very high score. In one word, more than value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A Tip for the Tourist”
Reviews.Author: MuchtravelledOAP
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was good value & previous reviews are very helpful particularly getting a room which avoids overlooking Lexington Avenue & associated traffic noise. It is ideally located for tourism. We were asked on arrival for a credit card & I handed over my Prepaid Currency Card (which protects my identity since it is anonymous except for the signature on the reverse) after explaining that I had no intention of incurring costs over and above the payment of our room which had been paid last September. On departure it was confirmed that there were no further charges & that my card had not been charged. WRONG! In continuing our holiday I started to be refused transactions & although we had alternative means of payment this completely defeated the object of buying the card. I telephoned the card issuer in the UK to be told that the Radisson Hotel had taken $220 off me. Fortunately the lady I spoke to believed that I had no knowledge of this, checked my impeccable credit record & my ancestors back to The Tudors and a) said that within a few days the Hotel should cancel the debt b) was prepared to refund me this cost so that I could continue my purchases using the card The UK agencies are pushing these prepaid cards & yes they are concenient but this is just a tip should other tourists get caught out through no fault of their own. I complained to the Hotel & received a relatively uncompromising reply which simply stated that this was their policy & that this should have been properly explained at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located Hotel - But a bit rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Jonnym_7
Reviews.Content: We made a late booking to stay at this hotel for 3 nights as we had to leave our previous hotel due to the Volcano erruption which cancelled our plane. Our previous hotel had increased their rates dramatically, so we were looking for a hotel that was more affordable. We booked this room on the Radisson website and got a rate of around Â£150 a night without breakfast. As the prices were high and it is a Radisson hotel, we thought it would be pretty good, but the only good thing about it was the location. It is located on 48th street, so takes about 20 mintues to walk to Central Park and about 30 mintues to Times Suare, plus there are subway stations very close. In terms of the hotel, we arrived about an hour before check in, and most hotels would normally get you checked in early, especially as this hotel has over 700 rooms. They did not, so therefore we had to store our bags and pay $2 per bag, they tried to even charge for a small bag which we attached to a suitcase, so just took it off and paid for the 2 suitcases. When we checked in, the hotel we were given was on the 17th floor, and faced Lexington Avenue. The room was a petite room, and they were not joking, a very small double bed, desk and drawers, plus the rooms needed a bit of TLC, especially the bathrooms. We spent 1 night in this room, in which we got no sleep due to the noisy Lexington Avenue. The windows let in so much noise!!! The next day we asked to move rooms, which they said was possible between 3pm and 6pm and was told we would have a room on the 23rd floor facing the back of the hotel where it is quieter. At 5.30pm we went back to Reception to sort this out, and they were not able to do this at this time, and said we needed to wait another hour. At 6.30 we were called in our room and were told we could now change rooms, so had to head back to Reception and sort it out. The next room ended up being on the 21st floor, and was facing the back of the hotel which was a lot quieter, however the bed was uncomfortable, as the matress sunk into the middle from both sides, and everytime you moved even a little bit it squeaked. Also, room and bathroom was tidy and clean, but the inside window was very dirty and had not been cleaned for a long time as you can see from the dirt on my fingers in picture i added. For Â£150 a night I would expect a lot better from a 4 star establishment. Would never stay here again, and after this experience will stay away from Radisson hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with Radisson Lexington”
Reviews.Author: rinibos
Reviews.Content: We s and stayed her from 11 to 23 april this year. We enjoyed our stay here. Room was quite nice, staff was very friendly and helpfull. Location was fine. Couldn't complain about anything. Because of the volcano erupting we came into trouble; we were not able to go home. We went to the reception on the morning we were supposed to leave an that's where Brenda came in. Because the hotel was sold out she at first called other hotels for us and arranged a place for the coming night. We were really afraid to be on the streets since the problems for hotels and airport were called "worse than 9/11". Brenda put us on the list in case someone would not come and that happened. we were called at the hotelroom that we could stay for three nights and cancel if any plain could take us home earlier. We had to stay for more night since we could'nt fly back earlier than six days further on and we could lengthen our stay for those days also. At the end we were able to fly a day earlier and she gave us permission to stay at the room till 04.00 pm. Conclusion; we were very grateful for her help and service. We were also very happy with the businesscenter, where was free internet. This room was a hot spot for many guests to try arranging a flight home.

Reviews.Title: “great value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: ywg_traveller
Reviews.Content: Quick Hits: great location in regards to Grand Central and Times Square; great value for NYC. Helpful staff. Long Story: We arrived late (midnight) on Wed night (for 4 nights) and had no trouble getting to the hotel from LGA nor any problems checking in. As for the room; yes it was a little cramped and yes there was a VERY small amount of flaking plaster/drywall in the bathroom (this has been reported in previous reviews, but I only mention it again to be fair and I feel that the bathroom was immaculate other than that). When my wife (who did all the research for this trip) first presented the hotel options to me I wasn't too sure as they all seemed rather expensive. Welcome to NYC!!! The truth, after talking to other travellers to NYC is that the Radisson Lex is a great deal with helpful staff and a great location. If you want big spacious and perfect rooms, be prepared to spend between two and even three times more (Hyatt anyone?) If you want cheaper, be prepared for some scary places!! We will be coming back to New York and will be staying at this hotel again. Another complaint I read was about the noise. We were on the 17th floor and, while we didn't have much of a view, we had no noise from the night club next door and only minimal street noise. It's the "city that never sleeps" people!! Even the Plaza has street noise! If you're a light sleeper you may want to include ear plugs (this goes for any hotel in NYC). For me, the only issue was the wireless internet, which seemed spotty (as an IT pro I'm on call pretty much 24/7 and when I need to get on it NEEDS to work) But on a vacation, if that's the worse thing, I've had a pretty damn good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really good value”
Reviews.Author: Zuzana82
Reviews.Content: This hotel has really great location, everything is close in walking distance, when you want to get to the downtown, subway is just two blocks from hotel. We appreciated very good choice of restaurants in the hotel - Sushi bar at hotels lobby was great, probably best sushi I have ever eaten, staff there was incredible, as well in Cuban restaurant in the hotel. Our room was spacious and very good equipped (we had junior suite). We asked for the highest possible floor and we got 26th floor which offered us really great views throughout Lexington avenue and surrounding streets. Our friends got junior suite on 23rd floor and they had two really huge terrace with great views.

Reviews.Title: “What a great deal for the location!”
Reviews.Author: SiliconValleyEyes
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were in control, with composure, and welcoming even when a wave of guests from California and South Africa checked in in the morning all at the same time. We got our room 4 hours earlier than the check in time (the staff requested the housekeeping team to get the rooms done quick for tired travelers). When we got to the room, it was sparkling clean. The bed was huge and very comfortable for someone like me who had a major lower back pain. Linens smelled clean. If you want great access to the Grand Central station, convenient stores, Staples, vicinity (walking distance) to Times Square, United Nations, shopping area, local Asian & American restaurants and Starbucks, this is the place to be. When we were tired, it was an easy walk back to the hotel to get some rest. Then, an hour or two after, we were back on the streets again. We didn't spend an arm and a leg for a comfortable place. Lexington street good access to taxis but the sound doesn't resonate to the rooms. We had a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL, GREAT SERVICE, AND LOCATION. WILL STAY AGAIN.”
Reviews.Author: y2yahe
Reviews.Content: After having a not so great stay at another hotel in NYC, i found this hotel by reading other reviews. This hotel is a great value, the rooms are very comfortable, the bed is great you can set it to be softer or harder, they have nice restaurants and the area is just great. My experience was great al thanks to Dana (i hope thats how it is spelled) we had late flight the next day and she was great trying to help us get a late checkout, she was always friendly even when we bothered her so much to make sure we got our frequent flyer miles for the stay. The hotel bellman im sorry i dont remember the name immediately came to help us get a cab (you know how that can be in NYC). My boyfriend and I would love to stay at this hotel again (we stay in a hotel in NYC 2 or 3 times a year) if we can get a good price again, but it is definitely a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Disappointing Room”
Reviews.Author: Cheezypuf
Reviews.Content: I had some difficulties trying to use the concierge services before I arrived at the hotel. I communicated these to the General Manager who was gracious and upgraded the room for us on arrival. Unfortunately the hotelâ€™s computer system wasnâ€™t working when we arrived and we were told to come back later. This wasnâ€™t a great reception â€“ we should have been told to rest in a room until they solved their problem. The room was reasonable, with plenty of niggles. It was a little tired, with faded flaky paint in the bathroom. The heating couldnâ€™t be regulated and the only way to cool the room was to open the bathroom window. There was some kind of voicemail for me, but there were no instructions for how to retrieve the message, and neither reception nor the telephone switchboard operator was able to provide assistance. The main disappointment was the bed. It had some kind of electrically operated system for moving the shape of the mattress. This didnâ€™t work and was stuck, resulting in a dome-shaped mattress, i.e. a big lump in the middle of the bed. This was very uncomfortable and I didnâ€™t sleep as a result. On a positive note, most of the staff at the hotel were friendly and pleasant, and the reception manager (a blond-haired Russian lady was especially welcoming and warm).

Reviews.Title: “Our one night, romantic getaway was a delight”
Reviews.Author: DSSNyc
Reviews.Content: I live in New York City and was looking for a romantic, leisurely getaway from our home for one night and found it here. The room was immaculate and huge (thanks to an upgrade). The staff was very courteous and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Wokinghamtravellers
Reviews.Content: Really modern hotel with lovely rooms and excellent staff. Rooms have beds that you can adjust by remote control to change how hard/soft the mattresses are. Great location and would recommend using the subway as there's a lot of walking if you want to see New York. Also recommend Ellen's Stardust Diner between 50th and 51st Street where the waiters and Waitresses sing live in between serving your meals - really fun restaurant. Also recommend going on a horse and cart ride around Central Park which costs about $34 for up to 4 passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Central, Comfortable and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: DillonWales
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights from 24 March and was a bit worried when I read the reviews some people had written (bed bugs come to mind). Ineed not have worried, the hotel is an excellent place to stay, and we would stay again. We stayed in an Executive Room, very comfortable, bed extremely comfortable and clean. Breakfast included, you do have a different menu however there is still a selection to chose from, my husband had a cooked breakfast every day, juice, toast and coffee. Our room was on the 8th floor and we were over the air conditioning unit outside, however, this did not disturb us in the night and we had a good nights sleep. We did not have dinner in the hotel, but there is a marvellous Indian restaurant The Maharaja on 133 East 45th Street. Exit through Sarbucks, turn left and walk for a couple of blocks and turn left onto East 45th Street the restaurant is on your left. We ate there 4 times in a week, supberb food and prices. Do not be put off by the decor, it is very small but very friendly. They did not have any Chardonnay wine one night, they asked me to write down the wine I wanted and they went out and bought a bottle, where else would you get service like that. A marvelous selection available, including a dinner special for $12.95, choose 1 appetizer or 1 soup or 1 salad, plus 2 entrees 1 vegetable, 1 chicken or meat, includes nan bread and papadam. Hotel only 5 minutes walk from Grand Central Station and even closer to 51st Street. Buses available 42nd street for crosstown and 2nd Avenue for downtown. One great tip is to buy a weekly unlimited Metro Ticket if you are there for a week, unlimited travel on subway and buses for $27. Just swipe the card each time you use it, and buy it at any subway station. For those on their first trip to NY you ideally need a metro ticket for travel on the subway and buses, as the buses only accept correct fare for each trip $2.25. Just go to the nearest subway station and you can by them at the machine, you can buy a variety of tickets so there will be one to suit you. A really nice treat is to have a private car back to the airport, just see the Bell Capain and he will arrange it all for $60. Taxi from the airport is $45 plus tolls so not much difference in price. Found the service in the hotel very good, and the free internet access in the Business Centre is excellent, especially if you need to check in on line for your return flight. We flew with British Airways during the strike, a bad experience as they cancelled our return flight but did not think to tell us!!!! The internet access helped us enormously to arange new flights and keep an eye on the flight to ensure it was not cancelled again. Staff were very helpful, especailly when our flight cancelled and she rang the airline on my behalf, cannot fault the service we received at all. Found all staff to be helpful and friendly. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: belfastpride
Reviews.Content: After getting a good deal on the hotel via their website for March accommodation, we booked - the price point was good compared to nearby other hotels. I then decided afterwards to look a bit more in-depth and found more reviews and mentions about bedbugs and late night noise. The hotel is in a good place, central, and within 10-15 minutes safe walk of Times Square, 5th Avenue, Broadway etc. When we got there, all was fine - the room was a bit on the small side but it was clearly stated what size it would be so that was fine. A quick check for those little bed bugs and nothing was found. After six nights of pleasant sleeping (the first three were a bit odd because we didn't know the bed softness could be adjusted!) we were set to check out. We did have a problem where the heating broke on the last night. After raising the issue, we were offered the choice of having work done for half an hour or so, or the loan of a portable heater as we were leaving the following day. We chose the heater as we had to pack and it would be quicker. On check-out, when asked if everything was okey, we mentioned the situation regarding the heat being broken and a receptionist was to get back to us to help settle the account later in the day. A few hours later an e-mail arrived with a revised bill to include discount for the broken heating - now that's service. I was well impressed. Perhaps some people just have a bad experience, but we definitely didn't experience any significant problems, and the one that did was resolved fast and very satisfactorily. I'd stay again and regardless of the reviews I read, I know that if there's an issue the hotel are more than happy to help!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with an excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: HKFOSLO
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 5 nights a few weeks ago and our expectations were not all that high based on previous reviews. Our reason for chosing the hotel was the location, but we were pleasantly surprised to find that the hotel was actually really nice! The staff was friendly and helpful, the room clean, quiet and of adequate size and the location, of course, was superb! Practically every major site was close by or within walking distance, and for the ones that weren't the metro was just a few blocks away. Unbeatable! The diner Raffles was quite nice. Good food (amazing curly fries) and friendly service. All in all - very good value for money, we would definitely stay here again :0)

Reviews.Title: “Total crap”
Reviews.Author: dutchgirl64
Reviews.Content: I will not bore the reader with the laundry list of things that went wrong during my 1 night stay at the Radisson Lexington Hotel (they could not find my pre-paid reservation, horrific noise from the room next door, dirty floors, unhelpful and very unfriendly manager (Janicka) and receptionists) - but I felt as though I would be remiss if I did not warn fellow travellers about this hotel. When we arrived after an almost 8 hour flight, they could not find our prepaid reservation in spite of our voucher. We had to tell this story to about 5 different people including the female manager Jalicka, and every single one of them left us waiting in the lobby for almost 3 hours without doing any effort to solve that problem. It was about 10.30 PM when they offered us (4 friends) 2 rooms at a rate of 163 dollars each and they had to be prepaid. We had to take that offer because it was too late to find another hotel. We got 2 rooms at the 11th floor, and in one of them was a one-person bed (to be occupied by 2 persons). So we had to go to the lobby again and we finally got a room where we could sleep with 2 persons. Although, sleep.....in the room next door there was some kind of gang-fight going on during the whole night. A lot of noise, shouting, screaming and blooded towels outside that room the next morning. Security didn't do a thing about it. To make the experience complete the rooms are not very clean, with long black hair in the sink and plaster coming off the ceiling. Overall ... the service is crap, the rooms are crap, and aside from the location... this hotel has nothing to offer. Lucky enough we found another hotel the next day where they were very hospitable. I always thought Radisson is a well-known name in the hotel branche, but for me....never again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jarrodaston
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but got upgraded to a suite. Really nice hotel, central and has all the amenities one requires. Pity the bathroom only had a bath/shower....hate that but otherwise I would stay here agin no problem.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL IN A GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: alwaysowen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson from the 11th to the 15th October 2010. On leaving JFK we went outside to look for a taxi, a word of warning to first time travellers to NYC, take a taxi from the rank and not from someone who says their cab is parked in the car park nearby, they are legitimate cabs but will over charge you. We payed $120 dollars for an old rattle wagon from the airport and $60 for a limo back to the airport. On our arrival the reception staff were friendly and efficient. The luggage staff were like Jack Flash, if a bit miserable, but to be honest we found this to be the case of most New Yorkers we met, they made you feel like you were inconveniencing them just by being there. The room was smaller than some hotels, but for the money it was clean, well appointed and more than adequate for our stay. We were in room 2624 on the 26th floor, so we missed most of the traffic noise, we were by the lift however, which was a bit noisey through the night, we were so tired it didnt really bother us, but it may be a problem for light sleepers. The bed was amazing, fabulously comfy and it had a gizmo attached to it where you could adjust the firmness of your mattress. The bathrooms are small but adequate. The hotel has a couple of restaurants, Raffles is nice but a bit expensive, there's an all you can eat diner accross the road where you can get much better value for money. We didnt venture into the cocktail lounge, but it looked really cosy. The hotel is ideally situated, just at most a 20 minute walk to many points of interest such as Grand Central, Chrysler Building, Times Square, Empire State etc. If you are a first time traveller to NYC as we were, there is a help desk in the lobby, the staff there are really helpfull and will point you in the general direction of any tours you wish to go on. We chose the Redline Bus Tours, its a 36hr ticket, where you can get on and off at various points of interest. Its good value, but look out for the English guide, he's much friendlier and much more knowledgeable than the others we came across (more miserable New Yorkers unfortunatley). If you wish to see a show during your stay, you can get tickets for the older shows at the ticket office under the big red staircase in Times Square for a fraction of the price if you book direct at the theatre or at your hotel. But be prepared to queue. For any of the newer shows, such as the Lion King or Billy Elliot or Wicked, its probably better to book online before you go as these are mostly sold out by the time you get there. If you go for a pre breakfast stroll around Central Park, as we did, and are looking for a good value breakfast, try Angelas Deli at Central and 6th, nothing special inside, but you get as good a breakfast as anywere else but for $6.00, pretty good when you can pay up to $25.00 each at a lot of other establishments. All in all we enjoyed our visit to NYC, the New Yorkers arnt a very friendly bunch, but the hotel was great and the staff in the main were lovely, we would certainly stay there again. HOPE YOU ENJOY YOUR STAY IN THE BIG APPLE :-)

Reviews.Title: “A good city centre hotel but be careful which room you get”
Reviews.Author: lex60
Reviews.Content: The Radisson has a good location and during our stay we found the staff friendly and helpful. It has a good diner, Raffles, and the cocktail bar is also good. There are other restaurants within the hotel but we stuck with the diner. Our first bedroom was on the 28th floor but was adjacent to a service lift and machinery room making it very noisy at night. As a result, we complained and got a 'standard' room on the 15th floor which was fine. There is a late checkout available - 15.00. Overall, a good hotel used by business people, fine for couples but not a family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Coop66
Reviews.Content: The Pure Clean Air Floor was terrific. Very comfortable, clean and convenient hotel. Staff was great and very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for all the main attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Maz1986
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Although the mini bar is dangerous as it is basically just a tray with items on it and if you remove the item, you instantly get charged for it! Great central location for Chrysler building, Rockfeller centre, 5th Ave shops, Central Park. There are some great local cafes nearby so i had no reason to try the food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & rooms for the price, Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: cml79
Reviews.Content: First, I will note the Cons, although I do feel that the Pros outweighed them by far. 1- The room was on the 21st floor, but the street noises were still quite loud at night, making it difficult to sleep. It was definitely in need of better insulation and sound-proofing, however I have found this in many areas of NYC, and I could have complained and moved rooms but chose not to. 2- The only other Con was regarding the food. We ordered two warm bread puddings from room service one night and they were both served cold. Also, the service at the Sung Dynasty restaurant was horrendous. We arrived at 9pm for dinner, and they said that "Of course" they were still serving, and led us to our seats. Our server was very rude, and the whole wait staff sat around staring at us impatiently waiting for us to finish our meals so they could go home. We felt this was odd and uncalled for, considering they were supposed to be open until 10:30pm. Anyway, we rushed through our meals and literally threw back our bottle of wine because we were so uncomfortable. Now, the Pro's: Other than the things listed above, our stay was fantastic! From the bellman, to the concierge, to the front desk attendants, to the maid service, the staff at this hotel really made our stay! Literally every staff member that we encountered was kind, helpful, gracious, and willing to do whatever needed to be done to accommodate us. Also, given that I had to change my reservation several times prior to arrival, I fully expected to have some problems once we arrived, however, everything was in order and fully taken-care-of. We even got a room upgrade. This was a breath of fresh air for a weary traveler. It is because of this level of customer service, and the value of the rooms for the price and location, that we will return. The rooms were really very nice for such a great price in NYC, especially in that location. It is extremely close to Grand Central Station, and within walking distance to Times Square, 5th Ave, etc., and is in a safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel added to an unforgettable experience.”
Reviews.Author: welshwizard65
Reviews.Content: We visited NYC in March with our friends to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday. The rooms (standard) were big enough and very comfortable. The staff were extremely professional and always helpful, even when presented with a room-decorating request for our friends' wedding day! Thanks Anita ; ) As a base for seeing New York, the Radisson Lex is ideally situated - a short walk to 5th Avenue - and is a great place to relax after a long day enjoying the incredible sights. We would definitely put this hotel at the top of our list when we come back to New York! The sooner the better!

Reviews.Title: “For New York city this is a good hotel, however”
Reviews.Author: mshag
Reviews.Content: First the good thing: The hotel was very clean and the rooms were comfortabley furnished. The staff were very nice and accomadating. Excellent location. However, I listening to banging doors all night, every night and whistling wind coming from a window that would not close properly.
