The room was very small, glad that I was not sharing this room with my husband. When I had to extend another night because of extended business, they raped me on the price, more than double the average price for the three previous nights. I would recommend this hotel with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: rockstar89
Reviews.Content: Great location & accommodations are what you expect in a Radisson. I have stayed at many and with the exception of the size of the room (pretty small) this one could have been anywhere in the U.S. Front desk clerk was very nice even at my check in time of 2am.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for New York”
Reviews.Author: LadyTravelToronto
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with 1 double bed and requested 2 beds. When we arrived, they managed to find us a room with 2 single beds which was great. Check in service, housekeeping and maintenance are quick. Rooms are small but expected in New York. Washrooms are a little run down. Hallways to the rooms are very dark and definitely need some freshening up. The bar area gets really busy in the early evenings. Good location...about a 15 minute walk to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent service in an excellent part of the city!”
Reviews.Author: Jackarmy71
Reviews.Content: My wife (I can say that now!) and I stayed at the Radisson Lexington from 6th March until 13th March. We were in New York (for the first time) to celebrate out friend's 50th and had also decide to get married at the City Clerk's Office in Worth Street. All I can say is what an amazing place. The hotel was superb and was situated perfectly for exploring all of what New York has to offer. Times Square, 5th Avenue, Central Park etc are all a short walk away. Our room was on the 17th floor and although you could hear the taxis beeping their horns and the hotel staff blowing their whistles throughout the night this just added to the amazing atmosphere that makes New York such a wonderful place. The room was perfect and the cleaning service was faultless. If I could pick one bad point it would be the lack of kettle in the room. However, there is a Starbuck's in the lobby and we were down there every morning enjoying a coffee and watching the New Yorkers go about their business. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and polite and decorated out room with balloons and banners after the wedding (very nice touch!). I would question as to why the bar isn't open later? Some evenings we returned to the hotel at about 11pm to find the bar closed. However, I can't wait to go back to the Radisson Lexington. As someone once said..."I'LL BE BACK!"

Reviews.Title: “Don't swing the cat!”
Reviews.Author: Weekyle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel for 5 nights 12th-17th March for a wee break to the Big Apple. This was our first time in NY and despite several people offering their own advice and hotel experiences, we opted to book via the web. We chose the Lexington. We arrived around 2pm, with the Bell-boy taking our bags approx 15ft from the kerb side to just pass the rotating door and stood with his hand out, telling us that he was finished for the day and we were to have a nice day! So, rather than engage in a dispute over the merits of his efforts ( or lack of) 2 dollars were deposited in his gloved palm. Booked in and the room wasn't ready, although it does say 3pm check-in, it would appear that they can't or won't budge on early entry into your room. After a 7hr flight, it would have been nice. So rather than wait, we left our bags with the Bell Captain and went out for the day! There is a Satrbucks on site right on Lexington, but there are no seats within, although you can take your coffee into the Hotel Lobby. When we finally got in our room, it was tiny for a double. Now, as I say this is the first time I have been in NY, but it was a small double bed, with a 42 inch plasma TV approx 2 feet from the side of our bed. A small cupboard ( smelled damp) for clothes with an easy to use safe-FREE!! The bathroom was ok but nothing special. We were 22 floors up, it has 27. The noise at night and early morning was incredible. The wind howled through the ill-fitting windows, and this was not double glazing at it's best-every sound for some reason was magnified. The problem is, once your settled in, it really feels like more of a hassle to start complaining and moving. The concierge staff were helpful, but DO NOT PURCHASE TICKETS FOR A SHOW. The mark-up is 100% and in fairness they tell you, but just shrug their shoulders. The location is ok, your one block down from the Waldorf and 3 blocks from the Chrsyler building. In fact that is what your paying for-LOCATION- nothing more. It worked out roughly 140 quid per night for room only. I have seen more space in Travel lodges etc than this room, but it depends what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of blonde night manager”
Reviews.Author: hgoldman77
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Radisson after my suburban home lost power in a storm. The hotel was lightly booked, and the weekend manager permitted me and my wife to stay at the hotel for $99 on a Sunday night, $179 on Monday. When I learned that power might not be restored until Wednesday or Thursday, I went down to the Front Desk to inquire about extending my stay, should the power outage continue. The man attending the Front Desk informed me that the hotel had "plenty of availability" and he said he didn't think it would be a problem. Then he asked the night manager, an unattractive, large woman at the desk, and she said the rate for the room woujld be $279. That effectively threw us out in the cold. We booked a less expensive room at the Cosmopolitan downtown. A lovely place. That night manager ruined what could have been a pleasant stay. She should go into a different line of work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: lavelle78
Reviews.Content: I do not understand all of the negative reviews on this site, I think some do not understand how small the rooms in new york are, you cannot go to NYC and expect a room that you would get in florida. I have stayed at this hotel before and it still gives great service. We arrived early to check in since we had a broadway show at 2pm. Upon our arrival the girl at the front desk (Anika) welcomed us and stated that our room was not ready yet but it would be shortly, we asked if there was somewhere we could change and they helped us out and also held our bags for free until we returned to check in. I was also upgraded to a large Lexington room since I signed up for the estandby upgrade, and all i have to say is WOW a room in NYC with 2 bathrooms and a king bed. When we asked if there were any good italian restaurants nearby Anika again gave us a list and we picked Nannis, and the food was to die for. The room was clean and comfortable with no issues. Upon check out we were greeted again with the same GREAT service. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone for the value, location and service I have received over and over again. Everyone make your own decision on this Hotel and remember its NYC the rooms are smaller anywhere you stay!! ***Book your room with the parking package (trust me its worth it)***

Reviews.Title: “find another place to stay”
Reviews.Author: icmesaview
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a cramped room with a queen bed. After speaking to the manager about our disappointment with our room, she eventually upgraded us to a deluxe room. We were surprised when we entered the new room to find it to be no different than the other, with one exception; the bed was an upgraded mattress, that was it. The room looks nothing like their photos depict on their website. With the reservation you are given a comp breakfast. I ordered the French Toast. It comes with coffee, juice and a serving of your choice of meat. I was served one slice of french toast, cut in half, and one slice of bacon. Neither were that appealing. I just about lost what little I ate after seeing a cockroach crawl down the wall to our table, and we immediatley got up to leave. I suppose the staff is used to the bugs, they barely batted an eyelash ! There were two positives things about this location, there is a cocktail bar just off the lobby, and a Starbucks just next to the breakfast restaurant. A latte was my breakfast that day. There is also a restaurant in the building, but we dined elsewhere for our holiday visit, so I cannot give it a review.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jacky70
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb with my best friend, we came to celebrate my upcoming 40th! Had the most amazing time ever, even with the snow nothing stopped us! Hotel was fab, all the staff were very friendly and helpful, loved the cuban resturant, food was excellent. Rooms were comfortable, not the biggest in the world but good by New York standards, we managed fine even with all our shopping!! Will definitely be booking again for another shoping trip with my friend, and hopefully with my husband and children soon. Can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ArnabPutih
Reviews.Content: I like the hospitality and friendliness of the staff of the hotel. Enjoyed our dinner at S Dynasty with its excellence food and romantic ambience. It's within walking distance to 5 Ave for shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in NY area”
Reviews.Author: Avatar1a
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really well located to get some good feeling of NYC. Few blocks fron Time Square and a nice walk to Central Park through 5th Av. is worth a trip. Ask rooms which does not have windows on Lexington directly there i very noisy disco there which keeps you awake till 4:00-5:00AM.

Reviews.Title: “First timer to New York - From England”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaker005
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the 23rd feb very wet cold day, hotel staff checked us in very quickly, we were on the 9th floor,two beds, two bathrooms all very clean, altho shower in one bathroom not working it was not an issue for us, only had to call down to reception once and that was when we arrived back to the hotel after a very long day sight seeing to find that we had not had any chamber maid service or clean towels, within minutes we had clean towels and straight after chamber maid arrived and changed the sheets it was the nite before the snow storm, the room was lovely and warm just what you wanted as it was so cold outside. The staff were very friendly and hotel in good location for all the sights and we will certainly be going back to new york and staying at the hotel, its a good base, we never eat in the hotel but found a great place called the oxford just up the road. All in all a good hotel, yes it was abit noisy outside but hey its new york what more do you want we slept well and the beds were very comfortable. We stayed for 6 days and left on the 28th of feb.

Reviews.Title: “good bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: MNoble
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, clean and convenient. As long as you get a reasonable daily rate (around USD 135 per night) it has all that you need for business or leisure. The wireless internet connection is free and is relatively quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities”
Reviews.Author: auldleither
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 25th February in middle of snow and more snow. Hotel staff courteous and friendly. Room clean and comfortable and less noisy probably because we were on the 22nd floor. Raffles was speedy, efficient and really great quality for service and food and price reasonable. Housekeeping in particular was first class. Our experience was an excellent oneand we would have no hesitation in returning when in New York. Jim and Moira Fergie from Edinburgh

Reviews.Title: “First time to New York”
Reviews.Author: flighty61
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Spitting distance of all we came to see. Not altogether happy with the lack of response to my daughter's 21st birthday arrangements. None were forthcoming but being British we said nothing. This is despite emailing and phoning the hotel in advance. We would, however, stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good rating because of overall visit”
Reviews.Author: mrsp17
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in excellent location. All the staff we dealt with were very friendly & helpful & even when passing staff said good morning etc, . We were allocated a room with a v small bed and as my husband is 6"2 I returned to reception & asked for a room with a larger bed, Receptionist was very polite &helpful & allocated us an upgraded room straight away. Rooms are a little worn round the edges but have the things you expect from a 3 star hotel in a very busy city that is obviously well used. It was clean,had comfy bed,good flat screen TV, free wireless internet in room and nice lobby & bar area with good atmosphere .

Reviews.Title: “Two sides to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RossisGirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived and checked in no problem although we were on the 20th floor and our friends on the 14th. I was horrified to see the room we were given. It was very small (worse than European rooms), the window did not lock, the seal was broken and the wind howling through (v cold outside). Walls were dirty and handles falling off the drawers. We complained and a handyman came pretty quickly to fix the window. It was unfixable so we asked to be moved which we were, to the 23rd floor. What a difference!!!! Bigger room, very clean, everything working, warm. We were a bit puzzled as to why we hadn't been given this room in the first place as the other was very obviously not habitable, but we were just happy to be sorted. Food very dear so we always breakfasted at the deli across the road which is really good. Brilliant location for shopping and sightseeing and the willingness to rectify the situation means that I would recommend the hotel. But if you get Room 2018 ask for another room!!

Reviews.Title: “In a nutshell......don't bother”
Reviews.Author: Sheanie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from New York City, great holiday, lots to do and see, food and drink not so cheap any more unfortunately - great breakfasts to be had though would you believe in Grand Central Station. There is a food court there with loads to choose from and even a Magnolia Bakery!! Sadly the Radisson on Lexington Avenue was a bit of a let down. This was a surprise Christmas pressie from my amazing partner who booked through a local agent. He unfortunately does not use the internet (like me) and trusted the agent who said it was a 3/4 star hotel. I definitely would not have booked this hotel if it were left to me as I almost always use Trip Advisor beforehand! When we got back and I read the other reviews, they were definitely not wrong. The hotel is not in a brilliant location and you have to walk miles to get anywhere (it seems). We checked in and had to make our own way to the room with no help with our cases. Our first room which we were given the air conditioning unit was outside our window and kept us awake all night. There is a very small wardrobe and not enough drawer space. We were actually moved the next day after complaining about the noise. Generally, rooms are a bit on the shabby side although there was supposed to have been a refurb !!!? Staff not very helpful at all. Did not give us any information about hotel facilities etc ! Hotel bar absolutely "through the roof prices". Finally, after checking the reviews when I got home, it added up.....I had been itching for most of the holiday and the problem is either cheap washing powder, too much starch on the sheets or (hopefully not) bed bugs I have read. Definitely give this one a miss. Hilton Garden at Times Square is in a fab location. Might try next time !!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our first stay in New York at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: Thomshar
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in NY and I took my husband for his 40th birthday. We had a lovely stay at the Radisson and our room, although looking out onto rooftops at the side, was a really decent size and much bigger than I expected having read previous reviews. Our room was 326 and the cleaner Gloria did a fantastic job every day, changing all the bedding each morning so the room was lovely, clean, fresh and smelled good on our return after a long day sightseeing. The only problem I experienced was on the last day I had a call for the Manager who asked me to re-confirm my credit card details as their system had gone down. He asked for me by my full name and thus I knew it must have been an employee from within the Hotel. Turns out by the time I got back more than Â£600 had been used from my card! When I called the hotel they insisted this was an outside call but that is absolutely impossible. They also confirmed that it had happened to more than one guest on the same day - I'm sorry Radisson but NO ONE knew my full name except for the hotel with whom I had booked the room and I am certain that one of their employees is responsible for this despicable act which ruined what was a really lovely time with my husband. Having said that I did enjoy my stay and would love to come back to NY again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value I've found in Manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: WhiteGatesNewYork
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January and February for $89 a night which at first I thought was a mistake! I really enjoyed the whole stay. They really work on making you have a good check-in experience. The bags were brought to the room, the check-in was quick and friendly. I enjoyed eating at the Raffles diner on site and the Starbucks in the lobby. I went to the bar on one occasion and they have a very friendly hostess. The business center is great and you can't beat the free wireless in the rooms. Only complaint is the rooms are quite small and can be noisy but for this rate I wasn't going to complain. Will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: AntoniaV
Reviews.Content: Visited New York for a business trip, employer booked me into this hotel. Now I know that New York hotel rooms have a standard of their own, but I must say this was the worst room I have had in a long time. It was absolutely tiny and, worse, cleanliness left much to be desired. The lobby of the hotel made a better impression then the room, and the service was good enough. I must say for New York the price of the room was reasonable, so the boss had a cheap deal. If I had to choose myself I would rather pay a little more for a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful....Except for the Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerNomad
Reviews.Content: Last year I spent twelve nights at the Radisson Lexington. While I was there the staff was wonderful. I was given a fantastic room,a corner room with a lovely view. The location was fabulous. The staff were friendly. It was quiet. All was well. Problem was I started to develop itching and strange bumps on my arms and legs and back that were harder and darker than mosquito bumps. In all my world travels, I had never seen or felt anything quite like it. I went to the doctor after and he said they were definitely bed bug bites! I wrote to the hotel to notify them and they wrote back saying that they "checked" and found nothing of the sort. I should add that they offered me an upgrade for my next stay, but I didnâ€™t find being eaten by bedbugs in a bigger room, to be compelling in the least and found it to be a very strange offer in light of the lack of promise to get rid of the bedbugs! Thus, needless to say, I found the manager's response to be fairly unsatisfactory, but I didnâ€™t want to get into a drawn out battle, so I let it go. I was SO relieved that I didn't bring any of those things back home, or I would have been livid! I'm writing a full year later because I am returning to New York for the same UN meeting and I was looking for my hotel. I wondered if maybe I had been wrong to tar the entire Radisson with the same brush (mostly wishful thinking because they were so nice otherwise, the location is perfect and the price was right). I was hoping that maybe it was just the person who stayed before me and the situation was isolated to that room and perhaps, in spite of their denial, the Radisson subsequently corrected the situation after my complaint,(after all what hotel would say, "Ah yes, as a matter of fact we DO have bedbugs."). So I googled "Radisson Lexington NYC" and "bedbugs" and found numerous sites where folks reported finding bedbugs at the very same hotel! :-( Thus, I felt compelled to add my experience to the chorus in hopes that they will actually admit the problem and do something about it because I would love to return! I'm glad to see through the positive reviews that some others have managed to avoid the bedbug afflicted rooms so that I know it's not a universal issue throughout the hotel. However, i don't want to roll the dice unless I know they have done large scale fumigation and laundering or whatever it takes for bedbug eradication, because two weeks is a long time to be chewed on by those critters. :-) I'm advising the same to my many friends and colleagues who are looking for lodging for the upcoming UN Commission on the Status of Women.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and value for money”
Reviews.Author: belfastbabes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Radisson Lexington from the 5-12 Feb, 2 rooms - clean - comfortable - and warm when it was -10 outside. UK guests remember Amercian double beds are a lot smaller than ours, as my son and his girlfriend found out - but no problem or hassle to change. Staff are very friendly and helpful, we were due to leave on the 10th but New York was snowed in and our flight cancelled, what could have been a stressful situation was sorted by the staff, they gave us the airline freephone number to confirm new flight, and extended our stay - we didn't have to pack or change rooms, was all sorted in few mins and we went off to enjoy our extra few days. I will certainly stay here again, and have no qualms about recommending it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Knutegutt
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. Perfect location for a NYC trip! Very friendly staff. A Starbucks conveniently located in the hotel. The rooms and hotel in general could do with a little refurbishing, but if you're looking for a decent place to sleep with a good location itâ€™s a good choice. Free internet accsess (Wired and wireless in room + free use of pc in businesscentre). Worked perfect. Nice atmosphere in the lobby, with music, bar, restaurant and a busy environment. I will definitely stay there next time I visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: ec2010
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Radisson for 6 nights in early February and we found it to be a great experience. I really have no idea why its gotten negative reviews on this site. Check in was painless and the room was exactly what we needed and not even small by most standards. I have stayed in hotels in Rome, Paris and Boston where the rooms were much much smaller. The room was cleaned daily with fresh bed linen and towels and nice toiletries, a really nice tv and great shower. We had a problem free, comfortable stay in the Radisson and were thrilled that we didnt listen to the bellyaching on this site before we booked. We will be back and will recommend to anyone going to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and relaxed ... I would go back”
Reviews.Author: Ru558ll
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Radisson Lexington. There was a genuine air of hospitality. The hotel staff were very friendly throughout - not just when they had to be. We booked a Lexington Large room. It had two double beds and two bathrooms. As mentioned in other reviews, there was a bit of city noise, but this is Manhattan! The temperature in the room was a little up and down, but other than everything was great. The rate was good and the location is great for getting round the city.

Reviews.Title: “Intimidating and discourteous”
Reviews.Author: newyorkloverforever
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and an 11-month old son. The heating in the room remained high above 70F all one night through the next morning, making us sweaty and thirsty, losing sleep. When we requested a different room the next morning, the front desk told us that the room will not be ready until 12:00 pm. We could not wait in the same room because it was too hot. We were told, however, that there was nothing they could do until 12:00 pm. The front desk also explained that there was only one technician for the entire hotel to check on heating. We waited for more than one hour for the technician. When there finally came a technician, however, there were two technicians. The technicians could not yet do their job because our baby had just fallen off into a slumber. There also came a cleaning crew knocking on the door, with our room on their list for "check-out", waking up the baby. We spoke to "Nancy", the front desk manager(a Thai woman), that we needed to move out immediately. "Nancy" became very irate for no reason, banging and knocking her computer keyboard. We almost thought she was going to break her keyboard. "Nancy" told us that there was no room available next to an ice machine area. We had given a mere indication of our preference to stay next to an ice machine area, only it was a possibility. "Nancy", however, made it sound as though we had made some absolute, "specific" request, using it as a reason for lack of availability of any room where we could move into immediately. Moreover, though she had suggested two possible rooms to move into, we had declined because we saw these rooms being of different size and capacity. "Nancy", however, kept on insisting that these rooms were of the same size. "Nancy" also laughed at us in front of everyone, as if it were ludicrous for us to desire a room next to an ice machine(we desired this for the sake of our baby). "Nancy" finally gave us a key to a temporary room for us to stay until 12:00 pm. The key did not work. She gave us a different key with no apology. Our baby was staring at her with a look of bewilderment, if not horror, all this time. This was a totally different image of "Nancy" who initially greeted us with a friendly smile and perhaps an overexcitement to see a baby arrive at the hotel. We waited in the temporary room for a new room to get ready. We called "Nancy" asking her when the room will be ready. She told us that she had just gone up there to see for herself, and the room was being cleaned at that time to be ready in no time. After 45 minutes, we went up to see the room on our own. There were cleaning staff still working in the room. They told us that they had just started to clean up the room only seconds ago. They also indicated that they could have set up our room much earlier. We moved into the new room. Heating in the new room worked ok, cooling off within one hour after turning it off. This was not consistent, however, with an explanation offered by the hotel's general manager(by the name of "Don"). "Don" had explained to us earlier that it was because the building was very old that the guests had no control over room temperature once the system gets turned on, suggesting that we therefore needed to admit outside air by opening the window. Doing so, however, would have hurt our baby. This is in the middle of winter, outside snowing. The two technicians also indicated that repair work was necessary for the room we left behind. We called hotel's customer service. "Don" called us right back regarding our call to the customer service. I was on the cellphone with my wife, when "Don" called in. "Don" asked my wife to see if I was in the room. My wife said no. "Don" then started yelling at her in a loud, angry and hostile voice. "Don" questioned her why we called the customer service. Though we merely reported our experience, "Don" accused my wife of making a request for refund of the entire cost of our stay. We did not make any such request. I heard our baby crying and screaming out loud in the back through my cellphone. My wife told "Don" that she no longer wished to have any conversation with him. "Don", however, yet kept on yelling at my wife that he will not reimburse. I also overheard "Don" repeatedly yell at my wife that she can look for another hotel to stay. My baby later vomited and had a diarrhea. Don had earlier indicated that "Nancy"'s behavior was "unacceptable". Besides a problem with heating, there was also a missed wake-up call. There was also an incident where housekeeping was not done until 5 o'clock in the afternoon, despite our request made at noontime. The bathroom door hinges squeked. A bathroom lightbulb was flickering. An alarm clock was missing. Extra towels did not come. All of these problems took hours and hours to resolve. We were exhausted and exasperated. We also felt scared. Calling me "sir" for an unnecessary number of times did not make us feel any better. No amount of apology is enough to compensate for this experience, to be rolled up in one slick word of an "inconvenience".

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: firebladebill
Reviews.Content: i dont know why this hotel gets negative comments, stayed at the radisson for 5 nights with my teenage daughter, we did have a bit of delay checking in because our room wasnt ready, but the staff on rececetion were excellent and gave me free breakfast vouchers for our stay for the inconveniance, rooms are good with free wi fi, very clean hotel great central location very friendly and helpful staff, cant wait to stay again,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Hotel and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TigerCME
Reviews.Content: Visited the Radisson whilst on a 5 day trip to New York with my girlfriend. I can't understand why people are giving all the negative reviews. The hotel is in a fantastic location for sightseeing and i found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Yes the rooms are slightly on the small side and the hotel is dated but what do you expect!?! Personally i felt that the art deco style of the hotel allows it to get away with this. We had enough room to store our clothes and suitcases (bearing in mind we also had clothes with us from a 10 day stay in Florida aswell as for the contrasting weather in NYC). The room was cleaned daily and the bed was comfy. There was alittle noise from outside but hello its a busy city centre this should be expected. If you want a clean and comfy hotel in a great location then this ticks the boxes...i would have no reservations recomending this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very good service, reasonable priced - very good value”
Reviews.Author: bitcowboy
Reviews.Content: Location: excellent, 15 minutes walk to Grand Central, 10 minutes to Empire State Building, 20 min to Times Square, right in the heart of midtown. Good and reasonably priced restaurants and bars lining Second Ave two blocks away. It's an older building, and a bit worn, but housekeeping was good and everything is clean. Great, friendly staff! Very welcoming. I got outstanding rates through the hotels own website - hotels.com would have charged me $50 more a night for the kind of room I wanted. If I ever return to NY - I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good value good service good position”
Reviews.Author: JaneyNorfolkEngland
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel suited us very well, easy walking distance to Times Sq and 5th Ave shops. The staff were helpful andpolite,and the rooms clean, and nicely decorated. We thought the coffee shop was expensive so had breakfast at the little cafe/store opposite, much better value. The room was very hot but staff responded promptly to request to turn heating down. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with small comforts”
Reviews.Author: darkgable21
Reviews.Content: I came here for a birthday weekend. I stayed in a Junior Suite which was small by my standards but comfortable. A sleep number bed made the sleep relaxing. The down part is the price of food in the hotel and the adjacent restaurant called Razzle. This place gouge you for the food so I suggest you go across the street to the Deli which has the best food I tasted in a while. The selection is vast and the value is good plus it is open 24 hours. The fitness center is well equipped but a little small. I did get a good 45 minute work out though. Very good location, around the corner from the Rockafella center and other attractions. We had a wonderful time shopping on Maddison Ave and was 10 minutes driving to Broadway when we went to see the play Fela.... Which I give 5 Stars to see......

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Experience”
Reviews.Author: LesleyW4
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled to New York City for the first time ever to see in the New Year and decided to stay at the Radisson Lexington Hotel mainly for its excellent location on the East Side Midtown Manhattan. The welcome was a warm one on a bitterly cold late December evening and we were assigned our room on the 12th floor. At first we thought we were in the wrong room as the bed was supposed to be a "king bed" but regrettably not as large as our own kingsize bed back home. The bed featured an adjustable "sleep number" mattress that could be made harder or softer depending on your individual preferences. It took a while to get used to but was quite comfortable. Despite outside temperatures of -20C - the room was hot enough without the heating on. The bathroom was on the small side but we'd experienced that in a Radisson Hotel in London. The room was equipped with a very up to date flatscreen HD TV and free internet connection. There was no mini bar or tea/coffee making facilities and the room service menu was very expensive indeed. No fluffy dressing gowns or slippers and these are a minimum requirement for a 4 star hotel in my experience. The hotel has a number of "restaurants" and we ate in the Raffles Cafe for breakfast - the service was excellent - very quick and friendly and the food was of a good standard. The staff were all very polite, friendly and helpful and easily the best part of this hotel. This hotel is great for its location for getting around the City on foot being close to all the major shops and attractions but also extremely noisy due to the police and ambulance sirens outside and the noisy plumbing inside! Choose this hotel for the location but don't expect luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away or stay awake!”
Reviews.Author: ElleTell
Reviews.Content: Booked into the Raddisson as part of a package deal, our flight was late so we arrived a day late, where they had "upgraded" us to the Honeymoon Room. This was despite our party requesting specifically twin room- as we were not a couple. The room was tiny, located over an elevator shaft, noisy and with steps throughout it (i was suffering from back trouble). to access it you needed to take two elevators. we remained there until another room was found (a twin) but the hotel suggested there were no non-smoking rooms available- until we argued with them. the room was spacious (obviously two rooms knocked into one) and the beds were very comfortable with controls. there were two bathrooms & it was equipped with TV. the bathroom was nice but there was a draft in the windows of the bathroom and also in the room itself. the wind howled and the window rattled all night long- the windows were not double glazed and noise from lexington avenue was heard all night long. the city was besieged by a snow storm & the hotel said there were no rooms available when our flight was cancelled. they did help find other hotels but only after i had cried & said i didn't know anywhere in new york. overall very poor service and the only good thing was a nice local chinese restaurant & that they found our next hotel for us!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: travellady84
Reviews.Content: The location is nice but thats the only nice thing about the actual hotel (the employees were also nice). Its run down but doesn't appear so at first glance since the clearly decorated it nicely. Yes the rooms are small (its New York), but the rooms were also dirty (sheets stained-had been washed just clearly not bleached), the bathroom had mold on the ceiling (I was on the third floor, next to the gym-a very bad choice with banging from people lifting weights), additionally the bed linens were cheap and I'm pretty sure the one extra blanket I got hadn't been washed. Mind you it was New Years so they were really busy but still! Don't stay here! I payed over 300/night for this place and if you are considering paying over 100/night DON"T DO IT!!! I honestly think it would have been better to stay by the airport and take a taxi in everyday (40-50 bucks, each way; or the bus-20 each way).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, free WIFI”
Reviews.Author: PijoMax
Reviews.Content: we stayed 8 nights during XMas. Booked executive room with only 5$ more than petite (normal) room. Room was ok in size (for Manhattan), clean, a little noisy (21st floor!). Try to book directly on nyc site (www.radissonnewyork.com) sometimes gives you better price. The only "problem" was in the bathroom, probably the phone was dismounted leaving wires there. The american breakfast included in the price was excellent. Internet WIFI free is important for me. We will stay again there (Just booked!!!)

Reviews.Title: “acceptable hotel with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: martram
Reviews.Content: Room size is definitely a topic for most New York hotels. The Radisson Lexington is not different: although I had the 2nd largest available room type (executive room, excluding the suites) â€“ it was the smallest hotel room I ever stayed in. Consequently I can only imagine how small the â€œpetiteâ€� room might be. Staying in December was certainly not the best idea. The heating next to one window could not be regulated. The air condition had to work in cooling mode to keep the temperature below 80 degrees of Fahrenheit. This set up is not only energy inefficient but also felt odd as I could feel warm air from the left and cool air from the right when lying on the bed. The service level was mixed. Check-In was smooth and fast but baggage storage after check out was unsatisfying. The hotel charges 2 dollars per bag although all other hotels I stayed do offer complimentary storage (for a reasonable time). The hotel is well located. Many tourist attractions like Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park are located within walking distance. Additionally three subway stations are within 5 blocks (Grand Central, 51st St, Lexington Ave - 53rd St). While the hotel is okay I assume that other hotels in New York may offer a better price/value ratio.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyguk78
Reviews.Content: Having read previous entries about the Radisson both my wife and I were quite concerned. However there was no need and I can only assume the Hotel checks this site or some people are never pleased. Firstly you need to bear in mind that this hotel is in New York which I have come to realise does not have the same star rating as other parts of America. The hotels are generally older buildings. Having arrived approximately 45 minutes early we were told that we could check in immediately. The whole process took less than five minutes. Hand over credit card details and collect your key. We were offered assistance with our bags but declined as the lifts were nearby. We were on the floor and easily found our room. Having stayed in New York on previous occasions we were pleasantly surprised with our room (827). It was fairly spacious, more than enough room for two even after my wife has shopped. The bathroom was spotlessly clean although possibly a bit dated but again its New York. Strange air filled beds ......... hours of entertainment........ Although not so good when you neighbours decide to inflate theirs as you can here the fan. The view from our room was limited to some back yards but lets face it how much time do you spend in the room looking out the window. People its New York go and explore, oh and shop. The temperature of the room was very comfortable on the first night and as it had snowed the following day we were concerned about how warm our room would be. This again was not a problem as an extra quilt had been placed in our room should it be required. My wife used it but I was comfortable enough without. The hotel itself is very well located for shopping and sight seeing 5th Ave, Lexington, Times Square, Central Park, everything within walking distance. Personally we did not try the food at the Hotel as there are so many fine places to eat in New York. We did however make regular use of the Starbucks. I did not find the Hotel too noisy, too hot, too cold or even to dirty like some of the other reviews mentioned. The only issues I had was the fact that it stated you could only change $100 of travellerâ€™s cheques. This was not a problem on the first morning as they happily changed more. However the next morning I spoke with a rather abrupt young girl who pointed to a sign stating that it was $100 only. I explained that it had not been a problem the previous day to which she responded that it should only have been $100. She then gave me a $100 bill. I asked if she could change it and she told me that it was all she had. Makes me wonder why I still use travellerâ€™s cheques!!!!! Due to the city being hit by the tail end of a blizzard we were concerned about our flights home. I asked the concierge who immediately logged on to the internet and checked the status of our flight. He then phoned a friend at the airport and explained to us that although the news was reporting doom and gloom this only related to domestic flights and not to international travellers. (Very helpful) all in all i found this Hotel fantastic and would happily recommend it to anyone. Rmember it's New York your room should only be for sleeping. :-))

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Very Good Price”
Reviews.Author: askforseconds
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 7:00 am and had to stow our bags in their luggage room.I had read a lot of complaints about this service, but don't agree with them. A hotel is not in the storage business and we thought $2 a bag was very reasonable to keep them alll day while we played. I only had two concerns about the stay. Our reservation said "King Size Sleep Number Bed," but in order to check in early we settled for a queen. Not a huge issue, and really not their fault. The other issue was with the included breakfast, at the next door cafe. When the staff heard you were from the hotel, they handed you a different menu with only a few choices. #1) 2 eggs, OJ, toast and your choice of breakfast meat. #2) Danish and coffee #3) Fruit cup and roll, etc. These may have filled us up, but weren't exactly what we were expecting for a vacation breakfast. Otherwise, this was a clean, affordable place to rest our heads. beautiful lobby, good staff, good concierge, free business center to print your return flight tickets. The location was excellent- on 48th, just off Lexington. Walking distance to all of midtown and 1 block to subway. Some advice: Ask that your room face 48th St., rather than 49th St. as those rooms have windows that don't actually face the street, but back up on buildings that face 49th and windows could not keep up with the roar of the HVAC from those buildings. Would rather have had the sounds of the city, horns, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy! Bring your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: dooragan
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. If I'd had to stay any longer I would have bought earplugs. I've stayed in many NYC hotels and accept that noise is part of the deal but this was excessive, even by New York standards. The problem stems from the huge airconditioning plant of the building adjacent....it is loud and never stops. Oh, and the rooms give compact a whole new meaning. They are pretty tight. Whilst every other aspect of the hotel was OK, I can't really recommend the Radisson when there are so many other better options in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Bosoxx
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to get away for the weekend and we chose NYC. Unfortunately, ended up at the Radisson. What a disaster. We could not even sit straight on the toilet because there was a radiator directly in front of the toilet. Granted, it was a cold weekend in NYC, but it felt like there was a window open in our room. Could not believe it. Moved rooms, did not help. I am usually very easy to please, and this is my first post, but did now want other people to have their vacation ruined.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Terrible hote. The staff are its only saving grace”
Reviews.Author: Galway_Man_09
Reviews.Content: The big problem here is the guest rooms - they are nothing short of deplorable for any hotel let alone a Radisson. We had to ask to change rooms as a result of wind whistleing through the windows, iron burns on the carpet, faulty safe, broken door latch, and a list i care not to remember. The room we were moved to had blistering paint in the bathroom, a carpet that was clearly infused with years of dirt (although it was vacumed well), and the bath was severely chipped. The room was really poor. It reflects very poorly on the hotel as a whole. Without a doubt, the grottiest hotel i have ever stayed in and definitely the worst Radisson i have been in. It is badly in need of updating. Its one saving grace were the staff, each of whom were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “to expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Gunne_V
Reviews.Content: Reminded me of the hotel in the Blues brother movie! LOL

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: luvegasNC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights in December on business. I made the decision because I have a tough time paying $450 + to stay the night in a bed. The hotel is supposed to be 3 stars - it isn't. The rooms are small, old/worn and dirty. The restaurant, bar and lobby are nice, but that is it. The location is very good for getting around to 5th Ave, Time Square, etc. Other than that, I guess I will just have to pay the price to stay in a reasonable hotel. I won't be staying here again when in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, was a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: corrcullen
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights. I arrived there at 1pm on a monday afternoon, checkin was not until 3pm, but they were kind enough to give us our room 2 hours early, which I really appreciated after a lot of travelling. The room was ok, nothing fancy, but adequate, and a nice big plasma TV as well, although was only really using the room for sleeping, as our visit was to explore NY afterall. The only thing I was disappointed about was, myself and my fiancee went to the bar downstairs beside the lobby, and the price of drink was outrageously expensive. 10 dollars for one small glass of white wine, and when the bill came, there was a 18% service charge on top of that. So dont drink in the bar!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service, excellent base for exploring NY”
Reviews.Author: chrisgriff6191
Reviews.Content: Our group of four, have recently returned from a four night trip to New York where we stayed at the Radisson Lexington. Like others I looked at the reviews on Trip Advisor, and was slightly concerned at the some of the negative reviews, though as the trip had already been booked, decided to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt. We caught the Newark Express coach from the airport, which was fantastic, and dropped us at Grand Central Station, a short ten minute walk from the hotel. Upon arrival, the staff were extremely helpful and courteous. We were given a room on the fourth floor and upon inspection, decided that the noise from the air conditioning unit outside may be a problem at night, therefore I asked whether we could switch which was not a problem, and was done immediately. Our second room, was far better. The rooms (dependent on which type you go for) are a cosy size though ample, with flatscreen TVs and a decent sized bathroom. The room was nicely decorated and whilst could do with a lick of paint, not shabby in the slightest. We knew we were in New York and were likely to spend very little time in our rooms. All we wanted was something clean and acceptable, which our room certainly was. At the hotel there is a Starbucks, Raflles Bar and Cafe, a Cuban restaurant, Habana Room and the Lex Lounge & Sushi Bar. I can't tell you about any of them as we never ate in the hotel. That's not to say there is anything wrong with the restaurants at all, we wanted to explore New York and often were still out around meal times so found restaurants near to where we were at the time. For breakfast we found a little cafe, Cafe Metro on Lexington Avenue that was our start point every morning. It sold omelettes, bagels etc. The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect, within easy walking distance of the major attractions, Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, 5th Avenue etc. Grand Central is 5-10 mins walk away for catching a subway train to anywhere in Manhattan, also there is a subway station at Lexington and 53rd Street. We walked to the Empire State Building on the final day, down on 34th Street and this took 20 minutes so still not a major journey I have seen some reviews talking about noise from outside and have to admit there were a few fire engines and police cars passing by on occasion, though was to be expected for New York and did not cause any problem. Most times we were completely exhausted from a day of sightseeing so rarely were awake for long when it came to going to bed!! Overall, I would absolutely recommend the Radisson Lexington to anyone thinking of travelling to New York. The location cannot be beaten, the rooms were clean and adequate, the staff were friendly and helpful and the service could not be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as they say”
Reviews.Author: plexiglasss
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about this hotel after reading some bad reviews, but it wasn't nearly as bad as I expected. The room was tiny, but that's to be expected in NYC. The bathroom was fine. All in all, it was just an average hotel room, but we really just needed a cheap place to sleep and this did the job.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - could do better though, and take your earplugs!!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelO36
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights over Thanksgiving, as part of a British Airways Holiday. The hotel is in a great location close to the centre of the City. The rooms was OK, looked as though it had recently been decorated with new HD TV. The bathroom was poor, cracked basin and old taps and the flooring needed to be replaced. It did have a good shower though. We stayed on the 11th floor and there was construction work going on 24/7 across the street. Given the proximity to Lexington Avenue and the local Fire Station and the weight of your neighbours bedroom door.....you need your earplugs!! All in all OK but could do better, it may have seen better days.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: y2ksenthil
Reviews.Content: I had a bad experience with this hotel...I am writing this review from the room where I stay. This is my second day and the room is not cleaned(including bathroom and tub)...they jus changed the bathroom towels and not the bet cover or billow covers. I can see the dust everywhere....there is kind of bad smell which sucks. I called reception, after the second attempt they took the phone and received my scold and finally they said ready to adjust some $ 50 USD...I again scold and denied the offer and canceled my booking and moving to a different hotel. If you want a pleasant stay pls dont stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Vickyxx4974xx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights upgraded to a junior suit as this included breakfast. The room was small but clean apart from the mini bar which was completely empty and filthy. The bed was lovely and comfortable. Yeh the room was small but whats the big deal its not like your in it much. The noise from the yellow cabs was constant throughout the night but your in New York for heavens sake!!! It was a great location with everything within walking distance and a Starbucks in the lobby what more could you want. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, noisy and no value for money”
Reviews.Author: Syltan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights during 5 cold October nights. We had initially booked a double, but when we arrived the very small room was dirty and what was called a double is nothing more than a large single room. We upgraded to a king for $50 a night extra which was worth it, space wise. The corner room we stayed in was located on the 7th floor, so we could hear all the noise from the streets and the subway running underneath the hotel. Every night at aroun 4.00 some bass started thumping somewhere and at aroun 7.00 the construction workers across the street started. The first 2 nights our heating was broken, so we complained about it. The heating wasn't fixed, but a duvet was on the bed when we came back to the hotel the 1st night. Finally on the 3rd night someone came and turned our heating on. Unfortunately the heating wasn't adjustable so we had to sleep with a blasting heating on one side and a cold open window on the other and woke with soar throats the next morning. On the 4th night 2 guys had to take apart half our room in order to fix the heating. It seemd someone had slammed a screw through a wire......! The bathroom and room were rather dirty. No one vacuumed during our stay so one couldn't walk without shoes. There was old dust throughout the room and the window panes had never been cleaned. The bathroom was horrible. Very small and with a very low ceiling so everything stays wet all day after a shower. It was also dirty with tiles turning yellow from old soap and a drain that didn't work properly for both the sink and bath tub. Out of the 3 phones in the room only one functioned with hick-ups. All in all we thought it was really not worth the 400 dollars a night with so many flaws. The only positive was the comfy bed and location.

Reviews.Title: “Celeb Haunt?”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterRae
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson following 4 nights in Las Vegas and had been travelling all day. We arrived at approx 9pm only to be told by the receptionist that our room wasn't ready as the previous occupant had only just departed. We had to wait an hour and were given some breakfast vouchers as compensation, I would prefered to have had something else. Our room was very nice, modern and fresh but maybe a little small. The one thing that put me off was finding long, black hairs on the bathroom floor after the maid had been in. They certainly weren't mine so after the first two days we left the don't disturb on the door and just took fresh towels from the maid. I liked the location of this hotel. I have previously been to New York and stayed near Times Square so it was nice to experience a different neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Mam's 60th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: carolshack
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Ideal location. We were given one of their executive suites on the top floor because it was my mum's 60th birthday. Absolutely huge! Must be one of the biggest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in! We had a brilliant time.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth what you pay. Is overpriced for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: AusBrenden
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 5 nights in a Junior Suite on level 13 room size was pretty good bed was comfy and you get free internet in your room but thats where the positives end. Bathrooms are old and dirty, drains dont work and are really small. The vent in the bathrooms go straight through the wall to the next rooms bathroom so you can hear everything, and i mean everything!! The heating didnt work, so requested an extra blanket but when it came up it was full of holes and torn... can hear every noise from every room above and beside you, you know everytime they shower or use the toilet... some things i dont need to hear!!. The door to the rooms must be made of paper as corridors are extremely noisy, you are woken up everytime someone is coming or going. Which brings me to my biggest problem, DO NOT STAY HERE ON ANY NIGHT THAT THE NIGHTCLUB IS OPEN you will not get any sleep. Even though i was on level 13 the bass from the music in the club thumped through the walls til 4am with no chance of sleep. I was paying $400 a night , definatly overpriced for what you get here. Would never recommend or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Kiwiabroad60
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights initially had a reasonable room on 24th floor, returned for a further 2 nights later in the week and given a shoebox sized room on the 8th which appeared to have no noise insulation and it sounded like the main drainage system for the upper floors was channeled via our plumbing system. Very poor for the money charged. Staff were fine.
